texts.es: Ángel Jonathan M. es soltero labora para UPONIC como profesor de danza y ha trabajado dos créditos con CEPRODEL, este crédito lo solicita para comprar ropa y zapatos para un evento. Agradece a CEPRODEL  por la oportunidad.
texts.en: Ángel Jonathan M. is single and works for UPONIC [The People's University of Nicaragua] as a dance instructor.  He has taken out two loans through CEPRODEL.  He is requesting this loan to buy clothes and shoes for an event.  He thanks CEPRODEL for the opportunity.

loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes for an event

loans.name: Miguel Ángel

texts.es:
Perfil del Cliente 	El señor Miguel Ángel R. S., se desempeña como guarda de seguridad devengando un salario de C$4,500.00, el señor R. se encuentra muy satisfecho con los créditos que CEPRODEL le ha brindado, cuyos créditos han sido utilizados para la ampliación de su vivienda.
Este crédito lo utilizo para compra de bloque, cemento, arena, hierro y piedrín.
texts.en: Client Profile:  Mr. Miguel Ángel R. S. works as a security guard, earning a salary of $4,500.00 córdobas [approximately $207.23 U.S. dollars].  Mr. R. has been very pleased with the previous loans CEPRODEL has offered him, which he has used to expand his house.  He will use this loan to buy cinder blocks, cement, sand, iron bars, and gravel.

loans.use: to buy cinder blocks, cement, sand, iron bars, and gravel

loans.name: Jose Santos

texts.es:
JOSE SANTOS Z., Trabaja como Obrero Polivalente en la Universidad Nacional Autonoma de Nicaragua, es padre de familia de dos hijos y estos se encuentran en edad escolar.
el prestamo lo quiere para comprar verjas para las ventanas de su casa de habitacion.
texts.en: Jose is a multipurpose worker at the national university of Nicaragua. He is a father to two school-age children. He plans to use the loan to purchase bars for his home's windows.

loans.use: Make improvements to his home by putting bars on his windows

loans.name: Aura Estela

texts.es:
Esta señora es una clienta que posee 8 años de experiencia en la venta es madre soltera y tiene a su cargo a 2 hijos los cuales dependen meramente de la actividad de negocio. 
Este crédito lo esta solicitando para la compra de mercadería para así surtir su venta ya que se aproximan los meses buenos que es en el mes de diciembre
texts.en: This woman is a borrower who has eight years of sales experience.  She is a single mother with two children under her care, who rely solely on her business.  She is requesting this loan to buy merchandise and to stock up, as she anticipates that December will be a good month for sales.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock her store

loans.name: Marlon David

texts.es:
MARLON DAVID G. B., Trabaja como Vigilante en el Centro de Formación Profesional Nicaragüense Holandés  Simón Bolívar, es padre de familia de dos hijos y estos y se encuentran en edad escolar.
el prestamo solicitado es para la compra de materialesde cnstruccion va acambiar el techo de su casa de habitacion.
texts.en: Marlon David G. B. works as a watchman at the Simón Bolivar Nicaraguan-Dutch Center for Professional Development.  He is the father of a family with two school-age children.  He is requesting this loan to purchase construction materials to replace the roof on his house.

loans.use: to improve his home by replacing the roof

loans.name: Víctor Manuel

texts.es:
El Señor Víctor Manuel T. A.,  inicia su negocio como una herencia con un capital de C$ 20,000.00 producto de ahorros y préstamos para el sustento de su familia.
Este crédito fue utilizado para  compra de productos como cuero y cromo.
El señor T. se siente muy satisfecho y agradecido con los créditos que CEPRODEL le ha brindado ya que ha podido aumentar sus ganancias y ha logrado construir su vivienda.
texts.en:
Mr. Víctor Manuel T. A. started his tannery business when he inherited it.  He started with $20,000 córdobas of capital -- which came from savings and loans -- in order to support his family.  This loan will be used to buy products like animal hides and chromium.
Mr. T. feels very satisfied and grateful for the loans that CEPRODEL has offered him, as they have made it possible for him to increase his earnings and to build his home.

loans.use: to buy animal hides and chromium

loans.name: Wallace Enrique

texts.es: El Sr. Wallace Enrique A. R. él es trabajador activo de la Alcaldía Municipal San Rafael del Sur desempeñándose como recaudador de fondos tiene  dos años de trabajar para esta institución. Ha tenido  dos  créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno lo ha realizado para la compra de materiales de construcción para ampliar y mejorar su casa de habitación y este lo está solicitando para gastos de la universidad, los cuales los créditos con ceprodel le ha beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esta manera el ha  mejorado su condición de vida de él y su familia.
texts.en: Mr. Wallace Enrique A. R. works for the municipal government of San Rafael del Sur as a finance collector.  He has worked for the municipality for two years.  He has taken out two loans through CEPRODEL, and has used each one to buy construction materials to expand and improve his home.  This time, he is requesting a loan for university expenses.  His past CEPRODEL loans have been of great benefit because they allowed him to improve his and his family's quality of life.

loans.use: university expenses

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to make home improvements; to buy construction materials like cement, steel, and gravel

loans.name: Arely Sugey

texts.es:
Esta clienta e madre soltera y tiene a cargo a 1 hijo el cual mantiene con le negocio de la venta de sopa y quien ya tiene 5 años de experiencia en este negocio 
Este crédito los esta solicitando para la compra de materia prima para la venta de comida ya que atiende a los trabajadores de la alcaldía  
Por lo que le interesa mucho agrandar el negocio por la buena demanda que tiene
texts.en: This borrower is a single mother with one son, who runs a business selling soup and has 5 years of experience doing so.  She is requesting this loan to buy ingredients for the food she sells to workers in her village.  She is very interesting in expanding her business because she has a lot of demand.

loans.use: to buy staple grains

loans.name: Lucrecia Miriam

texts.es:
Perfil del Cliente 	La Señora Lucrecia Miriam P., inicia con venta de chinela en el mercado central con un capital de C$8,000.00 producto de ahorro, actualmente se dedica a la venta de electrodomésticos, sus compras las realizas en Managua. 

Este crédito fue utilizado para compra de Compra de adornos navideños, juguetes y controles  para televisor, equipos DVD. 

La Señora P., es madre de tres hijos de los cuales solo una tiene a su cargo, ella está contenta con los créditos que le ha brindado CEPRODEL    por que ha logrado a incrementar su inventario donde ha obtenido buenas ganancias y así mejorado su nivel de vida familiar.
texts.en:
Ms. Lucrecia Miriam P. got her start selling slippers in the central market with $8,000 córdobas [approximately $368 USD] in savings.  Now, she sells home electronics.  She makes her purchases in Managua.

She is using this loan to buy Christmas decorations, toys, TV remote controls, and DVD sets.

Ms. P. is the mother of three children, though only one is still in her care.  She is pleased with the loans that CEPRODEL has offered her previously, as they have allowed her to increase her inventory, earning good profits and thereby improving her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy Christmas decorations, toys, and remote controls

loans.name: Marlon Jose

texts.es:
MARLON JOSE J. B., Trabajo como  Conductor de la Universidad Nacional de Ingeniería. ES padre de familia de dos hijos y uno se encuentra en edad escolar, ha trabajado cuatro prestamo con ceprodel y estos han sido pra el mejoramiento de su vivienda.
el prestamo solicitado es para la compra de materiales de construccion para construir un cuarto en su casa de habitacion.
texts.en: Marlon Jose J. B. works as a driver at the National Engineering Univerity.  He is the father of a family with two children, one of which is school-age.  He has worked with CEPRODEL to receive four loans, which have all been used to make home improvements.  He is requesting this loan to buy construction materials to build a room onto his house.

loans.use: to make home improvements; to build a room

loans.name: Leandro Ariel

texts.es: El señor Leandro Ariel R. D. es trabajador de ESSO ON THE RUN se desempeña como Cajero desde hace 03 años es primer vez que solicita credito con CEPRODEL para compra de medicamentos que no le cubre el seguro social, vive con sus padres es soltero y no tiene hijos.
texts.en: Mr. Leandro Ariel R. D. has worked as a cashier at Esso On the Run for three years.  This is the first time that he is requesting a loan through CEPRODEL, and he is doing so in order to purchase medications that are not covered by social security.  He lives with his parents and he is single with no children.

loans.use: to buy medications that are not covered by social security

loans.name: Dolores De La Concepción

texts.es:
Perfil del Cliente 	La Señora Dolores de la Concepción C. L., inicia realizando la compra en el mercado la terminal desde 6 am, luego se traslada a su puesto de venta   a ofertar sus productos.

Este crédito fue utilizado para compra de Frutas, Golosinas, y Cigarros

La Señora C. L., con los créditos que le ha brindado CEPRODEL  se siente muy conforme por que ha logrado a incrementar su negocio y así ha  mejorado su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ms. Dolores de la Concepción C. L. starts at 6 a.m., making purchases at the "La Terminal" market.  Then, she goes to her stand where she sells her products.

She will use this loan to purchase fruit, candy, and cigarettes.

Thanks to previous loans offered by CEPRODEL, Ms. C. L. feels very satisfied because she has been able to grow her business and therefore has improved her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fruit, candy, and cigarettes

loans.name: Juan Jose

texts.es: JUAN JOSE B. S., Trabaja como Vigilante Centro de Formación Profesional Nicaragüense Holandés Simón Bolívar. el prestamo solicitado es para comprar materiales de construccion para  la construccion dde un muro en la parte de atras del patio de su casa de habitacion.
texts.en: Juan Jose B. S. works as a watchman at the Simón Bolívar Nicaragua-Holland Center for Professional Development.  He is requesting this loan to buy construction materials for building a wall behind his house's patio.

loans.use: to make home improvements and to cover some personal expenses

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to have his eyesight checked and to buy glasses

loans.name: Amparo De Jesús González

texts.es:
La Señora Amparo de Jesús G., inicia realizando su compra en el mercado la terminal desde 6 am, luego se traslada a su puesto de venta   ubicado en la esquina de INISER a ofertar sus productos y finaliza a las 4 pm.

Este crédito fue utilizado para compra de manzanas, uvas Frutas, Golosinas, y Cigarros ya que se aproxima la navidad.

La Señora G., con los créditos que le ha brindado CEPRODEL  se siente muy conforme por que ha logrado a incrementar su negocio y con sus ganancias ha realizado mejora en  su vivienda.
texts.en:
Ms. Amparo de Jesús G. starts at 6 a.m., making her purchases at the La Terminal market.  Then she goes to her sales booth, which is located on the same corner as INISER [Nicaraguan Institute of Insurance and Reinsurance], and offers her products until she finishes at 4 p.m.

This loan is being used to buy apples, grapes, other fruits, and cigarettes, since Christmas is approaching.

Ms. G. feels very satisfied with the loans that CEPRODEL has offered her, as they have made it possible for her to grow her business.  She has used her earnings to make improvements to her home.

loans.use: to buy apples, grapes, other fruits, candy, and cigarettes

loans.name: Victorino Mercedes

texts.es:
VICTORINO MERCEDES, 5.	El trabaja como Vigilante en el del Centro de Formación Profesional Nicaragüense Holandés Simón Bolívar.
es padre de familia de dos hijos y estos se encuentran en edad escolar, el prestamos solicitado es para invertir en algunas mejoras que va hacerle a su casa de habitacion.
texts.en:
Victorino Mercedes, 5, works as a watchman at the Simón Bolívar Nicaraguan-Dutch Center for Professional Development.

He is the father of a family with two school-age children.  He will use the requested loan to invest in some improvements that he would like to make to his home.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to replace the roof on his house

loans.name: René Antonio

texts.es: El Sr. René Antonio L. G. él es trabajador activo de la empresa Instituto Nicaragüense de Turismo S.A desempeñándose como guarda de seguridad tiene  seis   años de trabajar para esta institución, es casado actualmente. Ha tenido  cuatro créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno lo ha realizado para la compra de materiales de construcción para ampliar y mejorar su casa de habitación, los cuales los créditos con ceprodel le ha beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esta manera él ha  mejorado su condición de vida de él y su familia.
texts.en: Mr. René Antonio L. G. works as a security guard at the Nicaraguan Institute of Tourism, S.A.  He has worked there for six years and he is currently married.  He has had four loans through CEPRODEL and he has used each one to buy construction materials to expand and improve his home.  These CEPRODEL loans have been of great benefit to him, as they have been the means for him to improve his and his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy construction materials: sand, cement, rock, gravel, etc.

loans.name: Maria Benita

texts.es:
ESTA CLIENTA ES MADRE SOLTERA Y TIENE A SU CARGO  HIJOS LOS CUALES A CRIADO CON EL ESFUERZO DE SU TRABAJO CON LA VENTA DE LECHE POR LAS MAÑANA Y LA VENTA DE ROPA AMBULANTE .
EL CREDITO LO ESTA SOLICITANDO PARA LA COMPRA DE MERCADERIA YA QUE SE APROXIMA LA TEMPORA ALTA QUE ES LA DE NAVIDA Y QUIERE SURTIR SU MERCADERIA TAMBIEN PARA AUMENTAR LA ENTA DE LECHE Y SUS DERIBADOS COMO QUESO Y CUAJADA.
texts.en: Maria is a single mother with children under her care whom she has worked hard to raise thanks to her jobs selling milk in the mornings and also selling clothing. She is requesting the loan to purchase supplies because her busy season, Christmastime, is approaching and she wants to stock up on merchandise. She also plans to expand her milk sales to other dairy products like cheese and curds.

loans.use: Purchase clothing and milk products

loans.name: Darwin Alí

texts.es: Darwin H. N. es empleado de UPONIC  desempeñandose como conductor, es casado con dos personas a su cargo. El primer desembolso con CEPRODEL solicita para compra de cin y perlin para reparar el techo de su vivienda. Agradece a CEPRODEL por su pronta respuesta.
texts.en: Darwin works as a driver from a Nicaraguan university. He is married and has two children under his care. He is requesting his first loan with Kiva partner CEPRODEL to purchase zinc roofing and beams to repair the roof of his home. He is grateful to CEPRODEL for its prompt response.

loans.use: Buy zinc roofing and beams to fix his home's roof

loans.name: Julia Lily

texts.es:
ESTA CLIENTA ES UNA MADRE QUE DESPUES DEL FALLECIMIENTO DE SU ESPOSO SE HIZO CARGO DEL NEGOCIO Y YA LLEVA UN BUEN TIEMPO CON EL NEGOCIO QUE ES VENTA DE MADERA ASERRADA 
ESTE CREDITO LO ESTA SOLICITANDO PARA LA COMPRA DE MADERA ASERRADA PARA AUMENTAR LOS INGRESOS DEL NEGOCIO
texts.en: This borrower is a woman who, after the death of her husband, took charge of his business.  She is now doing well with the business, which is selling sawed wood.  She is requesting this loan to purchase sawed wood, in order to increase profits for her business.

loans.use: to buy sawed wood

loans.name: Salvadora Yolanda

texts.es:
La Señora Salvadora Yolanda M., inicia ambulante con un capital de C$1,000.00 producto de aporte de su esposo actualmente tiene una pulpería en su casa, una parte de productos lo compra a proveedores que la visitan a su casa y otra parte en el mercado la terminal. 

Este crédito fue utilizado para compra de Compra de gaseosas, cosméticos, granos básicos y golosinas. La Señora M., con los créditos que le ha brindado CEPRODEL  se siente muy agradecido  por que ha logrado a incrementar su inventario donde ha obtenido buenas ganancias y así mejorado su nivel de vida.
texts.en: Ms. Salvadora Yolanda M. started as an itinerant vendor with just $1,000 córdobas [approximately $46 USD] of capital. Thanks to input from her husband, she now has a pulpería [small grocery store] in her house. She buys some of her products from suppliers who come to her house, and others from the La Terminal market. She is using this loan to buy soft drinks, cosmetics, staple grains, and candies. Ms. M. feels very grateful for the loans CEPRODEL has offered her, as they have allowed her to increase her inventory, earn good profits, and therefore improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, cosmetics, staple grains, and candies

loans.name: Flor De María

texts.es:
La Señora Flor de María S. H.,  inicia sus ventas de las 6 am ofertando su producto en su tramo y finaliza sus labores a las 12 pm, inició su negocio como vendedora ambulante en los tres mercados de la ciudad de león (Mercado Central, La Estación y la Terminal) con un capital de trabajo de C$ 1,000.00 producto de aporte de su mamá. Este crédito fue utilizado para  compra de productos como blusas, toallas, ropa interior, camisolas, tobilleras, etc.
La señora S. se siente muy satisfecha y agradecida con los créditos que CEPRODEL le ha brindado ya que ha incrementado su inventario ofertando diferentes productos y obteniendo mayores ganancias y así ha logrado realiza las compras de sus enseres del hogar.
texts.en:
Ms. Flor de María S. H. starts her sales at 6 AM, offering her products at her stand and finishing work at 12 PM.  She started her business as an itinerant vendor at the three markets in León (Central Market, The Station, and The Terminal), with $1,000 córdobas [approximately $46 USD] of capital provided by her mother.

She is using this loan to buy products like blouses, towels, undergarments, camisoles, socks, etc.  Ms. S. feels very satisfied and grateful for the loans that CEPRODEL has offered her, as she has increased her inventory to offer different products.  She has earned better profits and been able to purchase certain items for her household.

loans.use: to buy undergarments, shirts, cute clothes, women's blouses, and pants

loans.name: Gloria Isabel

texts.es: La Sra. Gloria Isabel G. A. ella se dedica al negocio de pulpería venta de granos básico, gaseosa, golosinas  tiene  un año de dedicarse a esta actividad, es Acompañada actualmente tiene un hijo en edad escolar. Ha tenido  dos créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno lo ha realizado para la compra de granos básico, golosinas, gaseosa para ampliarle a su negocio en mercadería, los cuales los créditos con ceprodel le ha beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esta manera ella ha  mejorado su condición de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en: Ms. Gloria Isabel G. A. runs a pulpería [small grocery store] where she sells basic grains, soft drinks, and candy. She has been doing this for a year. She is in a relationship and has one school-age child. She has had two loans through CEPRODEL and used both to purchase basic grains, candies, and soft drinks to expand the merchandise for her business. These CEPRODEL loans have been of great benefit to her, as they have been the means by which she has improved her and her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, soft drinks, chicken, and meat

loans.name: Martha Magdalena

texts.es:
La Señora Martha Magdalena S. H.,  inicia como vendedora ambulante entregando mercancía a los demás comerciantes fijos, con un capital de C$ 1,000.00 producto de ahorros. La señora S. viaja 2 veces por semana a Chinandega a comprar nueva mercadería.
Este crédito fue utilizado para  compra de productos como chinelas, zapatos, etc.
La señora Martínez se siente muy satisfecha y agradecía con los créditos que CEPRODEL le ha podido brindar ya que ha podido surtir su negocio con nuevos productos y así poder tener mayor clientela.
texts.en:
Mrs. Martha Magdalena S. H. started as a street vendor selling merchandise to stores with a capital of C$1.000.00 from her savings. She travels twice a week to Chinandega to buy new merchandise. 

This loan will be used to buy items like slippers and shoes. Mrs. Martinez has been very grateful and satisfied with the loans given by CEPRODEL because they have allowed her to stock her business with new items which increase her clientele.

loans.use: Purchase of slippers and shoes

loans.name: Brillo De Luna Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama BRILLO DE LUNA, porque quieren brillar como la luna, se encuentra ubicado en el Estado de México.  El grupo está conformado por  12  integrantes. Josefina A. Ríos es integrante del grupo. Tiene 29 años, estudió secundaria, es comerciante y tiene en total 2 hijos varones.  Ella se dedica a vender productos de belleza. Solicita el préstamo para surtirse más mercancía para esta temporada. Sus clientas son vecinas de la misma comunidad y conocidas. Al momento de solicitar este préstamo se siente ilusionada.   Quiere este crédito para poder hacer crecer sus ventas y tener más ingresos personales.   También espera poder apoyar en los ingresos de su hogar y estudios de sus hijos ya que son lo más importante para ella.
texts.en:
This group, called "Brillo de Luna" [Moon’s Shine] because they want to shine like the moon, is situated in Mexico State. The group is made up of twelve members and Josefina A. R. is one of them. She is 29 years old, finished high school, is a merchant and has two sons. She sells beauty products and requests the loan to buy more merchandise for this season of the year. Her costumers are neighbors of the same community and acquaintances. 

She is very hopeful now requesting this loan. She wants it to increase her sales and personal income. She also hopes to support her household income and the schooling of her children who are most important to her.

loans.use: To purchase seasonal merchandise

loans.name: José Leonel

texts.es: El Sr. José Leonel H. H. él se dedica a la actividad de siembra de granos como maíz, frijoles tiene  doce   año de dedicarse a actividad, es casado actualmente. Ha tenido  dos créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno lo ha hecho para preparar el terreno y comprar los materiales  para la siembra,   los créditos con ceprodel le ha beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esta manera él ha  mejorado su condición de vida de él y su familia.
texts.en: Mr. José Leonel H. H. plants crops like corn and beans.  He has been doing this type of work for 12 years and he is married.  He has had two loans through CEPRODEL, and he has used both to prepare his land and to buy supplies for planting.  The CEPRODEL loans have been of great benefit to him, as they are the means by which he has improved his and his family's standard of living.

loans.use: for agricultural expenses and to buy supplies

loans.name: María Lourdes

texts.es:
La Señora María Lourdes L. T., inicia su negocio a orilla del mercado central con un capital de C$10,000.00 ella también trabaja por la mañana de docente y su esposo en ese lapso atiende el negocio y por la tarde ella se integra también al negocio realizando.

Este crédito fue utilizado para compra de retratera, bolsos, lámparas de noche, juguetes. manzanas, ya que se aproxima la navidad.
La Señora L. T., con los créditos que le ha brindado CEPRODEL  se siente muy conforme por que ha logrado a incrementar su inventario donde ha obtenido buenas ganancias y así mejorado su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Mrs. María Lourdes started her business on the outskirts of the central market with C$10,000 of capital. She also works in the morning as a teacher. When she works in the morning, her husband takes care of her business. In the afternoon María Lourdes joins her husband at her business.
This loan will be used to buy picture frames, bags, nightlights, toys and apples for the approaching Christmas holiday.
Mrs. María Lourdes is very happy with the opportunity that CEPRODEL provides. She would like to improve her inventory in order to increase her earnings and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: She will buy picture frames, bags, nightlights and toys.

loans.name: Idesh

texts.en: Borrower Idesh is 42 years old and the father of 2 children. He lives with his wife in a small wooden house at his father’s place in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His wife works at a pawnshop as a manage.r His daughter lives separately. His son Banzragch got injured on his head 2 years ago and therefore should go to seek medical treatment in Korea. He has been operating a taxi service in the city for many years. He enjoys transporting people and transported his car to Mongolia when he was in Korea recently. With his earnings he purchased his daughter a Ger Mongolian nomadic tent. He is an energetic and enthusiastic person and hopes his son gets better and is able to attend university in Korea. He says: "I would like to be financially able to provide a good education and other necessary expenses for my children". With the loan he is requesting he plans to cover his son’s medical cost and to increase his business.

loans.use: To cover medical costs for his son

loans.name: René

texts.es: El Sr. René S. C. es trabajador Activo para el contratista Jairo Vargas Mendoza desempeñándose como guarda de seguridad tiene cuatro  años de trabajar para esta institución es casado actualmente tiene dos niños en edad escolar. Ha tenido  cuatro  créditos con CEPRODEL y cada  uno los ha  realizado para la compra de materiales de construcción para  ampliar y mejorar su casa de habitación, de cuales  los créditos con ceprodel le han beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esta manera el ha  mejorado su condición de vida de él y su familia.
texts.en: Mr. Rene currently works as a security guard for a contractor named Jairo Vargas Mendoza. He has been working there for the past four years. He is married with two school-aged children. He has had four loans with CEPRODEL. Each loan he has used to buy construction materials in order to enlarge and improve his house. The loans from CEPRODEL have helped him a lot. The loans have improved the quality of life for himself and his family.

loans.use: He will buy construction materials such as sand, cement, quarry stone, pebbles, etc.

loans.name: San Juditas Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama San Juditas, porque es el santo más idolatrado por la comunidad. El grupo se encuentra en el Estado de Puebla en México.  Está conformado por 10 integrantes.María D. C., es  integrante   del grupo. Tiene 64 años, estudió hasta el tercer año de primaria, es comerciante y tiene en total 4 hijos: 2 mujeres y 2 varones, ellos ya no dependen económicamente de ella, pero ella es su único sostén económico para sí misma.  María se dedica a la engorda y venta de guajolotes  (aves  de corral) actividad que inició hace 8 años. Solicita el préstamo para la compra de alimento y material para poder construir un pequeño corral. Para María esta es una actividad que puede desempeñar de acuerdo a su edad.
texts.en:
This group is called San Juditas, after the most idolized saint in their community.  The group is located in Puebla state in Mexico.  It is made up of 10 members.  María D.C. is one group member.  She is 64 years old, studied through the third year of primary school, is a businesswoman, and has four children total: two females and two males.  They do not depend on her economically anymore, but she is the only one providing for herself.

María works fattening and selling turkeys (poultry), which she started doing eight years ago.  She is requesting a loan to buy feed and for materials to build a small corral.  For María, this is a type of work that she is able to do at her age.

loans.use: to buy feed for turkeys and materials to build a small corral

loans.name: Silvano Aquiles

texts.es: El Sr. Silvano Aquiles A. G. es trabajador Activo para el Hotel Barceló Monte limar desempeñándose como operario  tiene trece  años de trabajar para esta institución, es acompañado actualmente. Ha tenido  cuatro  créditos con CEPRODEL y cada  uno los ha  realizado para la compra de materiales de construcción para  ampliar y mejorar su casa de habitación, de cuales  los créditos con ceprodel le han beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esta manera el ha  mejorado su condición de vida de él y su familia.
texts.en: Mr. Silvano is a worker at the Hotel Barceló Monte. He works as an operator. He has been working here for the past thirteen years. He is training people now. He has had four loans with CEPRODEL. Each loan he has used to buy construction materials to be used to enlarge and improve his house. He has benefited greatly from the loans from CEPRODEL. They have improved the quality of life for him and his family

loans.use: He will buy construction materials such as sand, cement, quarry stone, pebbles, etc.

loans.name: Byambasuren

texts.en: Byambasuren A. is 27 years old and lives with his mother, wife and two young sons in an apartment in the Songinohairhan district of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia’s capital city. His wife is currently unemployed and takes care of their two young sons. Byambasuren operates a taxi service in the city. He has been driving a taxi since 2008 and has built a stable operation. He is planning to enlarge and decorate his garage where a cafe managed by his mother and wife will be operated. Starting to operate his second business will enable him to increase his business earnings and improve his family's standard of living. Byambasuren is a hardworking man and is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan in order to construct his garage into a cafe.

loans.use: To construct his garage into a cafe

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of construction materials: sand, cement, stone, gravel, blocks, etc.

loans.name: Enhtur

texts.en: Enhtur B. is 27 years old, married, and has one child. The family lives in their own ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic home tent, in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His wife works as a cashier in the library. Enhtur operates and manages a traditional shoe-making business. He has been making traditional boots called Buriad and sells them to the wholesale buyers at the Narantuul, the largest market in the city. He started his business in 2002 and has gained significant experience over the years.  One day, he would like to own her own workplace. Enhtur is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more supplies and materials for his shoe-making business.

loans.use: To purchase more supplies and materials for his shoe-making business

loans.name: Muñequitas Group

texts.es: El grupo se llama “Muñequitas”,  se encuentra ubicado en el Estado de México, está conformado por 12 integrantes.En el grupo se encuentra la Sra. María Judith J.,   de 48 años de edad. La clienta tiene una papelería desde 1 año; nos platica que antes de abrir su negocio trabajaba en una biblioteca; ella sólo estudió la secundaria pero eso no le ha impedido cumplir el sueño de cualquier madre, el poder brindarle o sus hijos la  oportunidad de salir adelante, su máxima ilusión es que su hijo tenga una carrera universitaria, ya que en la localidad donde viven es común que los jóvenes se dediquen a las labores mineras, a la elaboración de tabique o al campo. Con el crédito que la institución le ha otorgado va a surtir su papelería para poder incrementar sus ingresos y de esta manera fortalecer su negocio.
texts.en: This group is called “Muñequitas” ["Little Dolls"] and is located in the state of Mexico.  The group has 12 members, including Ms. María Judith J., who is 48 years old.  She has run a paper goods store for one year. She explains that before opening her business, she worked in a library.  María only studied through secondary school, but this has not prevented her from achieving her dream of being a mother with the ability to offer her children the opportunity to get ahead.  Her greatest dream is that her son will get a university education, as in the area where they live, it is common that young people become miners, brick makers, or work in the fields.  With the loan offered to her by CrediComun and Kiva, she is going to stock her paper store so she can increase her earnings and therefore strengthen her business.

loans.use: to stock her paper goods store

loans.name: Henchbish

texts.en:
Henchbish A. is 42 years old and lives with her husband and three children in Tuv province in central Mongolia. She and family live together in a 'ger', which is a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. Her son attends a local secondary school while her two daughters go to kindergarten. Her husband works privately in the construction field. 

Henchbish operates a 'ger' bracing supply production business. She produces ropes, belts, and straps used in ger construction. She started her business in 2005 and has gained much experience as a maker of these products over the years. For the future, she is planning to have her own workplace. Over the many years of owing this business, she has built a stable and successful operation and her earnings have enabled her to provide for her family.

 Henchbish is a modest, honest and hardworking person. She is a diligent worker and hopes to continue to grow her business and improve her family's standard of living. She is requesting a 400,000 MNT loan to purchase horse manes and tails in order to produce ropes and straps.

loans.use: To purchase horse manes and tails

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of construction materials: sand, cement, stone, gravel, blocks, etc.

loans.name: Myagmardorj

texts.en:
Myagmardorj L.  lives with his wife and teenage daughter in an apartment in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His wife works in a hotel while his only daughter attends a local high school.  The family rents an apartment with monthly fees of 250,000 MNT and pays the rent every 6 months. Myagmardorj used to work in his brother's vacuum window making company and in 2004, he decided to operate his own window-making business with the help of his friend, in a rented workplace, renting the necessary equipment. 

After years of operation, they were able to buy their own tools and equipment and run their business which however stopped in 2009 due to high rental cost. After that, Myagmardorj  purchased a container space in Narantuul, the biggest market in the city, where he operates a luggage-storing business. He has built up a stable and successful operation within this short period. Over the year of operation, his earnings have enabled him to live in a rented apartment after previously living in a 'ger', a traditional Mongolian nomadic home tent, in his brother's yard. 

Myagmardorj is a modest and helpful man . He is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to expand his business type by returning to his previous vacuum window-producing business.

loans.use: To return his vacuum window-producing business

loans.name: José Walter

texts.es: El Sr. José Walter L. T. es trabajador Activo para el Hospital Carlos Roberto Huembé de la policía nacional   desempeñándose como guarda de seguridad tiene cuatro  años de trabajar para esta institución, es casado actualmente tiene un hijo en edad escolar. Ha tenido  dos  créditos con CEPRODEL y cada  uno los ha  realizado para la compra de materiales de construcción para  ampliar y mejorar su casa de habitación, de cuales  los créditos con ceprodel le han beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esta manera el ha  mejorado su condición de vida de él y su familia.
texts.en: José Walter L. T. is an active worker for the Carlos Roberto Huembé Hospital for the national police working as a security guard.  He has worked for this institution for four years.  He is currently married with a school-age son.  He has had two CEPRODEL loans and used both to buy construction materials to expand and improve his home.  These CEPRODEL loans have benefited him greatly and in this way he has improved his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials: sand, cement, blocks, etc.

loans.name: Erdenepurev

texts.en:
Erdenepurev D. is 53 years old and lives with her husband and three children in Huvsgul province, Mongolia. She and her family live together in a traditional Mongolian tent home called a 'ger'. Her daughter and son, aged 20 and 24, attend university. Erdenepurev operates a handicraft-making business in her town with the help of her husband. She produces a variety of felt products and souvenirs. She has been engaged this business since 2006 after working as a salesperson in a local store. 

Erdenepurev is a modest and hardworking woman who works hard to pay her children's tuition fees. She is requesting a 500,000 MNT loan to purchase more materials for her handicraft production in order to increase her business.

loans.use: To purchase more materials to make her crafts

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es: La  Sra. Maribel C. H. es trabajadora Activa para el Hotel Barceló Monte limar   desempeñándose como mesera de restaurante tiene siete años de trabajar para esta institución. Ha tenido  dos  créditos con CEPRODEL y cada  uno los ha  realizado para la compra de materiales de construcción para  ampliar y mejorar su casa de habitación, de cuales  los créditos con ceprodel le han beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esta manera ella ha  mejorado su condición de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en: Maribel C. H. is an active worker for the Barceló Monte Limar Hotel as a restaurant waitress.  She has worked there for seven years.  She has had two CEPRODEL loans and has used both to buy construction materials to expand and improve her home.  These loans with CEPRODEL have greatly benefited her and in this way she has improved her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials: sand, cement, blocks, etc.

loans.name: Lhagva

texts.en:
Lhagva C. is 30 years old and lives with his wife and two children in the Hovd province of Mongolia. He and his family live together in a 'ger', a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His 4-year-old son attends a local kindergarten while his infant son stays at home. 

Lhagva and his wife work together in their retail clothing business. They began this business in 2008 and have since built up a stable and successful operation. Within the short period of operation, Lhagva has managed to increase his working capital and his earnings have enabled him to buy a small plot of land for his family. 

For the future, he plans to buy a new truck with his business profits and start operating a transportation business to supplement his earnings. Lhagva is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more winter clothing items to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more winter clothing items for resale

loans.name: Adonis De Jesús

texts.es: El Sr. Adonis de Jesús J. M. es trabajador Activo para la Empresa ULTRA DE NICARAGUA S.A  desempeñándose como guarda de seguridad tiene dos  años de trabajar para esta empresa, es casado actualmente tiene dos hijo en edad escolar. Ha tenido  dos  créditos con CEPRODEL y cada  uno los ha  realizado para la compra de materiales de construcción para  ampliar y mejorar su casa de habitación y este lo esta solicitando para ampliarle a su negocio de recarga de teléfono movistar y claro, de cuales  los créditos con ceprodel le han beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esta manera el ha  mejorado su condición de vida de él y su familia.
texts.en:
Sr. Adonis de Jesús J. M. is an active employee of a company called Ultra de Nicaragua, S.A., where he has been working as a security guard for the past two years. He is married and currently has two school age children. Adonis has had two loan with CEPRODEL that were used to buy construction materials to expand and improve his home. With the loan he is currently requesting, he wants to expand his business of selling rechargeable phone cards from Movistar and Claro.

The loans from CEPRODEL have been a great benefit and will help him improve the living conditions for himself and his family.

loans.use: Operating capital for his rechargeable phone card business

loans.name: Sodnomdamba

texts.en:
Sodnomdamba A. is 30 years old and lives with her husband and child in Arhangai province, Mongolia. She and her family live together in a 'ger', a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. Her husband works as a fireman in a local company. Sodnomdamba sells a variety of socks inside the local market. She started her business in 2009 with a initial capital of 60,000 MNT and has gained a good reputation in her local community. She has found success with her new business and has stable earnings.

Today, her working capital exceeds 2,500,000 MNT. Sodnomdamba hopes to continue growing her business and have her own shop in the future. She is a modest woman. She is requesting a 300,000 MNT loan to purchase more inventory in order to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory

loans.name: Catalina Del Carmen

texts.es: La Sra. Catalina del Carmen E. G. es trabajadora Activa para el Colegio Público “José Domingo E.  de la localidad Gutiérrez Norte” desempeñándose como Maestra de Educación Primaria tiene Quince  años de trabajar para esta institución, es casada actualmente tiene dos hijos en edad escolar. Ha tenido  seis   créditos con CEPRODEL y cada  uno los ha  realizado para la compra de materiales de construcción para  ampliar y mejorar su casa de habitación, de cuales  los créditos con ceprodel le han beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esta manera ella ha  mejorado su condición de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Sra. Catalina del Carmen E. G. is an active employee of the José Domingo E. Public School in the town of Gutiérrez Norte. She has worked as an elementary school teacher at this institution for 15 years. Catalina is married and currently has two school age children.

She has received six loans from CEPRODEL. Each one was used to buy construction materials in order to expand and improve her home. The loans from CEPRODEL have been a great benefit since they have helped her improve the living conditions for herself and her family.

loans.use: Purchase construction materials such as sand, cement, stone, blocks, tiles, etc.

loans.name: Horolsuren

texts.en:
Horolsuren J. is 59 years old and lives with son in their own apartment in the Baganuur, one of the remote district of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolian capital city.  

Horolsuren operates a clothing retail business in a local community. She began her business in 2003 selling only Mongolian goods and has since expanded her business by selling a variety of sport clothing items. Her business has been quite successful and has allowed her to help buy an apartment for her son. She hopes to keep growing her business and have one more stall in the future. 

Horolsuren is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan in order to import a large amount of sport clothes for children at the age of 6 from China to sell at the local schools.

loans.use: To import sport clothes for resale

loans.name: Munhtur

texts.en:
Munhtur D., a 38-year-old widow, lives with her four children, who range in age from 10 and 19, in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent home, in Baganuur, a district of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia's capital city. Munhtur's husband passed away a year ago and she works hard to raise her children alone. Her oldest daughter attends university, while the other three children are students as well.

Munhtur sells adult and children's clothing in her community, a business she started recently after having operated a meat sales business in a rented stall for three years. Hoping to ensure the stable operation operation of her new business, she is requesting a 500,000 MNT loan to import winter boots from Erlian, China's border city.

A modest and hardworking person, Munhtur says, " My only wish is to provide a good educational background for all my children. "

loans.use: To import winter boots

loans.name: Munhbayar

texts.en:
Munhbayar N. is 40 years old and lives with her husband and three children in Baganuur, a district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia.  Her two daughters both attend a local secondary school while her youngest son is in kindergarten. Her husband works in the construction field. 

Munhbayar currently operates a clothing retail business out of a rented stall at the local market. She started her clothing business in 2004 and has gained much experience. Her business is the main income source for her family. For the future, Munhbayar hopes to expand her business further by having one more stall. She is a hardworking and open-minded person. She is requesting a 400,000 MNT loan to purchase winter adult clothing items and shoes for her trading business.

loans.use: To purchase winter clothes and shoes for resale

loans.name: Tsedensambuu

texts.en: Tsedensambuu T. is 31 years old and lives with his wife and one-year-old daughter in the Huvsgul province of Mongolia. He and his family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Tsendensambuu operates a taxi service in his town. He began his taxi business in 2009 and has built a stable operation. For the future, he hopes to expand his business and improve his car as well as increase his business revenues. Tsedensambuu is a modest and business-minded man.  He states, " If I could purchase a truck then I would earn more profits by transporting between towns." Tsedensambuu is requesting a 700,000 MNT loan in order to repair his car.

loans.use: To repair his car

loans.name: Sakina's Group

texts.en:
Sakina, a resident of Kasur, a Pakistani city famous for its sweetmeats, is 51 years old, a mother of four daughters and three sons, and married to M. S., a laborer. Although he is a very hard worker, his job is not a permanent source of income because work is sporadic. To support him financially and to fulfill the basic needs of the family, Sakina started an embroidery business, taking orders from her nearby clients and completing them promptly to earn an income.

All of Sakina's children are illiterate because she couldn't afford to send them to school. She has, however, taught her art of embroidery to all of her sons, who now operate their own business from a rented shop in the market. They contribute to the family financially from their earnings, while her daughters are very young and stay at home.

Sakina has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her embroidery business. With the loan, she will buy embroidery items such as clothes, beads, colored thread and sketches in bulk quantity that will enable her to complete orders on time and increase her income. A regular loan user of Asasah, this is her fourth loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained good credit behavior and attended all meetings.

Note: In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Sakina.

loans.use: To buy embroidery items in bulk quantity for embroidery business

loans.name: Farzana's Group

texts.en:
Farzana is a 35-year-old talented lady who supports her family financially from her embroidery business. She learned this art from her mother in her early age and now she is an expert in her field. She receives regular orders from her neighborhood clients and does well by completing them on time. 

She is a resident of a mid-sized city, Kasur, which is famous for its sweetmeat in Pakistan. She is married to A. A. who is a cobbler by profession. He makes shoes on order for different shoe factories. Those factories provide him raw materials for making shoes but in this way he only earns the laboring cost, which is not enough to meet the expenses of his family. That is why he has decided to buy the raw materials for himself and start to sell the finished products to these factories. In this way he can make more money and improve the financial situation of his family. 

Therefore, Farzana has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for her husband. He will invest the loan in purchasing raw materials such as nails, leather, shoe polish, etc. in bulk that will enable him to make shoes in larger quantity to sell to the factories. 

Farzana is hopeful that by utilizing the loan money, her husband’s income will be increased and she will be able to provide better living facilities to her large family of 8 children.   Both of her sons do labor and her daughters stay at home. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 2nd loan application. In the previous loan year, she had maintained her good behavior and attended every meeting. 

Note: In the photo, the lady who holds a book (called Asasah Passbook) in her hands is Farzana.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for shoe making business

loans.name: Sughran's Group

texts.en:
Sughran A. K. is a member of a poor family living in  Kasur, which is a mid-sized city famous for its sweetmeat in Pakistan. She lives in Rukan Pura, which is a small housing colony in Kasur, where she has a small house consisting of two rooms. Sughran is a very talented woman. She owns and operates an embroidery business in her home to supplement the income of her family. She mainly receives order from her neighboring clients and completes the dresses on time.  Her husband, A. K., has a business of selling bedsheets. He buys the bedsheets from the city multan and sells them at the local markets of Kasur for a good profit.  Sughran has two sons. Her elder son is involved in an embroidery business and her younger son is in school. 

Sughran has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for her son’s embroidery business. With the loan, her son will buy an embroidery machine, which will help him to complete larger orders on time and to work more efficiently. Sughran is very confident about the growth of her son’s business after this loan investment.  She is a regular loan user of Asasah; this is her third loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained good credit and never missed any meetings. 

Note: In the photo, the woman holding a book is Sughran.

loans.use: To buy an embroidery machine

loans.name: Lkhavgaochir

texts.en:
Lkhavgaochir is 29 years old. He lives with his wife and children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. They live in a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Lkhavgaochir's son Myagmardorj attends a local seconday school while his younger daughter stays at home with his wife during the day.
Lkhavgaochir runs a taxi service in his town and plans to operate a small knitting shop for his unemployed wife. He also hopes to save some money to build his own house and provide an education for his children. Lkhavgaochir is very energetic and has good communication skills. He is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to purchase a sewing machine and some raw materials for his wife.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine and raw materials for his wife

loans.name: Chhay Vy's Group

texts.en:
This village loan is made up of ten people. Mrs. Chhay V., a 32-year-old married woman, is the village bank president who has been selected by the group members. The group members live in Samraong K'aer village, Kandal province. Each members of this group will use their portion of the loan to support a different purposes.   
Mrs. Chhay V. is a farmer who owns a plot of land that she uses to cultivate vegetables for a living. She does not have enough money to support the farm, so she has decided to ask for a loan to buy vegetable seed and pay for laborers to plow her farm. Her husband, Mr. Mieng Phally, is 37 years old and works as a construction worker and also as a fisherman. He is able to earn a small income to improve the family's standard of living. The couple has four children: three attend the local school while the other is two years old.

loans.use: To buy vegetable seed and pay for laborers to plow her farm

loans.name: Dinara Musaeva's Group

texts.en:
The microfinance industry in Kyrgyzstan was developed in order to overcome poverty, raise the level of employment and promote the development of small businesses in Kyrgyzstan. It started functioning 15 years ago and is still successful today. The loans have helped thousands of families all over Kyrgyzstan.
Dinara M., 44, is the leader of this group from the village of Kochkor. Dinara is an experienced businesswoman since she has been involved in the cattle business for almost 16 years. A proud mother of four children, she hopes to provide a bright future for them. Her children are already college students and able to direct their lives by themselves. Dinara has applied for a loan to invest money in cattle raising. She plans to organize beautiful wedding ceremonies for her children, own good land and purchase a new car.
Nurbubu C., 41, is married. She works as a seamstress and will use her loan to purchase cattle. In future, she plans to purchase a car and open her own clothing workshop.
Altynbek A., 25, is married. He is a farmer and has applied for a loan in order to purchase additional cattle. He hopes to have a new house in the future.
Cholpon A., 49, is married and owns a small grocery shop. The purpose of her loan is to increase her number of cattle. She would like to broaden her business in the future.

Where did this loan come from?
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept: People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further), and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135.
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team – Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – at www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Phon Ravuth's Group

texts.en:
This group loan is made up of four people from Krabau village in Kandal province. Mr. Phon R. is a 23-year-old married man and has been selected as the leader of this group loan.
R. earns his living by operating two business ventures: vegetable and fish vending in the local market. His wife, Mrs. Chhoeun Sam Ath, is 23 years old and works as a seamstress in a garment factory as well as helping her husband in his business activities. Between them they are able to earn some profit to support their family. R. will use his loan from Kiva partner, AMK, to buy more vegetables and fish for enlarging his businesses. The couple does not have any children.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables and fish

loans.name: Kukun Imakeeva's Group

texts.en:
Loans have a great impact on people’s lives. They can help to start a business or bring new innovations to existing businesses. For this reason, the important thing is the purpose of the loan, not its size. Our clients have good ideas that deserve attention and financing.
Kukun I., 64, is the leader of this group. She has been involved in cattle raising and farming almost her entire life. For her business start-up she applied for a loan and it helped her a lot. Her husband is a pensioner and he tries to help her with the farming. Kukun has applied for a loan in order to broaden her business of reselling cattle. If she succeeds, she plans to arrange a wedding for her son.
Janyl M., 65, is married and also works in farming. The purpose of her loan is to increase her number of cattle and broaden her business.
Gulnara A., 42, is married and involved in farming. The purpose of her loan is to purchase sheep and broaden her business.
Shaigul B., 48, is married and raises livestock. She plans to purchase several sheep in order to increase her number of livestock.
Jibek I., 52, owns a shop. The purpose of her loan is to broaden the circulation of capital and gain more profit.

Where did this loan come from?
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept: People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further), and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135.
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team – Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – at www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Buzainap

texts.en:
Buzainap T. is a single mother of two children. She lives in Osh city, in the south of Kyrgyzstan. Buzainap graduated from trade college and worked as an accountant, but this work was not very profitable and she was not able to cover all of her children's expenses. In order to find a means of supporting her family, Buzainap started a business selling clothing. Using her initial capital of 5,000 KGS, she rented a sales location at the local market and started her business. Thanks to her hardworking and persistent nature, Buzainap managed to buy a flat for her family and increase her turnover. But in June 2010, when violent clashes caused by a deposed political regime broke out in the city of Osh, Buzainap lost her business, which was robbed and looted.
However, Buzainap doesn’t give up and is ready to resume her lost business and continue to work. For this reason, she is applying for a loan of 50,000 KGS, which she needs to restart her business. She plans to renew her range of goods for the coming winter season. Buzainap is very positive person, who believes in a prosperous future for her family and will do her best to achieve it.

About Bai-Tushum and Partners
Bai-Tushum and Partners use Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading microfinance institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: To broaden her range of goods

loans.name: Waziran Iqbal Hussain's Group

texts.en:
Waziran is a 51-year-old lady who belongs to a poor family. She lives in Kasur, a mid-sized city in Pakistan famous for its sweetmeats. Waziran is married to I. H., a private entrepreneur who runs a business selling clothes. He buys clothes from wholesale markets in the city of Lahore named “Ichra & AnarkA.” and sells them to the local market at a profit.
Waziran is a mother of two sons, both of whom are involved in an embroidery business. They run an embroidery shop in the market where they offer their services to customers in order to generate income for the family. The sons did not get an education because their parents were not in a position to afford it.
Waziran has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will purchase unstitched clothes of different varieties in bulk. The bulk purchasing will help him to increasing his sales and grow his business towards success. He has been in this business for over 25 years and Waziran is hopeful that this loan investment will bring good profits for her family. She is a new loan applicant to Asasah.
Note: In the photo, the lady who has holds the book (an Asasah passbook) in her hands is Waziran.

loans.use: To buy unstitched clothes in bulk

loans.name: Evans Bogonko

texts.en:
Evans Bogonko, 27, is married to Jedidah, 23, who helps him in the shop, and together they have two children aged four and one years old.

He has a retail shop in Ruai, which is near Tala. He has been running this business for the last six years and his monthly profit is Kshs 40,000. He was introduced to KADET LTD by other Kadet clients operating in groups.

Evans will use his loan to buy stocks of cooking oil and fat, sugar, rice, and flour to uplift her business so as to increase profit. 

If the loan boosts the business, Evans will turn it into a supermarket and build rental houses.

Evans dreams of becoming a big business person and taking better care of his family and educate his children.

He is honest and hardworking.

loans.use: Buy stock of sugar, flour, cooking oil and fat.

loans.name: Hilum Gachanja

texts.en:
Hilum Gachanja, 39, is married to Ruth, and together they have three children. He runs a shop as his primary business, which he has operated for a period of four years. Hilum also sells charcoal as his secondary business.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by an existing KADET client. His shop is located in Kiserian, which is well-populated and his business generates a monthly profit of Kshs 16,700.

With the loan, Hilum plans to buy 20 bags of charcoal to increase the stock for his secondary business, and the anticipated profit he plans to plough back into both businesses for a better and more stable source of income that will meet the basic needs of the family. His customers are contented with his goods, and this is a great source of motivation for him to aim higher to ensure that his customers are satisfied.

Hilum’s dream is to grow his business to a level that will generate enough income to buy a piece of land and develop it. This will ensure stability for him in taking care of his family. Hilum is vey hardworking.

loans.use: To buy 20 bags of charcoal to increase stock.

loans.name: Lot's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Lot S. N. is a married woman and was selected as the group leader of a loan consisting of 5 members, which is located in Preaek Hour Lech village, Kandal province. The members of this group will use their portion of the loan to support their different purposes.

S. N. and her husband, Mr. Doak Panha, own a small shop in Preaek Hour Lech village where they sell and repair phones. With both of these businesses, they are able to earn some good profits to support the famiL.'s condition. Since this business is doing well, they want to expand it. So, S. N. will use the loan from AMK to buy more phones and phone supplies to support her business activities. This couple has a child, who is just 5 months.

loans.use: To buy more phone and phone supplies to support her business activities.

loans.name: Nara

texts.en:
Mr. Nara K. is 30 years old and his wife, Mrs. Sreymao Heng, is 24 years old. They have been married since 2006 and have two young children:  one son and one daughter. The family lives along National Road Number One, about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. Nara is a farmer – he grows lotus. His wife is a garment factory worker. He hopes to expand his lotus farm but he does not have capital. So, Nara is requesting a loan of $1,000 to provide capital.

Mr. Nara K. and his wife are in the photo.

loans.use: To use for growing lotus

loans.name: Vannak

texts.en:
Mr. Vannak M. (in the photo) is 43 years old and his wife, Mrs. Phally Vun, is 38 years old. They have been married since 1992 and have five children:  two sons and three daughters. Two of them are hairdressers and the other three attend school. The family lives along National Road Number One, about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Vannak is a tuk tuk (motorcycle-based taxi) driver. He works in Phnom Penh. Vannak is requesting his first loan of $500 to build a restroom for his family to use.

loans.use: To build a restroom for his family

loans.name: Chamroeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Chamroeun M., 47, and her husband, Mr. Nao Sok, 50, (pictured together) live along National Road Number One, about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh city. They have been married since 1979 and have six children – three sons and three daughters. Two of them have full-time employment, one is in school and the others are assisting their parents.
Chamroeun and her husband are farmers: they grow papaya, tomatoes and corn. The couple is asking for a loan of $1,000 to purchase seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain their farm.

loans.use: To purchase seed, fertilizer and pesticide

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena has a sari-sari store business. Her husband’s support of this business is Lorena’s inspiration to persevere through the test of poverty to grow her business despite her circumstances. Sari-sari stores basically sell small quantities of various foodstuffs, groceries and beverages. “Sari” is a native word for variety. These small stores are either attached to the owner’s house or in a small native cottage not far from the owner’s home. Such stores are convenient for people in the barangay (village) who live far from the marketplace or town.
This kind of business has brought pleasure to Lorena’s family. With its profits, she has been able to support her family’s need. Being a good mother, Lorena always wanted to support her three children in whatever career they would choose to better their personal life. Aside from Lorena’s variety store business financed by the loan she received from Kiva partner, ASHI, she also has a buy and sell business, which is her way of saving profits to support her family's needs, especially her children’s education until college. With this in mind, Lorena is requesting a loan from Kiva lenders to purchase grocery items for her store and support her buy and sell business. This loan will help her businesses grow and make more profit, which will enable her to support her ambitions in life.
Lorena has been an ASHI member since 2004. Her family is very thankful that she has an opportunity to improve her living conditions through the income of her two businesses, both of which she has established with the support of previous loans. Her long-term goals are to have passenger jeepney (small bus) for added income, expand to a fully fledged grocery store, and give her children a better future. These dreams fuel her to continue her dedication to her ventures.

loans.use: To purchase groceries for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Chorn

texts.en:
Mr. Chorn B. (pictured above) who is 47 years old, and his wife, Mrs. Nary Pov who is 42, have been married since 1992. They have three children, two sons and one daughter, and all of whom are in school. The family lives along National Road Number One, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Chorn is a chef. His wife is a farmer who grows jasmine. Chorn is asking for his first loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorbike for commuting. He will also use a part of the loan to help fund his wife’s farming business.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for commuting and to help fund his wife’s farming business.

loans.name: Sidet

texts.en:
Miss Sidet D. (pictured with her mother) is an 18-year-old, single woman. She lives with her mother, who is a widow, and siblings (brothers and sisters) along the Tonle Bassac River. The Tonle Bassac River is a tributary of the nearby Mekong, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penn, the capital city of Cambodia.

Sidet has been a garment factory worker for two years. She is in the process of building a house, but she is not able to complete the house due to a lack of money. As a result, Sidet is asking for her first loan in the amount of $500 to make the finishing touches on the house.

loans.use: To complete the construction of her house

loans.name: Benard

texts.en:
Benard explains that he is a hardworking and imaginative man. To provide for his family, he runs a private, primary school. He started the school five years ago. Currently, he is operating the school with 26 employees.

He joined Faulu Kenya through a group called the "Sunshine Self Help Group." With the help of the group, he is better able to save his money. In addition, the group members guarantee each others' loans. With the requested loan in the amount of 40,000 KES ($500), he plans to buy cement for renovating the classrooms’ floors. In the future, he would like to expand the school into a college.

loans.use: To renovate classroom floors by purchasing cement

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel K. is a 31-year-old, married man. He is married to Loise Wanjiku, and they have two children. He has been in the local transportation business, known locally as "boda boda." He has been engaged in this line of business for nine years, which allows him to typically earn an income of 10,000 KES per month.

He has no experience with other microfinance institutions, yet he is applying for his third loan, this time in the amount of 40,000 KES ($500), from KADET LTD. He explains that he successfully repaid his prior loans. He intends to use the loan proceeds to repair his motorbike. In addition, he plans to spend the expected profits generated as a result of the loan wisely, by both paying for his children's education fees and expanding his business.

loans.use: To improve his business by repairing his motorbike

loans.name: Sitha

texts.en:
Mrs. Sitha R. (pictured) and her husband, Mr. Sophoin Kong, have been married since 2005 and have one young son. They live along the Tonle Basac River, a tributary of the nearby Mekong, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penn, the capital city of Cambodia.

Sitha makes garlands of jasmine flowers; she is hired by the villagers to do this. Her husband sells grocery items and gasoline and he is also a phone repairman. Sitha previously received a Kiva loan and she now is asking for her second loan of $1,200 to help her husband’s capital. He will use the loan to expand the shop where he runs his business by repairing more phones and installing cell phone applications and Mp3 and Mp4 players.

loans.use: To expand her husband's shop

loans.name: Kosal

texts.en:
Mr. Kosal K. and his wife, Mrs. Sakun Tit, live along the No. 1 national road, approximately 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have been married since 1989 and have two children, one son and one daughter. Both of the children are in school and assist their parents when they are not at school.

Kosal and his wife are vegetable farmers. They grow gourds, green beans, and lotus on their farm in the village. They sell their produce to a middleman in the village. The couple hopes to continue increasing their productivity so Kosal is asking for a loan of $1,200 to purchase seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain his vegetable farm. Besides of farming, Kosal also does construction work. 

Photo: Mr. Kosal K. and his wife.

loans.use: To purchase seed, fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Odom

texts.en:
Mr. Odom K. (pictured here), 41, and his wife, Mrs. Set Un, 38, live in a small village along National Road Number Three about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married for almost 20 years and have four children, one son and three daughters. One of their children works in a garment factory and the other three are in school.   
 
Odom is a security guard. He does not have his own transportation, so he spends a lot of money on traveling costs. Facing this, he decided to apply for a loan of $500 to purchase a motorcycle for commuting.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for commuting.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is a loving mother and hard working entrepreneur determined to improve her family's standard of living. She joined Kiva partner ASHI in 2000 to gain access to loans to support her entrepreneurial dreams. The first few loans she received enabled her to support the family’s sewing business and resale of plastic items and Styrofoam. The profit from these businesses has been the main source of family's income.  

Yolanda is now asking for another Kiva loan for a much larger amount. This is her second loan from Kiva lenders. She repays her previous loan in full and on time. The capital will fund further expansion of the family ventures to support Yolanda’s dreams for her children and her grandchildren to have brighter hopes. 

With working funds Yolanda’s business will keep on growing and she will be able to offer fulfilling services to her customers. Through the support of ASHI and KIVA partner, she hopes to see herself and her family change their living conditions and moving forward out of the poverty level. 

Yolanda hopes of an expanded business, therefore she is requesting a loan of 45,000 pesos to pay for a variety of plastic materials, styrofoam and other supplies. Yolanda requests this loan through ASHI so that she can support the expansion of her business and be able to provide the growing demands of her customers. Her long term goal is to have a tailoring shop a year from now so that she can give the opportunity of  employment to others, especially extended relatives in her community. She also hopes to have her own van for business use and to invest more in her home. 

Yolanda hopes to maintain long-term sustainable businesses. During the course of her membership in ASHI, Yolanda has been a model member dedicated to managing her family’s operations.

loans.use: To pay for a variety of plastic materials, styrofoam, and other supplies.

loans.name: James

texts.en: James is a 32 year old farmer.  He practices mixed farming in the Kiambu area, which has a favourable climate for farming.  He has been farming for five years and he hopes to grow his business in the future.  Besides farming, he does masonry for extra income. Since he joined Faulu kenya, his financial status has changed for the better. He has requested for a loan of KES 30,000 to buy masonry equipment.

loans.use: To buy masonry equipment.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis is a teacher by profession and he is employed by the government. In adddition, he does horticultural farming as a business. He started the business one year ago. So far, he has managed to employ one person. He is able to provide for his family and to educate his three children who are in school because of his income. He appreciates Faulu Kenya for assisting him financially because he has been able to boost his farming business. He has requested for a loan of KES 50, 000 to buy manure, a water pump and pipes.

loans.use: To buy manure, a water pump and pipes.

loans.name: Ajarkul

texts.en:
Ajarkul T. is a 46 year-old farmer. She is married and has three children. Her family has been engaged in cattle breeding for the past 15 years, which is the only mean of subsistence for them. They started this business with the initial capital of 8,000 Kyrgyz Soms and managed to earn 5,000 Kyrgyz Soms monthly. To reduce expenses for the livestock's foraging, Ajarkul pastures her livestock in the mountainous areas with native grasses. With the revenues from these activities, she was able to pay for higher education for her son. 

Now Ajarkul is applying for a loan of 60,000 Kyrgyz Soms to buy bull-calves. With the revenues, she plans to broaden her business by means of breeding. 

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors

loans.use: To purchase cattle.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is 36 years old. He is married and has two children who are six years old and eight months old.  He practices dairy farming in Kiambu, an area that is well known for its favorable climate for farming.  His business is just six months old. Peter is determined to see his business grow in the future and aspires to become a major supplier of milk in his area of residence.  Peter also practices horticultural farming to supplement his income.  In addition, Peter is also employed as a teacher. As a result, Peter has employed one person to check on his farm when he is occupied with teaching.  Faulu Kenya has had a great impact on his business because it provided Peter with a loan.  He used the loan to build a zero-grazing unit for eight cows.  Currently, he has four high-grade heifers.  Peter has requested another loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings to buy a dairy cow and a bull.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow and a bull.

loans.name: Saum's Group

texts.en:
This group loan consists of four people, located in Lekh Pram village, in Kandal province. Mrs. Saum S. A. is a 40 year old married woman and was selected as the group leader for this group loan. 

S. A. and her husband, Mr. Nov SambA., are farmers who own a plot of land that they use to cultivate vegetables for a living. With this farm, they face a problem because they don't have enough money to support it. Thus, S. A. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides, and to pay for laborers to plow her farm to cultivate vegetables. This couple work very hard to support their two children: one is a seamstress in a garment factory and another is attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides, and to pay for a laborer to plow her farm to cultivate vegetables.

loans.name: Mathew

texts.en:
Mathew is a 34-year-old married man from Mahenya estate in Kisumu City, which is located in western Kenya. He is married to Victoria Anyango who is a teacher. They have two children: Aniss, who is six years old, and Lua, who is five years old.

Mathew runs a farming business in Mahenya area and makes a monthly income of 17,000 KES. He currently has a tomato nursery which he intends to replant on his bigger farm. He has reqested for a loan of KES 25,000, which he will use to pay for fungicides, pesticides, and farm labor. From the anticipated profits, he will pay for his children’s school fees and meet other basic needs for the family. 
 
He hopes one day to open a greenhouse that will enable him to have a continous crop of tomatoes throughout the year without fear of weather changes. This will help him gain business from supermarkets, hoteliers, and other businessmen in Kisumu. He also intends to buy land and build a house for his family as a way of improving their standard of living.

loans.use: Pay for fungicides, pesticides, and farm labor

loans.name: Lucila

texts.en:
Lucila is a 32-year-old woman who has been buying & selling charcoal in the province of Talim Island, Rizal. She started the business 4 years ago to help her family meet basic needs as everything is very expensive and her husband’s salary wasn’t enough to sustain daily expenses. For this reason, she joined Kiva partner, ASHI. ASHI means “To rise up from Poverty”. Iin 2006 Lucila felt very thankful to obtain secured working capital and peer support to achieve her dreams.
