Now, Lucila continue to run her business to generate income and financially support her family. She would like to increase her weekly income. To this end, she has applied for new loan of 25,000 Php to purchase more stock for her business and increase her working capital. Lucila has already had previous loans from ASHI and repaid them successfully therefore she is being trusted to apply for a  much larger loan. As active businesswoman, Lucila would like also to explore alternate businesses to provide her family a good living.

Lucila has been dedicating herself to expand her business in order to support her dreams for her family and improve their standard way of living. She will be very responsible with her obligations and she is thankful to the people who will support the loan she is requesting. The loans have been  very helpful in making her business grow further and allowing her four children to  fulfill their dreams of completing college degrees and find stable jobs.
.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of charcoal and increase her working capital.

loans.name: Boniface

texts.en:
Boniface a 34 year old, runs a retail shop where he sells household items.  Most of his buyers are the people in the area of his his local residence.  He started the business in 2004 and he has managed to employ one person.  He was previously selling second-hand shoes to earn a living.  

Apart from selling household goods, he sells beauty products.  Boniface has really benefited from Faulu Kenya because of financial support and he was able to open a butchery. He uses his income to provide for his family's basic needs and to educate his two children.  He has requested a loan of 30, 000 kes to buy cooking pots, basins and hair braids.  He also wants to use part of the money to boost his butcher shop which is a new business.

loans.use: To buy cooking pots, basins, hair braids and to boost his butcher shop business

loans.name: Syavan (L’Unité Est Bonne) Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe SYAVAN de l’association Parisi est composé de 6 femmes mariées du village de Seoulasso de la sous-préfecture de TENE, préfecture  de  SAN, région de Ségou (quatrième  région administrative de la république du MALI). Les membres du groupe vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies. Elles se sont connues à travers le voisinage, elles ont en moyenne 36 ans et au moins 7 enfants. 
Elles exercent les activités  génératrices de revenus depuis plusieurs années, avec l’achat vente d’articles divers tels le charbon de bois, le bois de chauffe, les condiments alimentaires etc. 
Le groupe a intégré le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso il y’a une année et est à son 2ème  cycle de prêt. 
DIDIA D., la présidente du groupe comptent acheter avec son prêt, 35 sacs de charbon de bois pour les revendre à la foire hebdomadaire de TENE et dans les différents marchés hebdomadaires du village et environs. 
Didia D. qui est très connue et appréciée dans son activité envisage réaliser 15.000FCFA de bénéfice par mois tandis que les autres membres comptent sur un bénéfice mensuel de 12.500FCFA, qui sera utilisé pour rembourser le prêt, subvenir aux besoins familiales et réinvestir dans les activités.
texts.en:
The SYAVAN group of the Parisi association is composed of six married women from the Seoulasso village in the sub-prefecture of Tene, prefecture of San, region of Segou, which is the fourth administrative region of Mali.  The group members live in large extended traditional families.  The women are well known throughout their neighborhood and they have an average age of 36 and an average of seven children.                                                                           
The women have been generating income for several years by selling commodities such as firewood, charcoal, and condiments, etc.
The group has been a part of a credit program with Soro Yiriwaso for one year and the women are on their second loan.
D. Didia, the president of the group, intends to use her loan to buy 35 bags of charcoal to sell at the Tene weekly fair and in different weekly markets in local surrounding villages.
D. Didia, who is very well known and appreciated for her business activities, plans to earn 15,000 FCFA a month, while other members of the group earn a monthly profit of 12,500 FCFA. The women use the profits to pay back the loan, support the needs of their families, and reinvest in their business activities.

loans.use: To buy charcoal

loans.name: Confiance Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Confiance est un constitué de cinq  femmes mariées de la ville  San (région de Ségou), ayant en moyenne 45 ans et au moins 3  enfants. Elles vivent dans des familles polygames et font la vente  de riz, de la  restauration et l’achat vente de diverses marchandises.
Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis quatre ans. Après sept prêts solidaires tous correctement remboursés, elles sont à leur huitième  prêt et AWA T. compte acheter avec son prêt, 20 sacs de riz  pour les décortiquer. Elle effectue sa vente en détail, au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle diverse et variée.
Elle espère réaliser un  bénéfice de 42.500FCFA par mois.  En dehors du remboursement du prêt, elle utilisera  une partie de son  revenu  pour payer  les trousseaux des filles et autres dépenses de la famille. Les autres femmes du groupe comptent sur un bénéfice de 41.500FCFA par mois. 
Les femmes du groupe Confiance  ambitionnent agrandir leurs fonds de commerce et diversifier leurs marchandises.
texts.en:
The Trust group is composed of five married women in the city of San (within the region of Ségou).  The women have an average age of 45 and each has at least three children. They live within polygamous family structures and sell rice and buy and sell other diverse commodities.
Four years ago, the group members decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso credit program to increase the scale of their business activities.  After seven successfully repaid group loans, the women are seeking their eighth loan, with which Awa T. will buy 20 bags of rice. She conducts retail sales and extends cash and credit to a wide range of clients. 
She hopes to earn a monthly profit of 42,500 FCFA. In addition to repaying her loan, she will use part of her income to pay for her daughters clothing and other family expenses. The other women in the group rely on a monthly profit of 41,500 FCFA.
The women of the Trust group aspire to increase their activities, and diversity their merchandise.

loans.use: To buy rice

loans.name: Sidiki

texts.fr:
Né 13 janvier 1982 à San, SIDIKI T.  n’as pas eu la chance d’aller à l’école et a  vite embrassé les activités génératrices de revenus. Il est mariée et vit dans une famille monogame avec son épouse et ses 2 enfants  dans le quartier Santoro I, de la préfecture de San (Région de Ségou).  
SIDIKI fait l’achat et la vente de cola en gros et en détail  qu’il a appris  auprès de son père  il y a plus de 15 ans. 
Il est très sollicité et apprécié surtout lors des foires hebdomadaires de San  ville et environs.  
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle  et diversifier son activité, il décida de faire recours à l’‘institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec qui  il  est à son 3ème  prêt individuel. 
Monsieur SIDIKI T. compte acheter, 50 paniers de cola, il s’approvisionnait auprès des commerçants grossistes de San, mais avec l’augmentation du fonds de commerce, il compte aller jusqu’à Bouaké ( en République de Côte d’Ivoire) pour son approvisionnement. 
Il vend tous les jours au grand marché de San et dans les foires hebdomadaires à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes, à crédit et au comptant. 
Il espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 22.500 FCFA qu’il envisage utiliser pour rembourser l’échéance du prêt, utiliser  le reste pour payer les frais de scolarité de ses enfants, de la nourriture et investir dans d’autres  activités.
texts.en:
Sidiki T. was born on January 13, 1982. He never had the opportunity to go to school and very early on took up income generating activities.  He is married and lives in a monogamous family with his spouse and their two children in the neighborhood of Santoro I, of the San prefecture (Segou Region).

Sidiki purchases and sells kola nuts in bulk and for retail. He learned this activity from his father about 15 years ago. He is very much in demand and appreciated, especially during the weekly fairs in San and its surroundings.

To meet his customers’ demand and to diversify his activity he decided to call on the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso with whom this is his third individual loan. Mr. Sidiki T. would like to buy 50 baskets of kola nuts. He used to get his supply from the San’s wholesalers. However with the increase of his working capital, he would like to go as far as Bouaké (Ivory Coast Republic) to get his supply.

He sells every day at the large San market and at the weekly fairs to a customer base made up of women and men, on credit and for cash. He hopes to make a monthly profit of 22 500 Francs CFA that he plans to use to reimburse his loan and the rest will be used to pay for his children’s school fees, food and other activities.

loans.use: Purchase of baskets of kola nuts

loans.name: Eng's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Eng C. is a 26 year old married woman and is the group leader of the loan group, having been selected by its four members. They are live in Samraong K'aer village, Kandal province. Each member of this group will use their portion of the loan to support their different businesses and activities.

C. earns her living through selling groceriees in the local village. Her husband, Mr. Chhun Sitha is a car driver. With their occupations, they are able to earn some good profit to support their family. In order to increase their income to improve the family condition, C. decided to ask for a loan to buy more additional supplies of groceries to enlarge her business activities. This couple has a child who is 3 years old.

loans.use: to buy more groceries

loans.name: Linah Auma

texts.en:
Linah Auma is an industrious, twenty eight year old lady from the Nyamasaria area of Kisumu City, along the shores of Lake Victoria. Linah is married to Caleb Otieno and they have two children.

To make ends meet, Linah runs a Video entertainment hall where she shows various movies/videos at a small fee. This kind of entertainment halls are popular in most parts of Kisumu city. She has been doing this for the last five years and the sky is the limit for her. She is taking her first loan from KADET Limited which she will use to buy additional seats for her video hall. With this investment, she hopes to accomodate more people and earn more income and alsoprovide comfort for her clientele. Linah will use part of the profits to educate her children.

Her dream is to one day open a big video shop and also open more shops in other parts of the city. She is therefore looking for a Kiva lender to make her dream come to a reality.

loans.use: To buy additional seats for her video shop

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is a married lady and has four children who are above twenty years old.  She makes and sells doughnuts for a living.  She sells the doughnuts in her neighborhood.  Since she joined Faulu kenya, her business has been picking up.  She hopes to provide proper education to her children in the future.  She has requested for 10, 000 Kes to buy cooking oil and wheat flour.

loans.use: To buy cooking oil and wheat flour

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace, a sociable 36-year-old single mother of two, owns and runs N. Boutique for a living.  In her boutique, which she has run for two years, she sells clothes and shoes.  She also does farming in her rural home in order to earn extra income.  Grace has requested a loan of 20,000 Kes to buy more clothes, clothes hangers and shelves for displaying clothes, and dreams of renting a bigger business venue in the future.

loans.use: To buy more clothes, clothes hangers and shelves for displaying clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more used clothes.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en:
A 60-year-old, business-minded woman, Teodora hopes and dreams that some day her charcoal business will expand. Through the loan she is requesting from Kiva through ASHI, she will be able to increase her inventory of charcoal. Charcoal is the most common fuel for cooking food for the poor people living in very remote areas of the province. Aside from its affordable price, it is also the most conveniently accessed commodity for people in remote villages. Proceeds from her business will help Teodora achieve her goal of helping her two remaining children complete college and become successful, just like her eldest son Elmer who is now a teacher. She also hopes they will have a beautiful concrete house of their own to live in.

As a dedicated member since 1999 of Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI), a Kiva microfinance partner in the Philippines, Teodora is thankful for receiving capital and loans to support her business dreams. Despite the many trials in life that Teodora had been through, even in her membership in ASHI and in the relationships of her group members, she remains tough, active, and dedicated to reaching her goals in life.

loans.use: To purchase additional charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Jambu's Group

texts.en:
Jambu A. has the status of the group’s leader. She is 40, and divorced. By herself, she has to take care of her two children, both of whom are in school. This businesslike woman supports her family by farming; she cultivates sunflowers and millet. Thirteen years ago, when she divorced her husband, she began her own business, and now she also breeds cattle. Jambu wants to get a loan in order to purchase 1.5 tons of ground rice at 18 soms per kg, in order to resell it in the spring for 30 soms per kg. In the future she is planning to build a canteen (refreshment counter) in the stockyard market.

Jambu’s partners:

Aizada T. is 55 and married. Her big family consists of her spouse and their six children. The family members make their living by cattle breeding. In order to purchase a milk cow, they hope to obtain a loan. In the future Aizada wants to increase their cattle stock.

Maria A. is 48 and married. Her family has four children. Besides her husband's earnings from taxi-driving, the family cultivates and sells rice. From 15 years of working hard they have managed to build a house. The loan purpose is to prepare four hectares of their land for harvesting. In the future Maria is planning to increase their cattle stock, and then to arrange her sons’ weddings.

Mamatkamil I. is 55 and married. Together with his wife they have six children. The head of the family and his sons are engaged in rice and corn cultivating. The family needs to obtain a loan in order to plant millet on a one-hectar area. In the future Mamatkamil wants to purchase an allotment for cultivating rice, and plans to increase his cattle stock.

Manzurahon D. is 24 and married. She is the treasurer of the group. Her family has four children. The family has their own business which consists of baking the national bread. The purpose of the loan is to purchase a “Mercedes Benz” automobile. In the future the couple plans to build a big house.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our lending team – Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase rice.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en: Julius is a 26-year-old single man. For a living, he sells cows for slaughter. He has been operating this business for four years. He hopes to open his own slaughterhouse in the future. He also does construction work for extra income. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has become more focused in his business. He has requested for a loan of 15,000 Kes to buy goats and cows.

loans.use: To buy goats and cows

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Edisa's Group

texts.en:
Edisa K. is the leader of the group. She is 36 and a widow. Edisa has to raise three children by herself; all of them are in school. Today, this businesslike woman supports her family financially by renting a shop; she sells drinks, foodstuffs, dairy products, and cigarettes. This business was started a year ago. During this time Edisa has aimed to develop and extend her business, and by now she has managed to increase her inventory. She needs a loan in order to purchase more goods to increase her assortment of goods. In the future she is planning to give her children a university education, and then purchase a car.

Edisa’s partners:

Munduk B. is the treasurer of the group. She is 47 and married. All of her four children are already adults. The family budget is being enlarged with cattle trading and with the help of pension benefits. In order to develop their cattle business, the family hopes to obtain a loan.

Jyldyz T., 23, is not married. She earns her livelihood by working as a café bartender in Tokmok City. The main source of income for her family is from cattle breeding. The loan purpose is to purchase more cattle to increase the total number of animals.

Jazgul B., 29, is married. Together with her husband she is raising a son. The mother has the profession of part-programming engineer, and her spouse receives a disability pension. The loan purpose is to obtain a mobile phone. In the future Jazgul wants to purchase a flat.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our lending team – Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase goods for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a vapor machine

loans.name: Ainagul's Group

texts.en:
Ainagul O. has the status of group leader. She is 39 and married. Together with her spouse, who is a veterinarian, she has raised two children who are school pupils. Since 2000, the family has raised money by breeding cattle. She also works in a technical role at a school. The family has managed to increase its cattle stock and to purchase necessary household appliances. In order to develop the business and increase the total number of cattle, Ainagul is planning to purchase 3 calves for fattening and breeding. This is her purpose for requesting a loan.

Ainagul’s partners:

Janylkan N., 54, is a widow. She has 3 children. Currently she raises money by cattle breeding and works in a technical role at a school.  Janylkan wants to get a loan in order to purchase and fatten 2 calves.

Nazira I., 28, is married. Her family has 2 children. Today Nazira works in a technical role at a school. Her family also makes a living breeding cattle. The loan purpose is to purchase 2 calves for fattening. 

Cholpon J. is the treasurer of the group. She is 40, and married. Together with her spouse she has raised 3 children. Her son and her husband are farmers and are engaged in cattle breeding. The family needs to get a loan in order to purchase 3 sheep for further fattening. 
    
--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and uphold the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase three calves for breeding

loans.name: Farida's Group

texts.en:
Farida T. has the status of group leader. She is 32 and married. Together with her spouse she has raised three children. The elder children are in school and the youngest is a toddler. Three years ago, after having received credit, the family purchased livestock animals. Farida’s husband feeds, waters, and puts the cattle in the pasture. Selling milk also enriches the family's budget (8-9 liters daily). The family has managed to increase its number of livestock and has purchased 10 more livestock animals for fattening. The family hopes to obtain a loan. In the future, they are planning to build a house and repaid a shed.

Farida’s partners:

Gulzat M., 36, is married. She is the treasurer of the group. Together with her husband, who is a farmer, she raises 3 children. The family makes money by selling milk (8-9 liters daily). In order to increase the total number of animals for business development, the family needs to get a loan. 

Elmira J., 43, is married. Her family consists of her husband and their 5 children. The family budget is being enlarged by cattle breeding. In order to breed more cattle, the family wants to purchase 2 livestock animals. 

Ulan T., 29, is married. His spouse is a housewife and takes care of their 2 small children. The head of the family is engaged in trading; he sells foodstuff. In order to enlarge his assortment of goods, he plans to purchase sugar, macaroni and detergents. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock animals

loans.name: Chynara's Group

texts.en:
Chynara A. is the leader of the group. She is 54 and married. Her spouse supports the family by working as a school teacher. The couple had brought up 2 sons who are now 29 and 27 years old. The elder son helps parents to keep their house, while the second son raises money by working at a cement factory. In 2008, after having received credit, the family bought and planted potato seeds. From their harvest profits, they bought livestock animals. By now almost all the family members are engaged in milk selling (8 liters daily). They have managed to increase their total number of farm animals. Chynara hopes to get a loan in order to purchase 1 cow and 2 sheep for fattening and to increase their stock. In the future, the family is planning to arrange their sons’ weddings.

Chynara’s partners:

Djanyl B. is 56, and married. Together with her husband, she brings up a daughter. By now she is a chief accountant in an agricultural technical school. Djanyl’s family needs to get a loan in order to buy a cow to increase her cattle stock. 

Ainura A. is the treasurer of the group. She is 42 and married. Her family has 2 sons. She makes her living by selling milk (10 litres daily). Her loan purpose is to purchase 1 cow and 2 sheep to increase her cattle stock. 

Muktarbek B., 48, is married. Together with his wife, he raises a daughter. He earns money by welding iron gates and other iron items. He needs to get a loan in order to purchase materials for making gates. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase a cow and two sheep for breeding

loans.name: Zulay

texts.en:
Zulay K. is 61, married and lives in Sadovoe village with her family. She has three children who help in the household. In 2000, using her initial capital of 5,000 Kyrgyz Soms, Zulay began cultivating carrots. Currently, her land needs to be worked and manured. For this reason, Zulay plans to apply for a loan of 50,000 KGS to pay for transporting the harvest and purchasing fertilizer. With the revenues from this investment, she plans to broaden her business cultivating land.
Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: The Kiva borrower is a 22-year-old single man living with his parents in Lebanon. Despite his young age, he has been running a beauty salon for the past 4 years.  He offers different beauty services to his clients. As is common for the majority of Lebanese men, he too cooperates with his family to pay for the living expenses. He has always learned the new looks and haircuts in order to offer beautiful designs to his clients. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1000 from Kiva's partner, Ameen s.a.l., to purchase new hairdressing tools. In the future, he hopes to expand his shop and grow his business operation by providing the latest beauty services to attract more clients.

loans.use: To purchase new hairdressing tools

loans.name: Titus Mbau

texts.en:
Titus Mbau N. is 42 years old and married to Miriam Nyambura. They have three children age 18, 15 and 13 years respectively. They live in Thika, which is also where their business is located. Thika is an up-and-coming town that is very busy with many people engaged in different kinds of business. Many of these people happen to be customers of Titus.

N. has been working as a tailor for one year and earns a monthly profit of Kshs.14,000. He has no history with any other MFI (micro-finance institution) and he is applying for his first loan of Kshs.50,000 from KADET, which he intends to use to add more clothing material for making dresses for sale as the festive season approaches.

The anticipated profit he wants to save and plough back into the business in hope of growing his business to improve his standard of living. He would like to open additional branches of business and in the future, to buy a plot and settle his family. He is very happy and has much interest in his work.

loans.use: To buy more clothing materials for making dresses for sale on the coming festive season

loans.name: Budumbuli  East Development Group-Jinja

texts.en: Being amiable, evergreen and down to earth has helped 39 year old K. Glades a great deal. For over a decade now she has been plying a roaring restaurant business in Bugembe-Jinja. The underlying fact that her business has been doing well is something she does not put a veil on. Of cardinal importance in establishing a firm foothold on the market for her business has been the embrace of good customer care skills. This has in many respects been a winner. She began with a pancake sale business before she nurtured the whole idea of setting up this business. To manifest that she and her family can live within the means and ways of this business, all of her five children are attending good schools. In the course of time, Glades has reached a satisfactory profit maximizing point in her business. In a week, she makes profits totaling to 120,000 shillings and she is anticipating even better prospects with the acquisition of this loan. The purchase of substantial amounts of food and furniture for her restaurant is what is in the offing for her.

loans.use: The purchase of food and furniture for her restaurant

loans.name: Rubaga Development Group-Jinja

texts.en: Most people strain their nerves for years trying to find a settled means of subsistence. Three years ago is when 30-year-old amiable N. Annet set forth in her old or used clothes selling business in Jinja Town. This business, she says, has in many respects pushed the envelope for her in the shouldering of many of her family’s responsibilities. Annet says the need for self reliance was the motivation in starting this business. She says she knew beforehand that success would only be in her grasp if she worked vigorously at establishing a niche. $9 is what totals up as her weekly profits. Annet is a good natured mother of four, and with this loan she says she is going to purchase more bales of clothes for resale. She makes common cause with Rubaga Development Group-Jinja.

loans.use: The purchase of more bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en: Benard, a married man and a businessman, operates Upendo retail shop.  Most of his customers are people in his area of residence.  He has been operating the business for five years.  He was previously an artisan.  Benard is a hardworking man who hopes that someday he will complete constructing his rental houses.  He has requested a loan of 30,000 KES to buy sugar, cooking fat and tea leaves, and to fix a gate for his piece of land where he is constructing rental houses.

loans.use: To buy sugar, cooking fat and tea leaves, and to fix a gate for his piece of land.

loans.name: Ingrid

texts.es:
Ingrid forma parte del banco comunal “El Eclipse Valdiviano”, perteneciente a la ciudad de Valdivia. Ella hace artesanías en collares, aros y accesorios en tejidos, macrame, crochet, semillas y mostacillas y las vende en un local, el cual  arrienda en una galería de la ciudad hace 6 años. 
Con este préstamo comprará materiales para hacer sus productos artesanales, para lo cual viajará a Santiago, capital de Chile. Su sueño es tener su casa propia, ya que vive con sus papás y su único hijo de 18 años. También le gustaría tener otro local de artesanías, además del que ya tiene, pero en otro lugar. Para el sueño de su casa, Ingrid está ahorrando y esperando un subsidio del Estado, que estima pueda ser aprobado el próximo año. Su gran motivación es contar con los recursos que le permitan dar bienestar económico a su hijo y la oportunidad de tener estudios superiores.  
Para Ingrid Fondo Esperanza ha sido un importante apoyo que le ha permitido mantener su negocio. 
Valdivia es una ciudad del sur de Chile, ubicada en la región de Los Ríos. Se destaca por tener uno de los pocos ríos navegables del país. Valdivia presenta, dentro de sus principales actividades económicas, la industria de la metalurgia, la construcción naval, maderera, papelera, celulosa, cervecera y molinera.
texts.en:
Ingrid is part of the "El Eclipse Valdiviano" communal bank, based in the city of Valdivia.  She crafts items like necklaces, rings, and accessories, which are knit, macramed, crocheted, or made from seeds or beads.  She has sold these items for six years in a store that is located in a shopping gallery in the city.
 
She will use this loan to buy materials for making her artisan crafts, which she travels to Santiago, the capital of Chile, to purchase.  Her dream is to have her own house, as she now lives with her parents and her only son, who is 18 years old.  She would also like to have another shop for her crafts, in addition to her current one, but located elsewhere.  In regards to her dream of owning a house, Ingrid has been saving and is also hoping for a housing subsidy from the state, which she estimates could be approved in the coming year.  Her greatest motivation is to secure the resources that will allow her to provide for her son's economic well-being and for him to have the opportunity for higher education.

Fondo Esperanza has been an important help to Ingrid, as it has made it possible for her to sustain her business.

Valdivia is a city in the south of Chile, located in the Los Ríos ["The Rivers"] region.  It is known for having one of the few navigable rivers in the country.  Valdivia's principal economic activities are metallurgy; naval construction; wood, paper, and pulp production; brewing; and milling.

loans.use: materials for making artisan crafts like necklaces, rings, and accessories

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: Eunice, 37, is married and a mother of two. She is a hardworking lady who runs a general store.  Besides that she also operates a hardware shop.  She has been running the business for three years and has managed to employ two people.  She hopes to open more outlets for her business in the future.  She has requested a loan of 30,000 KES to buy foodstuffs to sell in her store, and nails and cardboard to sell in the hardware shop.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs, nails and cardboard

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
Ana forma parte del banco comunal “El Eclipse Valdiviano” perteneciente a la ciudad de Valdivia. Ella hace cecinas artesanales de carne de cerdo principalmente. Además prepara carne ahumada y otros productos derivados, de manera artesanal en su casa, junto a su marido, quien es maestro cecinero y trabaja en una fábrica del mismo rubro. 
Ana tiene 3 negocios a los que entrega, y 3 clientes particulares que le compran al por mayor, como sus principales clientes. Además tiene muchos clientes que le compran por unidad. Con este préstamo comprará carne para hacer sus productos y los materiales que le faltan para ampliar su cocina. Tiene 2 hijas, una de 7 años y una de 19 años, quien hace poco tiempo también forma parte de Fondo Esperanza y está trabajando en el negocio de sus papás. 
El sueño de Ana es tener su casa propia, ya que está arrendando por ahora, y también le gustaría ampliar su producción. 
Ana está muy agradecida de Fondo Esperanza, ya que por medio de los préstamos de bajo interés ha podido mantener su negocio y aportar económicamente al bienestar de su familia, ya que el sueldo de su marido no les es suficiente para vivir. 
Valdivia es una ciudad del sur de Chile, ubicada en la región de Los Ríos. Se destaca por tener uno de los pocos ríos navegables de Chile. Valdivia presenta, dentro de sus principales actividades económicas, la industria de metalurgia, la construcción naval, maderera, papelera, celulosa, cervecera y molinera.
texts.en:
Ana is part of the “El Eclipse Valdiviano” communal bank, located in the city of Valdivia.  She makes artisanal sausages, mostly from pork.  She also prepares smoked meat and other related products, all in an artisanal style from her house.  She does this work together with her husband, who teaches sausage-making and works in a factory in the same area.

Ana delivers to three businesses and has three individual customers who buy in bulk, which makes up her primary clientele.  She also has many customers who buy by the unit.  With this loan, she will buy meat for making her products and some materials that she is missing, in order to expand her kitchen.  She has two daughters.  One is 7 years old and the other is 19 years old and recently joined Fondo Esperanza and is working in her parents' business.

Ana's dream is to have her own house, as she is renting for now.  She would also like to increase her production.

Ana is very grateful to Fondo Esperanza, as the low-interest loans she has received have made it possible to maintain her business and to economically support her family's well-being, since her husband's income alone is not enough to live off of.

Valdivia is a city in the south of Chile, located in the Los Ríos ["The Rivers"] region. It is known for having one of the few navigable rivers in the country. Valdivia's principal economic activities are metallurgy; naval construction; wood, paper, and pulp production; brewing; and milling.

loans.use: to buy meat for making sausages

loans.name: Aurora

texts.es:
Aurora forma parte del banco comunal “El Eclipse Valdiviano”, perteneciente a la ciudad de Valdivia. Ella tiene un almacén en su casa, donde vende variados productos, como abarrotes, lácteos, confites y recargas de celular entre otras cosas. Con este préstamo comprará mercadería para su negocio. Tiene 2 hijas, de 16 y  14 años, para quienes Aurora es el único sustento económico. 
Tiene su almacén hace 23 años, pero desde el 30 de septiembre del pasado año 2009, cuando se quemó su casa y el negocio que tenía en la misma, perdió  todo lo que tenía. Luego de esa tragedia comenzó a arrendar y siguió con su almacén, aunque este es más pequeño que el que perdió en el incendio. 
El sueño de Aurora es tener una casa propia nuevamente y seguir creciendo en su negocio. Para ahorrar y cumplir su sueño tiene a la venta el terreno de la casa que se le quemó. 
Para Aurora Fondo Esperanza significa un gran apoyo económico y  le han servido las enseñanzas que recibe durante las reuniones, de grupo con la asesora, sobre la administración de negocios. También le ha servido compartir con sus compañeros, ya que hablan de las experiencias de sus negocios y ha podido tener nuevas ideas. 
Valdivia es una ciudad del sur de Chile, ubicada en la región de Los Ríos. Se destaca por tener uno de los pocos ríos navegables de Chile. Valdivia presenta, dentro de sus principales actividades económicas, la industria de metalurgia, la construcción naval, maderera, papelera, celulosa, cervecera y molinera.
texts.en:
Aurora is part of the "El Eclipse Validiviano" communal bank, located in the city of Valdivia.  She has a small store in her house where she sells a variety of products, such as groceries, dairy products, sweets, and cell phone minutes, among other things.  She will buy merchandise for her store with this loan.  

She has two daughters, ages 16 and 14 years old, and Aurora is their only economic support.  She has had her store for 23 years, but on September 30, 2009, her house burned, along with the store inside.  She lost everything she had.  Since this tragedy, she started renting and restarted her store, although now it is much smaller than the one she lost in the fire.  Aurora's dream is to have her own house again and to continue rebuilding her business.  In order to save money and reach her dream, she has put the land where her house burned up for sale.

Fondo Esperanza has been a great economic support to Aurora.  She has also found the sessions during their meetings, when the advisor talks about business administration, to be useful.  It has also been helpful to share with her fellow group members, who talk about their experiences with their businesses and have come up with new ideas.

Valdivia is a city in the south of Chile, located in the Los Ríos ["The Rivers"] region. It is known for having one of the few navigable rivers in the country. Valdivia's principal economic activities are metallurgy; naval construction; wood, paper, and pulp production; brewing; and milling.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her store

loans.name: Buwenge Kisa Kya Mukama Womens Development-Jinja Group

texts.en:
Buwenge Kisa Kya mukama is the group that 45-year-old K. Aisha is affiliated with. She has been relentless in the smooth overseeing of her five-year-old fish selling business. This has meant that she has summoned up of a lot of determination. She says all bets are off as to whether she will achieve long term success. 

The Buwenge neighborhood where she operates is a melting pot of fish-buying traders.  It goes without saying that this is a highly lucrative business from which she says she has benefited quite a lot. Aisha is happily married with eight kids. To set forth in this business she had to bank on profits from her agro-produce business. Prior to that she was more inclined toward a timber-selling business. At present, she has a side poultry business. 

$66 is what she says she makes in a week. With this loan, Aisha says she is going to buy more fish for resale.

loans.use: The purchase of more fish for resell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of used sneakers

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more crates of drinks and to buy some petroleum and spare parts for his motorcycle

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of used clothes

loans.name: Sadat

texts.en:
28-year-old Waiswa Sadat says his six-year ascendancy in his clothes, handbags, belts and shoes sales business all boils down to his incredible will power, diligence and an unwavering sense of determination.  

His first business source of livelihood was shoe hawking. It was after much soul searching and second thought that he decided he wanted to venture into a different business.  Shoe hawking is a business he found himself involved in after he got cash from selling a plot of land. He still runs it, though at a minimal level. 

About his marital status - Sadat says he is single, but with two kids.  About $31 is what totals up as weekly profits in his business transactions. He is requesting this loan to purchase more new clothes, handbags, belts and shoes for resale.

loans.use: The purchase of new clothes, handbags, belts and shoes for resale

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is 46-year-old married woman and the mother of four children. She is a new owner of a bakery in her town. Her freshly prepared goods and delicious Lebanese breads are enjoyed by members of her village and neighboring towns. 

She has obtained her first Kiva loan and she is pleased with her decision to take a loan from Ameen and satisfied with the loan amount. She is planning to continue expansion of her business and she is positive about the coming year. 

Now she is asking to borrow $1,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase ingredients such as flour. Her bakery is an important source of income for her family. Lebanon has many pastry shops and bakeries and it is easy to buy fresh goods in one’s village or neighborhood.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients such as flour

loans.name: Paul  Maina

texts.en:
Paul Maina M. is 38 years old, married to Susan Wangui, and they have seven children between the ages of 16 and 2. Paul has been in the tailoring business for about ten years and he earns a profit of approximately $140 per month.

The business is located in Thika town where most of his customers reside. He is applying for his third loan of 15,000 KES after paying back his previous loans successfully. He intends to use the money to buy more material for making clothes to sell so that he can meet the demands for the festive season.

Paul plans to use the anticipated profit from the expanded business as savings to ensure that the business is stable financially. His main desire is to educate his children and be in a position to offer them the basic needs for their family's standard of living.

loans.use: To buy more material for making clothes to sell during the festive season

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more slippers and phone cards

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 40-year-old married man living with his wife and three kids. He has been working as a traveling home painter for the past fifteen years. His income is vitA. to support his family and be able to satisfy the heavy expenses of life. He works hard to realize this target in collaboration with his wife who works as a cleaning woman in a locA. school. He works on a freelance basis taking home projects. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,100 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase new painting tools to replace the used ones in order to offer good quality service to his clients. In the future, he hopes to further expand his business and continue his work properly to earn income for his family.

loans.use: to purchase new painting tools

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Friendship Group

texts.en:
Kumba S., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called Friendship. She is 36 years old, single, and has four children whose ages are between 6 and 18 years. She was able to attend school only through 12th grade due to financial difficulty. She also cares for two siblings.

For 15 years, she has been selling drinks (liquor) and water in Redlight Market on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 8,000 LRD portion of this 40,000 LRD group loan to buy more crates of drinks and sacks of water. 

She describes herself as a friendly, very hard-working woman whose goals are to improve her business and educate her children.

loans.use: To buy more crates of drinks and sacks of water

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Mercado Solidario Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Mercado Solidario es conformado por 19 socios,  pertenecientes a la ciudad de Talca. Sus principales negocios son de manualidades en tejidos, telar, decoupage y pinturas; venta de artesanías y preparación y venta de colaciones. 
Paula es la presidenta de este grupo y en la foto se encuentra por el centro de la foto, justo detrás y a la derecha de la señora que tiene la muñeca de pelo rojo en la mano. Ella hace muñecas de tela, pinturas sobre madera y decoupage, hace 10 años. Desde hace 2 años tenía un local en el mercado central, en el centro de Talca, el cual lamentablemente quedo destruido por el terremoto del pasado 27 de febrero, por lo que ahora vende solo en su casa y a domicilio. Con este  préstamo comprará algodón y telas usadas para hacer las muñecas. En noviembre abrirá un nuevo local, ubicado en una galería nueva, en donde atenderá con su mamá, quien también participa en Fondo Esperanza y tiene el mismo rubro que ella. 
Su meta es que sus productos sean reconocidos por su calidad y originalidad.  Tiene 2 hijas, de 18 y 15 años, quienes viven con ella. 
A  Paula le ha sido muy grato participar en Fondo Esperanza y con sus compañeros de grupo.
Talca pertenece a la región del Maule, ubicada en la zona centro del país. La mayor parte de la población habita en el sector rural, la cual se dedica principalmente a las actividades económicas propias del campo. Se caracteriza  por su hermosa artesanía y arquitectura colonial.  Sus principales atracciones son la flora, la fauna, y sus viñedos. A pesar que la fuerza de trabajo se ha incrementado, esta región sigue siendo, según el último censo, una de las más pobres del país.
texts.en:
The “Solidarity Market” cooperative bank is comprised of 19 members from the city of Talca.  Their businesses are primarily knitted and woven articles, decoupage and paintings; making and selling handicrafts and light meals.  

Paula, the president of this group, is located in the center of the photograph just behind and to the right of the woman holding the doll with red hair.  She has been making cloth dolls, paintings on wood and decoupage for the past 10 years.  For the past 2 years she has had a site at the market in Talca, which was unfortunately destroyed in the earthquake that occurred this past February 27th.  For this reason, she now only sells her products from her home or door-to-door.

She will use this loan to buy cotton and used fabrics to make her dolls.  In November, she will open a locale located in a new gallery, where she will work with her mother’s help as she also participates in Fondo Esperanza and is in the same business as Paula.  Her goal is to have her handicrafts recognized for their quality and originality.

She has 2 daughters, ages 18 and 15, who live with her.  It has been very pleasant for Paula to participate in Fondo Esperanza and with her associates in the group.  Talca belongs to the Maule region, in the central part of the country.  The majority of the population is involved in agricultural economic activities.  The area is known for its beautiful handicrafts and its colonial architecture.  The principal attractions are the flora, fauna, and vineyards.  Despite the fact that the workforce has increased, the last census indicates that it continues to be one of the poorest areas in the country.

loans.use: Cotton and fabrics.

loans.name: God’S Blessing Group

texts.en:
Everlyn G., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called God’s Blessing.  She is 40 years old, widowed, and has five children whose ages are between 21 and 3 years. She was able to attend school only through 12th grade due to financial constraints. 

For five years, she has been operating a pastry business in Redlight outside of Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 6,000 LRD portion of this 28,000 LRD group loan to buy more flour, sugar, butter, yeast, etc.  

She describes herself as an honest and friendly woman whose dream is to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy more flour, sugar, butter, yeast, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of cement

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more bags of used clothes

loans.name: G.s. El Calvario Group

texts.es: La señora Marina Isabel tiene 38 años es madre soltera y tiene 3 hijos de 3, 6 y 14 años respectivamente. Marina se dedica a la venta de pan, ella tiene más de cuatro años de dedicarse a esta actividad la cual dio inicio con recursos propios vendiendo de manera ambulante, pero ahora vende en un lugar fijo. Cabe señalarse en principio fue con ayuda y apoyo de un familiar que pudo arrancar con su negocio. Ella solicita este crédito para invertirlo en la compra de más pan, siempre con el objetivo de vender más y ganar más. Otra integrante del grupo es Doña Francisca Paula, la cual tiene 51 años es casada y tiene 3 hijos los cuales ya son mayores de edad. Ella se dedica a la venta de camas de madera y también a la venta de camioncitos de madera de juguete de manera ambulante, pese a que también realiza entregas a los departamentos de Masaya y Granada. Ella inicio con este negocio desde hace 6 años debido a la falta de empleo que aqueja el país y buscando una alternativa para sufragar los gastos del hogar. Ella solicita este crédito con el objetivo de invertirlo en la compra de materia prima para la elaboración de los camioncitos de madera, que es lo que actualmente posee más demanda.  Así podrán invertir en materia prima para sus negocios.
texts.en:
Marina Isabel is 38 years old. She is a single mother with three children, 3, 6, and 14 years of age. For four years, Marina’s business has been selling bread. She started the business with her own funds and the help of a family member. Initially she worked as a roving vendor but now sells from a fixed location. Marina is seeking this loan to invest in purchasing more bread, always with the objective of selling more and earning more. 

The other member of this group is Francisca Paula; a 51-year-old married woman with three grown children. Francisca sells wooden beds and wooden toy trucks as a roving vendor. She also delivers her products to the departments of Masaya and Granada. She began the business six years ago because of the lack of jobs in the country. She was looking for an alternative way of meeting her household expenses. Francisca will use this loan to invest in raw materials for making wooden toy trucks, which are now in high demand.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more sacks of water and more rice, fish, meat, seasonings, pepper, salt, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more rice, slippers, soap, etc.

loans.name: Lidia Ruth

texts.es: Lidia Ruth ella tiene 27 años. Lidia se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general.  los cuales distribuye en su casa de habitación y de manera ambulante Ella empezó con este negocio desde hace 5 años, el cual dio inicio debido a una alternativa para sufragar los gastos de su hogar pues tenía cierta experiencia en el negocio. Luego ella observo que el mismo era rentable, por lo que lo ha mantenido subsistiendo ahora con ingresos de ella. Ella solicita este crédito con el objetivo de invertirlo en la compra de mercadería para el negocio. Su sueño es llegar a tener un negocio grande, que sea de capital propio para obtener mayores ganancias y de esta manera poder subsistir ella y su esposo.
texts.en:
Lidia is 27 years old and sells general merchandise from her own house and on the streets.  She began this business nearly 5 years ago to help with family costs.  She had some experience in the business.

Lidia soon observed that the business was profitable, and she has kept it going with her own earnings. She is requesting this loan to invest in merchandise for her business.

Lidia's dream is to turn this into a large business, with her own capital, in order to obtain larger earnings and consequently, for her husband and her to be able to subsist.

loans.use: TO BUY MERCHANDISE FOR HER GENERAL STORE

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
The Kiva borrower is a 28 year old married woman living with her husband and two young children. She has been working as a baker for over ten years. She specializes in preparing special Lebanese bread knowing as “saj”. Her freshly prepared goods are enjoyed by members of her village and neighboring towns. With her business income, she helps her husband with the household.

Today, she is requesting to borrow $800 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase a flour machine. Her bakery is an important source of income for her family. Lebanon has many pastry shops and bakeries and it is easy to buy fresh goods in one’s village or neighborhood.

loans.use: to purchase flour machine

loans.name: Marbella Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario se llama "Marbella" se encuentra localizado en la comunidad de Jaloxtoc, Ayala, en el estado de Morelos, México. Esta conformado por 5 integrantes que se conocen y son vecinas, ellas son:
**Ángela T. A. va a comprar con su préstamo libretas, lápices, sacapuntas etc. para surtir su papelería y medicamentos vitaminas para surtir su farmacia
**Juana Alicia González Hernández va a comprar masa, carnes frías, carnes rojas, vasos, platos, cucharas desechables para su negocio de venta de comida
**Sara D. T. va a comprar azúcar, huevo, aceite, papel higiénico, refrescos, etc. para surtir su tienda.
**Valentina Silvia A. B. va a compra Topperware y zapatos para surtir su negocio.
**Estela Gutiérrez C. va a comprar zapatos para dama es el que más se vende para surtir su negocio. 

La señora Juana Alicia González tiene 36 años de edad, estudio hasta el 5º año de primaria, ella es casada su esposo trabaja como campesino y tiene 3 hijas ellas son Paulina de 15 años está estudiando la preparatoria, Brenda tiene 13 años de edad estudia la secundaria,  Anais tiene 11 años estudia la primaria. La señora Juana Alicia tiene un negocio de comida vende tortas, pozole, refrescos, tostadas, dobladas y solicito su préstamo para invertir en la compra de alimentos masa, carnes frías, carnes rojas, vasos, platos y cucharas desechables para surtir su negocio, inicio su negocio hace 1 año por necesidades económicas, renta un local a cuadra y media de su casa llega caminando a su local, su negocio es importante porque se siente útil, tiene ingresos y aprende a ser independiente y le gusta cocinar, le da gran satisfacción u orgullo poder elaborar su comida para las personas que no son de este lugar y puedan comer sabroso. Ella esta orgullosa con su negocio por que tiene recursos para sus hijas y tiene de donde tomar lo necesario, sus hijas le ayudan a preparan la comida la grande va en la tarde la escuela y la chica en la mañana. Sus clientes son niños, niñas, señores y señoras, atiende de 30 a 40 clientes al día. Las ganancias las utiliza para invertir en lo que haga falta, para ir pagando el préstamo y para ahorrar un poco, este negocio le ha ayudado cuando tiene algunos problemas, para la escuela de las niñas y cuando su esposo no tiene trabajo de ahí tiene para los gastos. Sus sueños para el futuro son poder agrandar el negocio un poco más de comida diferente tener variedad de comida. La señora Juana Alicia está muy contenta con el préstamo que le proporcionan porque me le va a servir para lo que me haga falta. Las mejorías que desea lograr para sus hijas son que pudieran lograr una profesión y lo piensa lograr invirtiendo el préstamo en la comida, echarle ganas al trabajo. El pueblo de Jaloxtoc es bonito,  es muy tranquilo, no hay delincuencia, la gente le gusta ayudarse entre sí. Los integrantes del grupo quieren decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “Gracias y que nos sigan apoyando con más préstamos, les agradecemos su confianza”.
texts.en:
This solidarity group, called "Marbella", is located in the community of Jaloxtoc, Ayala, in the State of Morelos in Mexico. It is comprised of five members who know each other and are neighbors. They are:
  • Angela T. A., who will use her loan to buy notebooks, pencils, pencil sharpeners, etc. for her paper store as well as medicine and vitamins for her drugstore,
  • Juana Alicia González Hernández, who will buy baking mixture, frozen meat, red meat, disposable glasses, plates and spoons for her food business,
  • Sara D. T., who will buy sugar, eggs, oil, toilet paper and soft drinks to stock up her store,
  • Valentina Silvia A. B., who will buy Tupperware and shoes to stock up her business,
  • Estela Gutiérrez C., who will buy ladies' shoes to stock up her store, because shoes are in high demand.
Ms Juana Alicia González is 36 years old, studied until fifth grade and is married to an agricultural laborer. They have three daughters: Paulina is 15 and attends a three-year pre-university course, Brenda is 13 and attends high school, and Anais is 11 and goes to elementary school. Ms Juana Alicia has a food business; she sells pies, pozole (stew made with pork or chicken and corn), soft drinks, tostadas (fried corn pancakes) and dobladas. She applies for a loan to buy baking mixture, frozen meat, red meat, disposable glasses, plates and spoons to stock up her business. She started her business a year ago for economic reasons. She rented her premises within walking distance from her home, one and a half blocks away. Her business is important to her because she feels useful, has an income and learns to be independent. She loves to cook and gets a lot of satisfaction from preparing dishes for visiting people who can enjoy a tasty meal. She is proud that her business gives her all the necessary resources to provide for her daughters. Her daughters help her to prepare the dishes; the eldest girl attends school in the afternoon and the younger one in the morning. Her customers are all kinds of people, boys and girls, men and women, all in all she serves 30 to 40 customers a day. The earnings are used to invest in necessary ingredients, repay her loan and save some money. Her business helped her when she faced economic challenges, because she was able to pay for the girls' school and other expenses when her husband had no work. Her dream for the future is to expand her business and offer a greater variety of dishes. Ms Juana Alicia is very happy with the granted loan because it helps her to pay for what she needs. The improvement she wants to achieve is that her daughters become professionals and that she can invest in more food and earn an income from her work. The residents of Jaloxtoc are nice and very quiet, there are no crimes and people love to help each other. The group members want to say to Kiva and Fundación Realidad: "Thank you, and please keep on helping us with more loans. We are grateful for your trust."

loans.use: To purchase baking mixture, frozen meat, red meat, disposable glasses, plates and spoons to stock up her business

loans.name: Oscar Leonel

texts.es: Oscar Leonel tiene 44 años, su actividad es brindar el servicio de transporte Hace más de 10 años. El es un hombre muy trabajador y responsable pues sabe que tiene hacerse cargo de sus 2 hijos menores de edad a su cargo. Su esposa quien ayuda a su negocio a sufragar los gastos del hogar, vende productos de la zermat y Avon, juntos trabajan para mejorar las condiciones de su hogar. Este negocio lo aprendió por su propia cuenta y fue por ahorros que tenía conservado que compro su propia unidad y así empezó con este servicio. Es por eso que solicita este crédito para la compra de repuestos para su unidad de transporte.
texts.en:
Oscar Leonel is 44 years old and has worked in transportation for more than 10 years. He is a hardworking and responsible man because he knows he has to take care of his 2 young children. His wife helps him defray the costs of maintaining their home by selling Zermat and Avon products. Together, they work to improve their family's living conditions. 

Oscar Leonel started his business on his own, using his savings to buy his own vehicle. He is requesting a loan to buy replacement parts for his transport vehicle.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Reynaldo Antonio

texts.es: El señor Reynaldo Antonio es casado y tiene tres hijos los cuales son menores de edad. El señor Reynaldo posee  la administración de renta de apartamentos. Este negocio está ubicado contiguo al instituto Juan José Rodríguez,  en donde llegan un sin número de clientes él está muy feliz con su medio de vida ya que habla con mucha personas. Reynaldo dio inicio a su negocio hace 20 años, cabe señalar que este negocio fue heredado por su mama, ya que ella tenía dos casas y Reynaldo siguió con esta actividad. El crédito será invertido en la compra de mobiliarios, ropa de camas, y otras cosas para brindar un buen servicio. Su meta principal es llegar a construir un hotel, que pueda servir como fuente ingresos.
texts.en:
Reynaldo Antonio is married and has 3 young children. He manages rented apartments. The apartments are adjacent to Instituto Juan José Rodríguez, which provides him with a steady number of tenants. He is very happy with his way of life and the opportunity to interact with to many people. Reynaldo started his business 20 years ago; it was passed on to him by his mother, who already had 2 houses and left the apartments to him to manage. 

This loan will be invested in furniture, bed linens, and other items to furnish the apartments well. Reynaldo's goal is to build a hotel, which will provide him with a good source of income.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of peanuts

loans.name: Zoila Maria

texts.es:
La señora Zoila María Álvarez es comerciante  desde hace 30 años vende revistas y novelas usadas,  tiene su clientela a las que les gusta su producto.
Tiene 2 años y medios de trabajar con nuestra institución en los cuales todos estos financiamientos los ha solicitado para compra de mercadería para su negocio ella coloca su mercadería a sus amistades 
Es madre soltera cuida a sus nietos en tiempos libres pero se dedica a su trabajo fuertemente para salir adelante con los financiamientos que Ceprodel le ha brindado ha mejorado su casa poco a poco y sus ventas se mantienen su calidad de vida también la ha venido mejorando.
texts.en:
Sra. Zoila María Álvarez is a merchant who has been selling magazines and used novels for 30 years. Her customers enjoy her products.

She has worked with CEPRODEL for 2½ years. All of the loans she has requested were used to buy merchandise for her business, which she then sells to her friends. Zoila is a single mother who cares for her grandchildren in her free time, but she is strongly committed to her work so that she can get ahead. As a result of the loans CEPRODEL has provided, she has been able to gradually make repairs to her house, maintain her sales, and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her magazine stand

loans.name: Maria Lucrecia

texts.es: Maria Lucrecia tiene 65 años es casada y posee 6 hijos mayores de edad. La señora Maria tiene aproximadamente 9 años de dedicarse a la venta de mercadería en general, la cual vende de forma ambulante. Ella empezó con una pequeña cantidad de ropa, con capital propio. Todos los fines de semana visita a sus amistades, vecinos y familiares para ofrecer sus productos, a pesar de que toda la semana pasaba en su trabajo, guardaba energías para  los fines de semana. Después poco a poco fue introduciéndose al negocio de la venta de cosméticos y adornos. Pues es así que ella busca la forma de generar ingresos a su hogar. Solicita es crédito para la compra de materia prima. Su sueño es  dedicarse específicamente a la administración de su negocio.
texts.en: Maria Lucrecia is 65 years old.  She is married and has 6 grown-up children.  Maria has been selling goods in general for approximately 9 years.  She sells them in an itinerant manner.  She started out with a small quantity of clothes, with her own capital.  Every weekend she would visit her friends, neighbors and family members to offer her products.  In spite of the fact that she worked in her job all week, she still kept energy for the weekends.  Then, little by little, she started introducing cosmetics and decorations into her sales business in an attempt to create more income for her household.  She is requesting this loan to buy supplies.  Her dream is to devote herself to the running of her business.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Silvia Elena

texts.es:
La Señora Silvia Elena M. A. es comerciante del Mercado Central desde hace cuatro años tiene un puesto de venta de ropa. Es casada tiene tres hijos dos de ellos en edad escolar cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, su negocio lo inicio con un capital de C$ 3,000.00  que fueron aporte de su esposo, poco inventario, antes ella se dedicaba a cuidar a sus hijos y  su casa pero quiso poner un negocio para no depender de nadie y con esta situación económica que estamos atravesando contar con otros ingresos ya que son tres niños los que hay que mantener y actualmente está esperando a otro.
La Señora M. A. tiene 1 año de trabajar con ceprodel en los cuales los financiamientos obtenidos por nosotros le han servido de mucho ya que su inventario ha incrementado ha podido sacar adelante a sus niños se esfuerza por ellos y para ellos trabaja diario busca la manera de cómo colocar la mercadería en otros tramos dejándola al crédito y cobrando al  diario.
texts.en:
Sra. Silvia Elena M. A. is a merchant at the Central Market where she been managing a clothing stand for the past four years. She is married and has three children, two of whom are in school. With the support of her husband, Silvia was able to start her business with capital of 3000 NIO that he gave her to acquire a small inventory. Previously her only responsibility was to take care of the house and the children, but she wanted to have a business so that she would not become dependent on anyone. With the current economic situation, Silvia needed another form of income in order to support her three children and another one coming soon.

Sra. M. A. has been working with CEPRODEL for the past year and used the loans she obtained to increase her inventory. This has allowed her children to move forward. Every day Silvia looks for different ways to display her merchandise. She extends credit and collects payments on a daily basis.

loans.use: Purchase undergarments for adults & children

loans.name: Dulce Maria

texts.es: La señora Dulce Maria, tiene 35 años es una mujer casada y tiene 1 hijo el cual aun es menor de edad. Hace más 5 años de dedicarse a la venta de repostería y comida, ubicada en su casa de habitación. Ella dio inicio a este negocio ante la necesidad que sufría de ingresos para la manutención de su familia en general. Por lo que con todo el esfuerzo logro obtener capital propio, y en parte de su familia que la apoyaron para establecer este negocio. El financiamiento será invertido en la compra de repostería, ya que actualmente tiene un buen pedido. Su deseo es de establecer un cafetín y que le brinden mayores ingresos a ella y su familia.
texts.en: Dulce Maria is 35  years old.  She is married and has one son who is still a child.  She began her business selling confectionery and other food more than 5 years ago.  The business is located in her house.  She started this business out of necessity because she didn't have enough income to support her family in general.  With a lot of effort she managed to obtain her own capital and also some from her family who supported her in setting up her business.  This loan will be used to buy confectionery since she currently has a good order.  Her wish is to set up a small café and to make a better income for herself and her family.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more furniture

loans.name: Jazmin Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario se llama "Jazmín", se encuentra localizado en Barrio San Pedro, Acteopan, en el estado de Puebla, México, este grupo está conformado por 5 integrantes mujeres que se conocen y son vecinas, la señora Irene C. A. es la representante del grupo, ella tiene 63 años de edad, no fue a la escuela, tiene 5 hijos ellos son Minerva de 28 años de edad, Ángeles de 38 años de edad, Santos Mario tiene 27 años de edad, Simón tiene 25 años de edad trabaja la alfarería elabora cazuelas, ollas, jarros, Luis Yovani tiene 14 años está estudiando la secundaria y también le ayuda a atender a los clientes, a poner la greta en bolsas para venderla por kilo. 
Las integrantes del grupo son:
**Petra A. M. y va a comprar con su crédito barro para elaboración de sus ollas, cazuelas, para venderlas crudas. 
**Jorgina B. T. va a comprar leña para quemar la loza por que ya se le termino.
**Margarita M. V. va a comprar leña, greta, barro para la elaboración de las cazuelas y jarros.
**María Myriam Guzmán C. va a comprar aceite, azúcar, arroz, dulces, jugos etc. para elaboración de las quesadillas.
**Irene C. A. va a comprar ollas, cazuelas, leña, greta para surtir su negocio porque también vende leña. Los integrantes del grupo quieren decir a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad, “muchas gracias por el apoyo, por confiar en nosotros y vamos a trabajarlo para no quedar mal”. La señora Irene tiene su negocio de compra-venta de greta y loza ollas, cazuelas, jarros, candeleros, sumerios y ornatos para el hogar, ella solicito su préstamo para comprar  greta, ollas, cazuelas, jarros, candeleros, sumerios y ornatos para tener surtido su negocio, también quiere terminar su casa poner el techo de loza, el piso, las ventanas y las puertas y revocar las paredes para que ya se pueda pasar a su casa y arreglar bonito su local. La señora Irene inicio su negocio hace 4 años aprendió lo del negocio por necesidad, tenía hijos en la escuela y no tenía dinero, su esposo se fue a los estados unidad a trabajar pero tenía poco trabajo lo poco que ganaba lo ahorraba comenzó con bultos de loza con 5 bultos me alcanzaba llego un cliente que le compro todo y fue comprando mas y no lo gastaba seguía comprando y sus hijos le entendían no compraban todo lo ahorraban los voy invirtiendo en loza, lo que mandaba su esposo de los estados unidos lo ocupaba para los alimentos y los puerquitos, su negocio está en su casa en San Marcos, estado de Puebla, su negocio es importante porque tiene dinero para darle a su hijo que está estudiando la secundaria, para material, libros y le gusta trabajar elaborando las ollas y las cazuelas y le gusta comprar para que se vea mas y se vea bien y no les falte lo que los clientes pidan, está muy contenta con todo lo que ella vende, su proveedor de Puebla que le surte la greta le da crédito de 15 o 20 días para pagar, sus clientes son de todos los lugares de San Bartolo, Santa Maria, le compran por kilo la  greta y por bulto las cazuelas, las ollas, los jarros. Su negocio es popular porque todas las personas lo conocen, su negocio no tiene competencia  aunque en San Marcos todos se dedican a la alfarería cada cliente sabe donde compra, las ganancias los utiliza invirtiendo comprando mas loza y en la greta, su esposo también trabaja sale a vender al mercado de Tenancingo, estado de México  y en otros negocios la alfarería y el aporta para la alimentación y para los gastos de la casa, ella quiere ampliar el negocio arreglar y surtirse pero ahorita no puede porque no es su casa es de su hijo, ya que su casa esté terminada se va a cambiar y va a poner su tienda tipo galería y arregle la alfarería como ella quiere y lo piensa lograr trabajando y con las ganancias. En el Pueblo de San Marcos nadamas siembran en temporada de lluvia casi todos se dedican a la alfarería, son bonitas las fiestas patronales el 2º domingo de Enero se festeja el Dulce Nombre de Jesús, hay misas, chínelos, baile, el 25 y 26 de Abril es la fiesta de San Marcos. La señora Irene comenta que este negocio le ha ayudado a sacar a su familia adelante y sus sueños son ver terminada su casa para arreglar todo lo que falte y poner el local de loza tipo galera para que se vea bien y surtirla y verla crecer. Ella está muy contenta con este préstamo que le proporcionan, las mejoras para el futuro de sus hijos son que salgan adelante y que aprendan lo que ella está realizando y lo piensa realizar echándole ganas, trabajando y este préstamo que nos eta ayudando está muy contenta al saber que hay personas como ustedes que le ayudan a lograr sus sueños.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called “Jazmín”.  It is located in San Pedro neighborhood in Acteopan, in the state of Puebla, Mexico.  It has 5 female members who know each other and are neighbors.  Mrs Irene C. A. is the group's representative.  She is 63 years old and didn't go to school.  She has 5 children: Minerva who is 28; Ángeles, 38; Santos Mario, 27; Simón, 25 (a potter who makes earthenware cooking pots and jugs) and Luis Yovani, 14 (who is at high school and also helps serve customers, put clay in bags and sell it by the kilo).

The other members of the group are:

** Petra A. M. who will use her loan to buy clay to make cooking pots to then sell them unfired.
** Jorgina B. T. who will buy firewood to fire the earthenware because she has none left.
** Margarita M. V. who will buy firewood, white clay and clay to make earthenware pots and jugs.
** María Myriam Guzmán C. who will buy oil, sugar, rice, sweets, juice etc. for her quesadilla business
** Irene C. A. who will buy pots, firewood and clay to stock her business

The members of the group would like to say to Kiva and Fundación Realidad “Many thanks for your support and for having faith in us.  We are going to work hard so that we do not let you down”.  

Irene has a business buying and selling different types of clay, earthenware pots, jugs, candlesticks and decorations for the home.  She is requesting her loan to buy more of these products in order to stock her business.  She also wants to finish building her house, installing a cement roof and floor, windows and doors, and plaster the walls so that she can go round and fix it up nicely.

Irene set up her business 4 years ago.  She learned about her business out of necessity.  She had children in school and she didn't have any money.  Her husband went to the United States to work but had little work.  The little money that he earned he saved.

She started off selling packages of earthenware.  She started out with 5 packages and was approached by a customer who bought it all and kept buying from her.  The family didn't spend the money but used it to keep buying and selling.  They invested the money in buying more earthenware.  The money she received from her husband in the US covered their food expenses.

Irene's business is located in her house in San Marcos, in the state of Puebla.  Her business is very  important to her because it means she has money to give to her son who is studying at high school and needs books and other material.  Irene likes making earthenware pots and she also likes to buy so that she has more stock which is well displayed and so that she can provide her customers with everything they require.  She is very happy with everything that she sells. 

Irene's provider in Puebla sells her clay on credit, giving her 15 or 20 days to pay.  Her customers are from all over San Bartolo and Santa Maria.  They buy clay from her by the kilo and buy the pots and jugs in bulk.  Her business is popular because everybody knows her.  It has no competition.  Although everybody in San Marcos is in the pottery business, customers all know where to buy from.  Irene's profits are re-invested in buying more earthenware and clay.

Irene's husband also now works.  He sells earthenware products in the market in Tenancingo in the state of Mexico and to other businesses.  Between this and the pottery store, they have money for  food and to cover household expenses.  Irene would like to expand her business, fix it up and stock it well but right now she can't because her own home isn't finished yet, so it is currently in her son's home.  She plans install a type of gallery in her store and fix the pottery store the way she wants it.  She hopes to achieve this by working and with her profits.

The 'fiestas patronales' (celebrations for the feast day of a town's patron saint) are very pretty in San Marcos. The 2nd Sunday in January is the 'Dulce Nombre de Jesús' (Sweet Name of Jesus) fiesta.  There are religious masses and 'chinelos' (traditional dances).  The 25th and 26th of April is the date for the San Marcos fiesta.

Irene comments that her business has helped her to improve her family's lives.  Her dreams are to see her house finished and to set up her gallery in her store so that everything is well displayed.  She wants to stock it well and see it grow.  She is very happy to receive this loan.  It will help improve her children's future and help them to get ahead.  She intends to achieve her goals through effort, hard work and this loan which is helping them a lot.  She is happy to know that there are people such as yourself who will help her to achieve her dreams.
