loans.use: Purchase of clay, earthenware pots, jugs, candlesticks and decorations for the home

location.town: Barrio San Pedro, Acteopan, Estado de Puebla

loans.name: Dionisio  Efraín

texts.es: El señor Dionisio G. A. es comerciante del Bisne mayoreo se dedica al servicio de transporte de Chinandega león y Corinto desde hace 15 años es soltero no tiene hijos a su cargo tiene cuatro años y medio de trabajar con Ceprodel en los cuales los financiamientos le han servido para reparación de su microbús y mejoramiento de su casa la cual la ha venido mejorando poco a poco
texts.en: Sr. Dionisio G. A. is a businessman at the wholesale market in Bisne.  He has been providing transportation services to Chinandega, León, and Corinto for 15 years.  Dionisio is single and does not have children.  He has been working with CEPRODEL for 4½ years and has used the loans to make repairs to his minibus and gradually make improvements to his home.

loans.use: Purchase tires & reupholster the seats of his minibus

loans.name: Alicia Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Alicia Del Carmen  tiene 34 años es casada y con su pareja tiene  2 hijos menores de edad a su cargo. Ella se dedica a la venta de calzado, entre lo que sobresale la venta de zapatos, deportivos, sandalias, zapatillas, chinelas de baño, pantuflas entre otros. La señora ya tiene 7 años de haber empezado con su negocio,  inicio vendiendo en su casa, fue así que la mayoría de sus clientes la conocen. El crédito será invertido en la compra de mercancías, ya que si compra en este momento y vende en noviembre o diciembre, sus ganancias se incrementan ya que es ahora cuando los precios están bajos. Además ella desea diversificar sus mercancías e introducirse a vender otros tipos de calzado. El sueño siempre ha sido realizar mejoras a su casa, por lo que también quiere comprar un modulo en el mercado.
texts.en:
Alicia Del Carmen, 34, is married with two young children. She sells footwear, including shoes, sports shoes, sandals, trainers, bath slippers, flip flops and more. She started her business 7 years ago, initially selling from home, and that's how most of her customers know her. 

She will invest the loan in the purchase of goods. At the moment prices are low so if she buys now she can sell in November or December at a profit. She would also like to diversify her business and start selling other kinds of footwear. Her dream has always been to improve her home, and to that purpose she would also like to buy a stall at the local market.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a consignment of drugs

loans.name: G.s. Los Menudos Group

texts.es: La señora Martha Maria tiene 48 años, es madre soltera y tiene 1 hijo de 17 años de edad. La señora se dedica a la venta de ropa usada de paca, principalmente pantalones y camisas y además también vende peluches usados, al por mayor y al detalle. Ella tiene un pequeño tramo ubicado en el mercado en el cual vende sus productos. Ella inicio este negocio con capital propio buscando una fuente de ingresos para mantener a su hijo, el cual ya ahora es bastante mayor y le ayuda en su venta. Ella solicita el crédito con el propósito de comprar más mercadería para lograr las ventas de Navidad en la cual las ventas se incrementan. Otro integrante del grupo es Don Carlos, el cual tiene 36 años es casado y tiene una hija de 5 años de edad. El señor tiene en su hogar un servicio de vulcanización de vehículos y además posee una venta de repuestos de vehículos. El inicio este negocio desde hace 10 años, el cual el continuo debido a que en principio era su papa el propietario y que administraba el negocio. El señor solicita el préstamo para realizar compra de materiales de repuestos para vehículos, con el objetivo de incrementar sus ventas.
texts.en: Martha Maria is 48 years old, is a single mother and has one son who is 17 years old. She sells used clothing in bulk, mainly pants and shirts. Furthermore, she sells second-hand stuff toys both separately and in bulk. She has a small space located in the market where she sells her products. She started this business with her own money while looking for a source of income to take care of her son. He is older now and he helps her with her sales. She is asking for a loan with the goal of buying more merchandise to keep up with Christmas demand when sales tend to increase. The other partner in the group is Don Carlos. He is 36 years old, married and has a five year-old daughter. At his home he has a vulcanization service for cars. He also sells used car parts. He started his business ten years ago and continued thanks to his father who owned and ran the business. Don Carlos is seeking a loan to be able to buy replacement vehicle parts with the goal of increasing his sales.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to prepare for the christmas season

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es: Teresa M. B. de oficio secretaria labora para UPONIC es soltera y solicita crédito para ampliar su habitación comprar playsen y madera, clavos y mano de obra. Agradece a CEPRODEL por su beligerancia.
texts.en: Teresa M. B. is an office secretary who works for UPONIC. She is single and is seeking a loan to improve her home. She would like to buy fiberboard building material, wood and nails and she would like to hire a worker. She thanks CEPRODEL for its activism.

loans.use: Home improvement

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of peanuts

loans.name: Liliette Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Liliette Del Carmen  ella tiene 28 años, es casada. Su  negocio  es la venta de repuestos de bicicleta, ella trabaja todos los días además algunas veces viaja a otros departamentos en donde encuentra estos productos mucho más accesibles. Hace más de 5 años que dio inicio a este negocio, en la búsqueda de ingresos para brindar una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos. El crédito será invertido en la compra de pedales, asientos, cadenas, grasa, termos entre otras cosas ya que se acercan una muy buena temporada de venta y ella desea aprovechar comprar en este momento en que los precios están un poco bajos. Su sueño es llegar es poner una establecimiento en el mercado para obtener más clientes.
texts.en: Mrs Liliette Del Carmen is 28 years old and married.  Her business is selling bicycle parts.  She works every day and sometimes travels to other districts where these products are much more easily obtained.  She began this business 5 years ago as she searched for income to provide her children with a better quality of life.  The loan will be used to buy pedals, seats, chains, oil, water bottles, etc. since a good sales season is approaching and she wants to be able to take advantage and buy these articles while prices are quite low.  Her dream is to set up her own premises in the market in order to get more customers.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more consignments of drugs

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es: Maria Auxiliadora tiene 53 años, su actividad económica es un pequeño kiosco. Hace más de 8 años que tiene esta actividad, pues inicio como una opción porque no tenía un trabajo y no ganaba un salario que le ayudara a sufragar los gastos de su hogar, también tiene 2 hijos que ya son independiente y ayudan a Maria en lo que pueden con el negocio, por lo que las compras de sus productos tiene que hacerlos en el mercado pues así los compra a un precio más accesible. Con el financiamiento comprara golosinas, pan, galletas, jugos, refrescos, helados entre otras cosas. Sueña con mejorar su actividad económica y seguir adelante.
texts.en: Maria Auxiliadora is 53 years old and her business is a small kiosk.  She has been working at her kiosk for more than 8 years.  She began in this business because she didn't have a job and wasn't earning a wage which would help her to cover her household expenses.  She also has 2 children who are no longer dependent on her and help Maria as much as they can with the business.  For this reason, products have to be purchased in the market as that way they can be bought at a more affordable price.  With this loan she will buy candies, bread, cookies, juice, soft drinks and ice creams amongst other things.  She dreams of improving her business activity and getting ahead.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Julio Jose

texts.es: Julio José tiene 38 años, su actividad es la elaboración de artesanía. Hace más de 14 años que tiene este negocio, por lo que ha sido muy satisfactorio para él y su familia, el tiene 2 hijo a su cargo ya que es un padre muy responsable y se preocupa por proporcionarle los ingresos necesarios. No es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos para mejorar su negocio. El cuenta con su propio taller elaborando los diferentes productos como hoyas, vasijas, adornos, floreros y tinajas. Es por eso que solicita este crédito para la compra de materia prima para la elaboración de sus productos.
texts.en: Julio José is 38 years old.  His business is making handicrafts.  He has been in this business for more than 14 years and it has been very rewarding for him and his family.  He has 2 children in his care since he is a very responsible father and he worries about making enough income for them.  This is not the first time that he has taken loans to improve his business.  He has his own workshop where he makes his products such as basins, earthenware pots, ornaments, vases and large earthenware jars.  This is why he is requesting this loan, to buy raw materials to make his products.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Miguel Antonio

texts.es: Miguel Antonio tiene 38 años, tiene en su casa de habitación un negocio de pulpería. Sus ventas en su mayoría son de contado pues siempre esta depositando mucho empeño para  ofrecer un buen servicio a sus clientes. El inicio en este negocio desde hace 10 años, por lo que fue él el que estableció el negocio primeramente con muy pocos productos como es golosinas, refrescos y pan así con estas pequeñas cosas fue que empezó a llamar la atención de sus clientes. El está solicitando este crédito con el objetivo de comprar materias prima. Algo que él hace es mantener la oferta de su producto a un precio que sea accesible a las personas. Su sueño es agrandar el negocio y por supuesto llegar a obtener mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Miguel Antonio, 38, runs a grocery store from his home. He mostly sells in cash and he always tries very hard to provide good customer service. He started the business 10 years ago. Initially the store only stocked a few products, such as sweets, soft drinks and bread; it was these little things that began to attract the customers' attention. 

He is requesting the loan to buy raw materials. He would like to keep his product offering at a price that everyone can pay. His dream is to expand his store and of course to get higher revenues.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more milk, bread, sugar, radio batteries, soap, sardines, candles,  etc

loans.name: Rebeca Del Socorro

texts.es:
REBECA DEL SOCORRO A. G., Trabaja como Operador de Cómputos en el Mercado Iván Montenegro.es madre de familia de un niño y este se encuentra en el colegio.
el prestamo solicitado es para la compra de materiales de construccion como ; arena, cemento y piedra para construir un baño en su casa de habitacion.
texts.en:
Rebeca del Socorro A. G. works as a computer operator at the Iván Montenegro Market. She is the mother of a child who is attending high school.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy construction materials such as sand, cement, and stone in order to build a bathroom for her home.

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to build a bathroom

loans.name: Oswalda

texts.es: Oswalda tiene 50 años, es separada, viven con sus tres hijos en su casa propia, ella es una mujer muy luchadora, es así que poco a poco ha logrado construir su casa. Oswalda posee una tienda, siendo su única fuente de ingreso y por tal es la que más temprano abre para el público, debido a que madruga para ir al mercado mayoristas y poder abastecerse de verduras y frutas frescas para  su negocio, ya que son alimentos no perecibles y de lo que tiene mucha demanda como el pan de cada día. A media mañana no le queda mercadería alguna, y eso le da mucha satisfacción, por lo que le resulta rentable su trabajo. Además de esté trabajo, también se dedica a vender queques y gelatinas que ella misma prepara. Lo que mas le gusta negocio, es conversar con sus clientes, además tiene víveres que no logra vender lo cual lo utiliza para el menú familiar. Es así que lleva 6 años en esta actividad y lo que considera más difícil es cargar las bolsas de compras, ya que sufre de lumbalgia. En adelante tiene planeado construir el segundo piso de su casa. Este es su noveno crédito con MFP y se compromete a ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas, para no traerle complicaciones a su banco comunal. Con el crédito que solicita, va comprar alimentos de primera necesidad, para que su bodega esté provista de diversos productos y que sean del gusto de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Oswalda is 50 years old.  She is separated and lives with her three children in her own home.  She is very much a fighter and as a result she has managed, little by little, to build her own home.

Oswalda owns a store which is her sole source of income and, for that reason, hers is the store that opens earliest to the public.  She gets up very early in the morning to go to the wholesale market in order to be able to stock her business with fresh fruit and vegetables as they are perishable foods for which she has a lot of demand.  By mid morning she has no merchandise left and this makes her feel very satisfied and means that her work is very profitable.

In addition to this work, she also sells cakes and jellies (jell-o) which she makes herself.  What she likes most about her business is chatting to her customers and also the fact that the provisions which she doesn't manage to sell she uses for her family's meals.  She has been in this business for 6 years and the most difficult thing about her work is packing shopping bags since she suffers from lower back pain.  In the future she is planning to add a second level to her house.  This is her ninth loan from MFP and she pledges to be punctual in her repayments in order to avoid making things difficult for her community bank.  She will use the loan that she is requesting to buy basic foodstuffs so that her store is stocked with a range of products which will please her customers.

loans.use: To buy basic foodstuffs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase a household appliance

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more milk, bread, sugar, radio batteries, soap, sardines, candles etc

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more cartons of milk, radio batteries, crates of soft drinks, bags of sugar etc

loans.name: Mario Jose

texts.es:
MARIO JOSE V. J., Trabaja Como Vigilante en el mercado Mayoreo de Managua, es padre de famillia de un hijo y este actualmente se encuentran en la universidad.
elprestamo solicitado es para la compra de materiales de construccion como , cemento y arena para repllar algunas paredes de su casa de habitacion.
texts.en:
Mario Jose V. J. works as a security guard at the Managua Wholesale Market. He is the father of a child who is currently attending university.

The loan he is requesting will be used to buy construction materials, such as cement and sand, so that he can repair some of the walls in his house.

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to repair some of the walls in his house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase materials needed to repair a room

loans.name: Sali

texts.fr:
Âgée de 46 ans, Sali B. est une femme mariée et mère de six enfants qui réside avec son époux et leurs enfants à Mamassoni, un des quartiers périphériques de la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
   N’ayant pas eu la chance d’avancer à l’école pour des raisons sociales, cette dame s’est initiée depuis plus de dix ans à cette activité de petit commerce d’achat et de vente des pagnes wax, des tissus brodés,  des bazins teintés, etc.). Elle est beaucoup sollicitée surtout de sa clientèle (composée essentiellement des femmes) pour la qualité de ses produits.
   Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis plus de cinq ans. Elle a bénéficié  de plusieurs prêts solidaires (prêt de groupe) dans une association des femmes de son quartier. Elle est actuellement à son douzième individuel qui lui permettra d’acheter, 8 complets de tissus brodés, 18 pièces de pagnes wax, 8 complets de bazin “moins riche” en couleur à Bamako. Tous ses prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.                                                                                                    Elle dispose d’une place au niveau du marché de leur quartier où elle vend ses marchandises au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée essentiellement des femmes. Elle amène souvent ses marchandises dans les localités environnantes de la ville de Sikasso les jours de leur foires pour être vendues
    Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 215 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Sali B. is 46 years old. She is a married woman and mother of six children. She lives with her spouse and their children in Mamassoni, one of the outlying neighborhoods of the town of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

This woman never had the opportunity to make a go of her schooling because of socio-economic reasons. Ten years ago she taught herself a small business activity, purchasing and selling “pagnes wax” [wrap around fabric Wax Hollandais], embroidered cloth, and dyed damask etc…. She is very much sought after, especially by her customers (made up mostly of women) because the quality of her products.

With the intention of better meet her ever increasing customers’ demand she decided, five years ago, to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. She has received several solidarity loans (group loans) in a neighborhood woman’s association. This is currently her twelfth individual loan which will enable her to buy 8 sets of embroidered cloth, 18 bolts of “pagnes wax”, 8 sets of less-rich damask in color, in Bamako. All her previous loans have been fully reimbursed.

She has a stall at the neighborhood market where she sells her merchandise for cash or on credit to customers who are mostly women. On fair days, she often brings her goods to the villages surrounding the town of Sikasso to sell them.

With this loan, she is planning to make a monthly profit of 215 000 francs CFA which will be used mostly to participate to the family expenses, pay the loan, and invest the rest in her activity.

loans.use: Purchase of clothing

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more body lotion and under clothes

loans.name: Minata

texts.fr:
Minata O. est une veuve de 55 ans, vivant avec ses 4 enfants dans la grande famille de son défunt mari à Kaboïla II, le centre ville de Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Minata O. après avoir mené beaucoup d’activités sans succès, s’est initiée à cette activité de restauration il y’a environ six ans. Elle mène son activité devant une école tous les jours où elle est beaucoup sollicitée de sa clientèle composée d’ élèves et de professeurs pour la qualité de ses produits. 
Pour satisfaire cette clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis plus d’un an. Après un premier prêt individuel bien remboursé, elle sollicite un deuxième prêt individuel pour  acheter, 3 sacs de pomme de terre, 40kg de viande de bœuf, 60kg de poissons frais, 5 litres d’huile alimentaire, 2 paquets de maggi, 2 bidons de vinaigre, 20 sachets d’Attièkè, 1 sac de charbon de bois, des miches de pain,  des bananes (Aloko), etc.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 100 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiale et payer les intérêts de son prêt.
texts.en:
Minata Outtara is a 55-year old widow. She lives with her four children in the extended family of her deceases husband in Kaboila II,  a central district of Sikasso (the third administrative Region of Mali). Having tried various business activities without success, about six years ago Minata Outtara  launched her food preparation business. She cooks her food in front of a school every day. Her business is very popular with customers, students and teachers, because of the high quality of her products. 

In order to meet the ever growing customer demand, more than a year ago she decided to return to the microfinance institution SOro Yiriwaso. After a duly repaid first loan, she is now seeking a third individual loan in order to purchase three bags of potations, 40 kg [approx 90 lbs] of beef, 60 kg [130 lbs], of fresh fish 5 liters [1.3 gal] of vegetable oil, two packs of Maggi bouillon cubes, two jugs of vinegar, 20 packs of  Attièkè [cassava root], 1 bag of charcoal, loaves bread, Aloko bananas [a snack made from fried bananas] etc. 

She plans to achieve a monthly income of 100,000 West Africna Francs, which will essentially be used to increase her working capital, contribute to the family budget and pay off the interest on her loan.

loans.use: Purchasing raw materials for food production

loans.name: Enriqueta

texts.es: Enriqueta S. tiene 66 años, vive con su esposo, quien se dedica a la agricultura.  No tienen hijos. Doña Enriqueta tiene una venta D. regalos en su propia casa, la atienD. todos los días, gustosamente en las tardes. Mientras todos los días muy temprano le acompaña  a su esposo a cultivar, ahora cosechan acelga, brócoli y rábanos. Ella ayuda a un grupo D. su comunidad que se dedica a darles víveres a las personas enfermas. Quiere refinanciar su crédito ya que considera muy buena la temporada, para vender, solicita el credito para comprar articulos para adorno y regalos tales como papel china y papel para forrar regalos  ya que se aserca la epoca D. fin D. año quiere aprovechar para surtir su tienda y vender un poco mas y si seguir ayudando al grupo D. su comunidad.
texts.en:
Enriqueta S. is 66 years old and lives with her husband, who is a farmer.  They do not have children.  Doña Enriqueta has a gift shop in her house that she manages every day, which she likes to do mostly in the afternoons.  During the early morning hours, she helps her husband every day look after their crops.  They currently grow chard, broccoli, and radishes.  Enriqueta helps a community group with providing food for the sick.  

She is seeking financing because it is a good time for making sales.  The loan she is requesting will be used to buy items for decorations and gifts such as tissue paper and gift-wrapping paper.  The year-end season is approaching, so she wants to take advantage of this time to restock her store and generate a few more sales so that she can continue helping her community group.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise, such as tissue paper & gift-wrapping paper

loans.name: Nouhoum

texts.fr:
Âgé de 35 ans, Monsieur Nouhoum D. est marié et père de 4 enfants (2garçons et 2 filles). Il réside dans une grande famille traditionnelle élargie à Hamdallaye, un des quartiers péripheriques de la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
N’ayant pas eu la chance d’aller à l’école et forgeron de catégorie sociale, il s’est vite initié à cette activité familiale depuis très jeune à savoir celle de la forge. Il achète l’aluminium à Bamako pour les transformer en objets de toutes sortes (Marmites, théières, assiettes, cuillères, etc).
Nanti d’une grande expérience et d’une bonne notoriété, il fait l’objet d’une sollicitation sans pareille des clients compte tenu de la qualité de ses services. Aujourd’hui, compte tenu de peu de moyens dont il dispose, il se voit incapable de satisfaire la demande qui est de plus en plus forte. Ainsi, il intégra l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis plus d’un an, il a bénéficié d’un premier prêt très bien remboursé. C’est donc dans le cadre de toujours mieux relancer son activité afin de mieux satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle qui ne cesse d’augmenter qu’il sollicite un deuxième prêt pour acheter, 950kg d’aluminium et quelques matériels supplémentaires.
Avec ce prêt, il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 300 000 FCFA. Les bénéfices qu’il générera de l’exercice de cette activité lui permettront de rembourser son prêt et faire face aux besoins de sa famille, ensuite investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
35 years of age, Mr. Nouhoum D. is married and the father of four (two boys and two girls). He lives in a traditional large extended family in Hamdallaye, a peripheral area of the town of Sikasso (the third administrative district of Mali).

Not having had the chance to attend school and coming from a family of blacksmiths, he quickly learned this family trade early on and became a blacksmith as well. He purchases aluminum in Bamako in order to make various objects out of it (pots, tea kettles, plates, spoons etc).
With his long experience and good business reputation, he is very much in demand as clients appreciate the high quality of his service. At present, given his limited means, he is unable to satisfy the growing customer demand. He joined the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution  over a year ago and already obtained a loan, perfectly repaid.  And so, in order to continue growing his business and better satisfy the growing demand, he is seeking a second loan to purchase 950 kg [approx. 2100 lbs] of aluminum and some additional materials.

With this loan, he plans to achieve a monthly revenue of 300,000 West African Francs. The revenues from this activity will allow him to repay his loan and provide for his family’s needs as well as reinvest the remaining funds into this business.

loans.use: Purchasing aluminum and additional materials

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more door locks, hinges, nails, paint, cutlasses, shovels, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase a refrigerator

loans.name: Marvin Antonio

texts.es:
MARVIN ANTONIO C. C., Trabaja como Oficial de Mantenimiento en el Mercado Israel Lewites.
EL PRESTAMO SOLICITADO ES PARA LA COMPRA DE MATERIALES DE CONSTRUCCION COMO : ZINC , PERLINES Y CLAVOS PARA REPARAR EL TECHO DE SU CASA DE HABITACION.
texts.en:
This is Marvin Antonio C. C.; he is a maintenance worker at the Israel Lewites market.

He is requesting this loan in order to buy construction materials such as  zinc sheets, beams and nails to repair the roof of his house.

loans.use: To buy construction materials to re-roof his house.

loans.name: Bernarda Lourdes

texts.es:
La  señora Bernarda de Lourdes P. C., es una comerciante que tiene una pulpería en su casa  lleva ya 3 años trabajando con CEPRODEL y ha obtenido 20 créditos los cuales le han ayudado a mejorar sus condiciones de vida y engrandecer su pulpería.

La señora Bernarda P. C. habita en la Comarca el ojo de agua  carretera al Eliseo Agrícola, es soltera madre de un hijo.
texts.en:
Señora Bernarda Lourdes P. C. is a storekeeper who has a grocery store in her home.  She has been working with Kiva Field Partner, CEPRODEL, for three years now and she has had 20 loans, which have helped to improve her living conditions and enlarge her store.

Señora Bernarda P. C. lives in the El Ojo de Agua district on the road to Eliseo Agrícola. She is a single mother with one child.

loans.use: To buy goods to stock up her business

loans.name: Alfonso Alberto

texts.es:
ALFONSO ALBERTO L., Trabaja como Higienista en Commema Mercado Oriental.
El va utilizar la plata en la mejora de su Casa de Habitación que piensa  comprar algunas lamina de zinc  casa de habitación y solventar algunos gastos familiares.
HA TRABAJADO SIETE PRESTAMO CON CEPRODEL Y ESTOS HAN SIDO PARA EL MEJORAMIENTO DE SU VIVIENDA.
texts.en: Alfonso Alberto L. works as a cleaner for COMMEMA (Municipal Markets Corporation of Managua) in the Mercado Oriental market. He will use the funds for home improvements. He plans to purchase some zinc sheets for his home and to take care of some family expenses. He has previously received seven CEPRODEL loans for home improvements.

loans.use: Home improvements and personal expenses

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy basic groceries

loans.name: Ivan

texts.es: El JOVEN Ivan Q. es soltero estudiante y trabajador es primer crédito que solicita a CEPRODEL, este será utilizado para pagar mensualidades que tiene pendientes, agradece a CEPRODEL porque de esta manera podrá seguir estudiando ya que tenía pendiente varios meses de pago.
texts.en:
This young man, Ivan Q., is a single student and a hard worker. This is the first time he has requested a loan from CEPRODEL. He will use it to make several outstanding monthly payments to the university.

 Mr. Q. is grateful to CEPRODEL because after making the payments, he will be able to continue his studies.

loans.use: To make university payments

loans.name: Telma Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora Telma del Socorro E. es trabajadora de la Alcaldía de Chinandega se desempeña como operaria de Limpieza desde hace 6 años, lleva ya 5 créditos con CEPRODEL y ha pagado muy bien.

La señora Telma es soltera tiene dos hijos en edades escolares y habita en el barrio San Agustín, poco a poco ha podido sacar adelante a su familia con empeño y dedicación.
texts.en:
Telma del Socorro E. has been working for the Chinandega city hall as a cleaner for the past 6 years. She has already received 5 loans through CEPRODEL, and is very good at paying them back. 
Telma is single and has two school-aged children. She lives in the San Agustín district, and has gradually been able to improve her family's situation with her hard work and dedication.

loans.use: To buy construction materials (zinc, wood)

loans.name: Edgar Antonio

texts.es:
EDGAR ANTONIO C. S., Trabajo como Higienista en el mercado Oriental Managua.
Va a utilizarlo la plata la va a utilizar en el mejoramiento de vivienda de su casa de habitación, cambio de techo para su hogar
texts.en:
Mr. Edgar Antonio C. S. is a sanitation worker at the Oriental Market in Managua. 

He will use the loan to make home improvements (to change the roof).

loans.use: to make home improvements

loans.name: Pedro Pablo

texts.es:
El señor Pedro Pablo V. es trabajador de la Alcaldía de Chinandega se desempaña como operario de Limpieza Publica en el mercado el Bisne, es casado con 03 hijos y  habita en la colonia Santa Ana .
El señor V. lleva 02 créditos con CEPRODEL los cuales los ha pagado en tiempo y forma y le han ayudado a desarrollarse económicamente.
texts.en:
Sr. Pedro Pablo V. is an employee of the City of Chinandega. He works as a public sanitation engineer at the market in Bisne. Pedro is married, has three children, and lives in the subdivision of Santa Ana.

Sr. V. has had two loans from CEPRODEL that were repaid in a timely manner and helped him develop financially.

loans.use: Personal expenses

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana, de 23 años, es una joven muy emprendedora, vive casa de sus padres y lo que más desea es mejorar si calidad de vida. En vista que es  hija mayor, considera que tiene responsabilidad para generar los ingresos para su familia. Es así que acondicionó un espacio pequeño junto a su puerta, para vender frutas y gaseosas, dándole como resultado un negocio rentable, ya que logra a vender rápido toda la mercadería no perecible que ofrece. Desde entonces se dirige muy temprano al mercado mayorista para abastecerse de frutas frescas, en cuanto a las gaseosas son adquiridas por la misma empresa dejándole a crédito. Hace más de un año que trabaja en esta actividad, por lo que en este tiempo le ha permitido captar clientes además de ganancias. En adelante piensa ampliar su negocio y convertirlo en la bodega más surtida de su pueblo. Es su cuarto crédito que tiene con MFP, por lo que asegura que este crédito será muy beneficioso en el desarrollo de su actividad. En su grupo comunal, es un cliente muy responsable, motivo por el cual le quieren mucho. Con el crédito solicitado, comprará gaseosa, chocolate, galletas y demás golosinas en general.
texts.en:
Ana is 23 years old.  She is a very enterprising young woman.  She lives in her parents' house and what she most desires is to improve her standard of living.  Since she is the eldest daughter, she considers it her responsibility to create income for her family.  For this reason, she set up a small space by her front door where she could sell fruit and soda.  This resulted in a profitable business since she managed to sell very quickly all the goods which she offered.  Ever since then, she gets up very early in the morning to go to the wholesale market in order to stock up on fresh fruit.  The sodas are acquired from the same firm, on credit.

She has been in this business for more than a year and has been successful in attracting customers as well as profits.  In the future, she is planning to expand her business and turn it into the best-stocked store in her village.  This is her fourth loan from MFP.  She assures us that it will be very beneficial in the development of her business.  In her community group she is a very responsible client and everybody likes her a great deal.  With the loan she is requesting, she will buy soda, chocolate, cookies and other sweets in general.

loans.use: To buy sweets to stock her stall with

loans.name: Justo German

texts.es:
JUSTO GERMAN M. H., Trabajo como Vigilante en Commema Mercado Oriental de Managua.
 EL PRESTAMO LO VA a utilizar el préstamo  en el mejoramiento de vivienda de su casa construcción de cuarto de habitacion, HA TRABAJADO SIETE PRESTAMO CON CEPRODEL Y ESTOS HAN SIDO PARA EL MEJORAMIENTO DE SU VIVIENDA.
texts.en:
Justo German M. H. works as a security guard at the Commema Eastern Market in Managua.

This loan will be used to make an improvement to his home, specifically the construction of a room. Justo has received seven loans while working with CEPRODEL and used all of them for home improvements.

loans.use: Pay for the construction of a room

loans.name: Belkis Del Carmen

texts.es:
La Joven Belkis C. Hernández, es trabajadora de la Alcaldía de Chinandega se desempaña como Operaria de Limpieza Publica en el Mercado El Bisne, es soltera sin hijos y aun vive con sus padres.
Belkis C. Habita en el Barrio la Resistencia lleva ya 02 créditos con CEPRODEL y los ha demostrado ser una persona responsable con sus obligaciones.
texts.en:
Belkis C. Hernández is a young woman who is employed by the City of Chinandega. She works as a public sanitation engineer at the Bisne Market. Belkis is single, does not have children, and lives with her parents in the neighborhood of La Resistencia.

She has already received two loans with CEPRODEL and demonstrated that she is a responsible person with her obligations.

loans.use: Personal expenses

loans.name: Carlos Ivan

texts.es:
CARLOS IVAN A. L., Trabaja como Higienista en Commema Mercado Oriental
EL PRESTAMO LO VA A INVERTIR EN COMPRA DE MEATERIALES DE CONSTRUCCION COMO :ARENA, CEMENTO Y MANO DE OBRA PARA CONSTRUIR UN CUARTO EN SU CASA DE HABITACION.
texts.en:
Carlos Ivan A. L. works as a janitor at the Commema Eastern Market.

This loan will be invested in the purchase of construction materials such as sand and cement. It will also be used to pay for labor in order to build a room in his house.

loans.use: Purchase construction materials & pay for labor

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: EL PRESTAMO SOLICITADO ES PARA INCERTIRLO EN COMPRA DE MATERIALES DE CONSTRUCCION COMO: ZINC, MADERA Y CLAVOS PARA CAMBIAR EL TECHO DE SU CASA DE HABITACION YA QUE EN INVIERNO SE PASA EL AGUA.
texts.en: This client is requesting a loan that will be invested in the purchase of construction materials such as zinc, wood, and nails in order to replace the roof of his house since it leaks during the winter.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials that are required to replace the roof of his house

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es:
Oscar tiene la edad de 25 años, es un joven trabajar de pocos recursos económicos, casado con dos hermosos hijos.
Su trabajo es de bar tender en una discoteca los cuales trabajan en turnos, lleva ya varios años en esta labor.
Su anhelo como padre de familia es dar un techo digno a su familia, lo que ha venido comprando materiales y mejorando poco su arranque de concreto. Lo que hoy nace la iniciativa de comenzar  a construir, que lo hará mediante el financiamiento que Afodenic otorgara.
Comprara materiales de construcción como: piedra, arena, cemento, hierro, zinc y otros para hacer las mejoras.
texts.en:
Oscar is a young man who is 25 years of age. He is working, but has few financial resources. Oscar is married and has two beautiful children. He works in shifts as a bartender at a discothèque and has been in this job for several eyars.

His greatest wish as a father is to provide a decent home for his family. Oscar has been buying materials and steadily laying down a concrete foundation. Today he has taken the initiative to start building, so he seeks financing from AFODENIC. He plans to buy construction materials such as stone, sand, cement, iron, zinc, and other items to begin these improvements.

loans.use: Purchase construction materials for his house

loans.name: Maryoris

texts.es: Mayoris H. M. vive en la ciudad de Cartagena  en la urbanización Emmanuel, donde  tiene el negocio de vender calzado, ropa casual y bolsos; esta mujer  casada y con dos hijos en las edades de 3 a 7 años,  inició su negocio una vez quedó desempleada y con su liquidación  comenzó a traer mercancía  y proponerla inicialmente a sus amigos y familiares,  luego agregó los referidos de estos clientes y en esa medida ha venido creciendo gradualmente ;  así fue como quedando    muy limitada para responder a sus clientes con los pedidos que le hacen, inicio  el proceso de financiación con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, su credikiva es su segundo financiamiento y con  la inversión de este en mercancía,, ella incrementará  sus ventas en un 25%. Para Maryoris su negocio ha sido de mucha utilidad, porque una vez dejó de ser empleada generó un trabajo autónomo a partir de su microempresa; ella día a día    se esfuerza trabajando y estudiando para terminar su carrera de licenciatura en Idiomas porque su sueño es tener una escuela y educar a la comunidad teniendo en cuenta que  la pedagogía es su gran potencial. En este final de año sus utilidades aumentarán porque este es una época de mucho repunte en las ventas y Maryoris sabe aprovecharla perfectamente debido a su experiencia de negocio y al apoyo familiar que la llena de muchas alegrías y deseos de salir adelante para que el futuro de sus hijos se torne brillante.
texts.en: Maryoris H. M. lives in the city of Cartagena in the Emmanuel housing development where she has a business selling footwear, casual clothes and bags.  She is married and has two children aged 3 and 7.  She started her business when she became unemployed with her severance pay.  She began to obtain goods and offer them initially to her friends and family members.  She was then able to add people who these customers referred and, in this way, her business has been gradually growing.  As she was very limited in her ability to respond to her customers and the orders that they were making, she began her loan process with la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  This Kiva loan is her second loan.  She plans to invest it in buying merchandise and increase her sales by 25%.  Maryoris' business has been very useful because once she lost her job she created her own work from her small business.  Day by day she works hard and also studies hard to complete her university course in languages because her dream is to have a school and educate the community bearing in mind that teaching is her great potential.  In this end-of-year season, her profits will rise because this is a period of the year which sees a great rise in sales and Maryoris knows very well how to take advantage of it owing to her business experience and her family's support which fills her with a lot of happiness and desire to get ahead so that her children's future becomes bright.

loans.use: To buy shoes, colorful bags and special clothes for the end-of-year festive season

loans.name: Rafael

texts.es:
Rafael Rodríguez P.  vive en la ciudad de Cartagena donde se dedica a vender ropa mediante un sistema muy particular, compra las telas e insumos y manda a fabricar la ropa especialmente femenina, aprovechando el taller de confecciones  que tiene su madre  desde hace mas de 20 años y que por ser el negocio de Rafael muy  rentable,  le aporta un porcentaje de utilidad a ella.
Este es su cuarto financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, organización a la cual pertenece hace un poco más de tres años  y que le ha ayudado a crecer como independiente y como empresario. Igualmente con las utilidades producidas por el negocio, ha logrado comprarle una maquina de confeccionar a su mamá, generado gran unidad familiar, porque su gran sueño es hacer una  fuerte alianza de trabajo con toda su familia, abrir nuevos mercados para ampliar su espectro productivo, aunque su mayor desafío es lograr juntar todo el capital para lograrlo. Con su credikiva Rafael comprará telas, adornos, hilos y detalles que llevará al taller de su madre para confeccionar vestidos femeninos ya encargados, aprovechando que se acercan las festividades de final de año y él aspira a aumentar su clientela y sus utilidades en esta temporada de gran movimiento comercial .
texts.en:
Rafael Rodríquez P. lives in the city of Cartagena.  He sells clothes there in a very unique way.  He buys the fabric and supplies.  He then orders the clothes to be made, especially women’s clothes.  He takes advantage of his mother’s seamstress shop, which she has had for over 20 years.  Rafael’s business is very profitable, and he gives a percentage of the profits to his mother.

This is his fourth loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  He has belonged to this organization for a little over three years.  It has helped him grow independently and as a businessman.  With the profits from his business he has managed to buy a sewing machine for his mother.

This has generated great family unity.  His big dream is to make a strong work alliance with all of his family and to open new markets to increase his productive presence.  His biggest challenge is to get together the capital to accomplish this.

Rafael will use the loan to buy fabric, decorations, thread, and accessories to take to his mother’s shop to make the women’s garments that are on order.  He will take advantage of the end of the year festivities that are approaching.

He aspires to increase the number of customers he has.  He also wants his profits to increase during this time of the year when there is great commercial activityt.

loans.use: Buy fabric, decorations, thread, and accessories to take to his mother’s shop to make  women’s garments

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy sweets and wood to help her husband who is a bricklayer

loans.name: Nubis Del Rosario

texts.es:
Nubis M. vive y tiene su negocio en un barrio de Cartagena llamado camino del medio, lugar previsto para  que opere el Transcribe,  sistema  de transporte masivo de esta ciudad, donde ella vive  con su cónyuge y sus dos hijos en las edades de 17 y 19 años.
 Nubis es una cliente asidua de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, que inició su vinculación desde el año 1995 en un grupo solidario , inicialmente comercializaba con licores, pero su actividad fue cambiando gradualmente,  hasta hacer de ella una gran miscelánea donde comercializa variedades  pues este es el énfasis que tuvo Nubis  como meta,  desde que lo inició. Su vida desde que emprendió su negocio,  ha dado un gran giro especialmente por el apoyo recibido por parte de esta organización, porque cuando inició no tenia experiencia alguna y la capacitación y las orientaciones de sus profesionales la ayudaron a salir adelante, lo mismo que el apoyo incondicional de su familia y los vecinos del sector ya que es muy reconocida y por eso tiene una muy buena demanda en el mercado, los que le representa un importante ingreso, pese a la gran competencia que existe en esta comunidad.
Su sueño es adicionarle muchas más infraestructura a su negocio  y lograr que siempre esté surtido con lo que sus clientes requieran y  en todas las épocas del año, debido a que su mayor desafío,  es cuando bajan las ventas  y ella debe recurrir a la comercialización de productos por catálogos, para superar estos momentos.  En la actualidad solicita su credikiva para comprar mercancías variadas como bisutería, adornos femeninos para el cabello, obsequios para regalo, papelería, empaques, los cuales proyecta tener disponibles para la venta  a finales de este año.
texts.en:
Nubis M. lives in and has her business in a neighborhood called Camino del Medio in Cartagena.  The Transcripe, a massive transport system, is being planned for this city.  She lives with her husband and their two children, ages 17 and 19.

Nubis is a regular member of the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She started her connection with the communal bank in 1995.  Initially she sold liquor, but her business was gradually changing until it became a large business selling a variety of items. This was the goal that Nubis had when she started the business.

Ever since undertaking the business her life has taken a great turn, especially with the support received from this organization.  When she started she had no experience.  The training and the orientations from the professionals with the organization have helped her get ahead.  The unconditional support of her family and neighbors also helped.  Now she is well known. There is a good demand for her products in the market.  This income is important given that there is a lot of competition in the neighborhood.

Her dream is to greatly expand the infrastructure of her business.  She also dreams of always being well-stocked with what her customers need.  Her greatest challenge is when sales are down and she needs to fall back on selling products by catalog in order to make it through these times.

She is currently requesting a loan from Kiva to buy varied merchandise like jewelry, hair accessories for women, gift items, stationery items, and packaging goods.  She plans to have these items available to sell at the end of this year.

loans.use: To buy varied merchandise like jewelry, hair accessories for women, gift items, stationery items, and packaging goods

loans.name: Concepción

texts.es: Esta clienta es trabajadora de la Alcaldía municipal de Chinandega y trabaja en el área de limpieza pública. Esta señora es casada y su familia depende en un 100 % de los ingresos del cliente por lo que su salario no le ajusta para realizar las mejoras necesarias en la vivienda por lo que esta solicitando el credito para mejorar la cocina y el techo de su casa.
texts.en: Concepción is employed by the City of Chinandega as a janitor.  She is married and her family is 100% dependent on her income.  There is not enough left over from her salary to make needed improvements to her home.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan to repair the kitchen and the roof of her house.

loans.use: Purchase materials needed to repair the roof & the kitchen

loans.name: José Del Carmen

texts.es: El señor José del Carmen V. es trabajador de la alcaldía de Chinandega se desempeña como barrendero del tren de aseo es padre de 3 niños que están en edad escolar por los cuales se esfuerza mucho en su trabajo ya que con este salario vive toda su familia este financiamiento lo solicito para reparar parte del techo de su casa.
texts.en: Mr. José del Carmen V. is a worker in the municipality of Chinandega. He acts as a garbage truck sweeper. He is the father of 3 school-age children for whom he works hard since his whole family is supported by his salary. He is asking for this loan in order to repair part of the roof of his house.

loans.use: To buy construction materials.

loans.name: Esperanza De Los Ángeles

texts.es: La señora Esperanza M. es trabajadora de la alcaldía de Chinandega se desempeña en el área de barrido de calles es madre y padre de tres niños los cuales estudian y ella lucha por sacarlos adelante tiene años de trabajar en dicha empresa y ha sacado seis financiamientos los que los ha invertido en su casa y para gastos personales como compra de televisor  para que sus niños tengan un medio de distracción ella siente que con estos créditos ella ha superado bastante y que poco a poco ha sacado a su hijos adelante.
texts.en:
Sra. Esperanza M. is an employee of the City of Chinandega and works as a street sweeper. She has had to be both mother and father to her three children who are in school. Esperanza struggles to get ahead. She has worked with CEPRODEL over the years and has received six loans that were invested into her home and used for personal expenses, such as the purchase of a television so that her children could have a means of distraction.

She feels the loans have helped her overcome and enabled her to gradually move her children forward.

loans.use: Purchase construction materials

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es: Teresa tiene 41 años, es madre soltera, una mujer muy trabajadora y jovial, vive en su casa que le fue heredada en compañía de su hijo de 19 años. En la actualidad estudia en la universidad pública, la carrera de educación, conveniente para vender joyas en fantasía fina y cosméticos de marcas muy reconocidas en el mercado, negocio que le va muy bien, por lo que se siente muy contenta con el trabajo que realiza. Lo que más le agrada es aconsejar a sus clientes las aplicaciones que debe usar para cada cosmético, así como las joyas que deben comprar. En un inicio vendía éstos productos por catalogo pero no le resultó, desde entonces prefiere llevar la mercadería consigo para ir a mostrarles a sus clientes. Lleva 5 años y medio en este negocio por lo que anhela incrementar su capital y tener stock en cosméticos. Este es su crédito número 19 con MFP, y se compromete a pagar sus cuotas como hasta hoy, ya que le es de mucha utilidad para el incremento de su capital. Con el crédito que solicitó, comprará productos de belleza y joyas, para abastecer los pedidos pendientes que le hacen sus compañeras de la universidad.
texts.en:
Teresa, 41, is a hard working, jovial single mother that lives in her house, which she inherited, with her 19 year old son.  She is currently studying Education at the Public University which is very convenient for her to sell costume jewelry and well-known brand cosmetics.  She does quite well and feels quite happy with the work she does.

What she likes best about the work is advising her customers about the best way to use each cosmetic as well as the jewels they buy.  At the beginning she started out in catalogue sales but this did not have good results for her and since then she prefers to have the merchandise in her possession in order to show it to customers.

She has been in this business for five and a half years and she wishes to increase her capital having more cosmetics to stock.  This is her 19th loan with MFP and she commits to repay as she has done to date because it is very useful to increase capital.

She will use the requested loan to buy more beauty products and jewelry to fill pending orders her fellow university students have placed.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics and jewelry  to have more variety to offer her customers.

loans.name: Marcela Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Marcela del Carmen Z. B. es trabajadora de la alcaldía, casada y madre de tres niños se desempeña en el área de barrido en el Mercado santa Ana de Chinandega tiene de trabajar  en la alcaldía ocho años  de los cuales ceprodel le ha brindado seis financiamientos que los ha ocupado en la reparación y remodelación de su casa poco a poco ella ha salido adelante su casa la ha compuesto con al ayuda de su esposo y sus niños estudian en la escuela primaria ella es una mujer luchadora y se esfuerza por sacar adelante a sus niños y a su hogar.
texts.en:
Sra. Marcela del Carmen Z. B. is a city employee. She is married and the mother of three children. Marcela works as a street sweeper at the Santa Ana Market in Chinandega.

She has worked with CEPRODEL for eight years and has received six loans that were used for repairing and remodeling her house. Marcela has been able to gradually make improvements to her home with the help of her husband.

Her children are elementary school students. Marcela is a determined woman who strives to succeed on behalf of her children and the rest of her household.

loans.use: Purchase construction materials

loans.name: Juana Francisca

texts.es: La señora Juana Francisca M. A. es vendedora desde hace 15 años su negocio es venta de pan lo ejerce ambulante en los sectores aledaños de su casa de habitación que queda en el reparto la florida, es madre de dos niños que todavía están estudiando y por los que se esfuerza con su negocio para sacarlos adelante ella siente que con los financiamientos que le hemos brindado alrededor de cinco años  ha salido adelante y su calidad de vida ha mejorado bastante
texts.en:
Sra. Juana Francisca M. A. has worked as a saleswoman for 15 years. She has a business of selling bread, which requires her to travel throughout the areas surrounding her house in the Florida subdivision. Juana is a mother who strives to support her two children who are still in school.

She feels that the loans CEPRODEL has provided over the past five years have helped her move forward and make great improvements in her quality of life.

loans.use: Purchase construction materials

loans.name: Maricela Raquel

texts.es: La señora Maricela Raquel R. G. es trabajadora de la alcaldía de Chinandega desde hace cuatro años se desempeña en el área de barrido del Mercado de santa Ana, tiene dos niños por los que se esfuerza para sacarlos adelante anteriormente trabajaba de domestica y su financiamiento lo solicito para reparar su casita  con laminas de zinc,
texts.en:
Sra. Maricela Raquel R. G. is an employee of the City of Chinandega. For the past four years, she has worked as a street sweeper at the Santa Ana Market. She has two children and strives to succeed on their behalf. Maricela previously worked as a housekeeper.

She is requesting this loan in order to make repairs to her home. Maricela will buy materials, such as sheets of zinc.

loans.use: Purchase construction materials for making home repairs

loans.name: Marlin Leonor

texts.es: Esta clienta es trabajadora de la alcaldía municipal de la ciudad en donde se desempeña como secretaria desde hace 13 años. esta Sr. Es casada y tiene a su cargo a 2 hijos los cuales los mantiene de su salario por lo que se le dificulta realizar las mejoras de su salario por tal razón está solicitando el crédito para la reparación de su cocina y el cambio de alguna laminas de zinc.
texts.en:
This member has worked at the town hall for thirteen years where she is a secretary. She is married and has two children who are her dependents. She provides for them out of her salary which makes it difficult for her to pay for the house repairs.

She has requested the loan to fix the kitchen in her house and to change some zinc sheets.

loans.use: To buy construction materials

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es: Luisa, de 67 años, es una madre de familia responsable y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia con su esposo y sus 3 hijos de los 7 que tiene. Todas las tardes Luisa se dedica a la preparación y venta de comida, como caldos de gallina, patascas y anticuchos, platillos típicos de país y del que la gente gusta mucho, entre ellos los mecánicos que trabajan al costado de su negocio. Su esposo la apoya en esta actividad, él se encarga de atender a los clientes, de esta manera trabajan juntos durante 27 años, permitiéndoles acumular ganancias. En adelante, piensa en cercar con rejas el ingreso a su casa, para que puedan trabajar con mayor seguridad. Es su diecinueve  crédito con MFP, por lo que asegura que este crédito será beneficioso para continuar con su negocio. Con el  crédito que solicita, comprará productos para continuar trabajando con su negocio que mejor sabe hacer, que es cocinar.
texts.en:
Luisa, 67, is a responsible, hard working mother.  She lives in her own house with her husband and three of her seven children.  Every afternoon she prepares traditional, popular food items that people enjoy a lot like chicken soup, patascas (a thick stew made by boiling a whole pig, sheep or beef head) and anticuchos (skewered, grilled beef heart) to sell among mechanics that work next door.  Her husband helps her with the business.  He tends to the customers and they have worked together this way for 27 years and have amassed profits this way.

In the future she wants to install fencing around her house’s entrance so that they can work with more securily.

This is her 19th loan with MFP and she assures us that the loan will be very beneficial to continue with her business.  She will use the requested funds to buy ingredients to continue working at the business she knows best: cooking.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for meal preparations.

loans.name: Juan De Mato

texts.es: Juan de Mato, de 50 años, es un hombre alegre y muy trabajador, esta casado con Hilda, de 44 años, ambos tienen 6 hijos, pero solo viven con dos de ellos, David, de 13 y Verónica de 11 años, en su casa propia ubicada en la zona rural de Santa Clara. El trabajo que desempeña, es la agricultura, ya tiene 20 años dedicándose a ello. La siembra de papa en sus diferentes variedades, es su principal actividad, cuando sus sembríos están listos para ser cosechados, él los empaqueta y vende en el mercado central de su ciudad; pero no solo a eso se dedica Juan, ya que, la crianza intensiva de ganado vacuno y ovino; es lo que le divierte más. Los enseba y posteriormente, vende su carne en pueblos aledaños de su localidad. Ahora él está planeando construir un cobertizo, con el cual podrá cuidar a sus animales del constante frío de la zona. Es el octavo crédito con MFP, y agradece a su banco comunal, que durante todo este tiempo trabajo con esmero y ahínco. Con el crédito que obtendrá, comprará semillas de papa de la variedad “Yungay”, de la misma manera, invertirá el restante en la compra de abono orgánico, para su producción de papa  de la variedad “Pericholi”, que cosechará dentro de algunos meses.
texts.en:
Juan de Mato, 50, is a cheerful, very hard working man.  He’s married to Hilda, 44, and they have 6 children but only two, David, 13 and Verónica, 11, still live with them in their own house located in a rural area of Santa Clara.

He has been a farmer for 20 years.  His main activity is planting various varieties of potato.  When the harvest is ready he packages it and sells it in the city’s Central Market.  But this isn’t all Juan does.  He also raises cattle and sheep.  That’s what he enjoys the most.  He fattens them up and then sells the meat in adjoining towns.   He is planning to build a shelter to protect his animals from the constant cold in the area. This is his 8th loan with MFP and he thanks the communal bank which has worked with dedication and effort all this time.

He will use the loan he’ll get to buy potato seed of the “Yungay” variety as well as using the rest of the loan to buy organic manure for his “Pericholi” variety of potato that he will harvest in a few months.

loans.use: To buy potato seed and organic manure for his next planting.

loans.name: Flor

texts.es: Flor, de 23 años, es una mujer “luchadora” que, como toda madre soltera, trabaja para mantener a su hija Dennis, de 4 años; a la que cuida y educa en casa de sus padres; ubicado en la zona rural de Santa Clara. Su principal aspiración es construir su casa propia, en la que pueda brindarle las comodidades suficientes a su pequeña hija; por ello todas las mañanas, trabaja con ahínco en sus terrenos de cultivo. Ya tiene 3 años dedicándose a la agricultura; los sembríos de papa, es su principal actividad, es así que las diferentes variedades de la misma, le permite vender su producción todo el año, Sin “mayores dificultades”, menciona. Pero no solo  a ello se dedica Flor, también se encarga del cuidado de 3 vacas de buena raza, que le proporciona la leche necesaria, para poder preparar “queso”, el que después comercializa a buen precio, entre los pobladores de su localidad. Es el quinto crédito con MFP, y al ver el progreso que tuvo gracias a su banco comunal, recomendó a su hermano, para que pueda; como ella, salir adelante. Con el crédito que obtendrá, comprará abono y semilla de papa de la variedad “única”, con ello piensa, abastecer  su producción para la campaña agrícola que se aproxima.
texts.en: Flor is 23 years old and she is a fighter.  Like all single mothers, she works to care for her daughter, Dennis, of 4 years, who she takes care of and educates in her parents house; located in the rural area of Santa Clara. Her main aspiration is to build her own house, so that she can provide the commodities necessary for her small daughter. Because of this, she works eagerly every morning on her crops. She has worked in agriculture for 3 years, the potato crop being her main activity so that different varieties of the same crop can be sold throughout the year without "major difficulties", she says. However, this is not all Flor does, she also cares for 3 cows of good breed, which give enough milk to prepare "cheese", which is later sold at a good price from local villagers. This is her fifth loan with MFP, and seeing the progress she has had thanks to the community bank, she advised her brother to do the same so that he can, like her, get ahead. With the loan she receives, she will buy fertilizer and a variety of "única" potato seeds, with this she believes she can supply her production for the approaching agriculture season.

loans.use: To buy potato seeds and fertilizer for her next harvest.

loans.name: Rolin

texts.es: Rolin, de 21 años, es un hombre, que a pesar de los inconvenientes que tiene, lucha por salir adelante. Él, convive con Dora de 25 años, con la que tuvo un hijo; Jean Pier, de 11 meses de edad, al que cuidan con mucho amor en una casa arrendada, ubicada en la localidad de Santa Clara. A su corta, edad. ÉL tiene en claro sus objetivos, el nacimiento de su hijo le impulsa en su trabajo diario. Sus aspiraciones, se centra en la construcción de su casa propia, por ello hace 3 años que se dedica a sembrar sus propios terrenos agrícolas, donde siembra, distintas variedades de papa, los que después de cada cosecha los comercializa en el mercado central de su localidad. Pero como las fuerzas que tiene son muchas; cuenta que en sus tiempos libres trabaja en otros sembríos, las ganancias que obtiene, lo ahorra, con ello planea comprar sus propios terrenos agrícolas. Es el primer crédito con MFP, y asume, la responsabilidad de trabajar en un banco comunal, donde sus miembros son personas responsables y cumplidas. Con el crédito que obtendrá, comprará abono orgánico, para la variedad de papa “yungay”, que esparcirá sobre sus cultivos, los cuales cosechara en estos meses.
texts.en: Rolin, 21 years old, is a man who despite drawbacks, struggles to get ahead. He lives with Dora who is 25 years old, with whom he has a son, Jean Pier, who is 11 months old.  They care for him with much love in a rented house in the town of Santa Clara. At his young age he has very clear objectives, the birth of his son drives his daily work. His aspirations center around building his own home. Because of this, he has been planting his own agriculture for the past 3 years. He plants different varieties of potatoes, which after each harvest are sold in the central market in his area. But as the forces he has are many, he works on other crops in his free time.  With the profits obtained he saves and plans on buying his own farmland. This is his first loan with MFP, and he assumes responsibility for working in a community bank where it's members are responsible and accomplished. With the loan he receives, he will buy organic fertilizer for the "yungay" potatoes, which he will spread on the crops that he will harvest in recent months.

loans.use: To buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Martin Felix

texts.es: Martín tiene 32 años de edad, vive en su casa con su esposa y sus dos hijos los cuales se encuentran en edad escolar, el trabaja en su taxi haciendo colectivo, lleva en este trabajo hace ya varios años el inició sus labores con su propio vehículo el cual adquirió con sus ahorros de trabajo como obrero de planta, su sueño es poder darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y una mejor educación a sus hijos, Martin solicita el crédito para darle mantenimiento a su herramienta de trabajo, se le brinda el crédito por contar con buenas referencias personales.
texts.en: Martín is 32 years old and lives in his home with his wife and two children, who are school-age. He works providing a collective taxi service.  He began this work several years ago with his own car, which he purchased with his savings working as a factory worker. His dream is to be able to provide a better quality of life for his family and a better education for his children. Martín is requesting a loan for maintaining the tools of his trade. He is being granted a loan because he has good personal references.

loans.use: Maintaining the tools of his trade.

loans.name: Khat's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Khat M., a 40-year-old married woman, is the group leader of this loan, having been selected its by four members, all of whom are residents of Preaek Ruessei village in Kandal Province. Each member of this group will use their portion of the loan for a different purpose.

M. and her husband, Mr. Hout Thall, earn their living by selling fast food in the local village, making good profits that enable them to support their three children, all of whom are students in the local school and also helpers in their parent business. In order to increase income to improve the family living standards, M. decided to ask for a loan to buy more ingredients to expand her fast food enterprise.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients to expand her business

loans.name: Juana Rosa

texts.es: Juana tiene 59 años, vive en casa con sus hijos los cuales estan en edad universitaria, ella se dedica al alquiler D. cuartos, negocio que le brinda buenos ingresos, recibiendo un promedio mensual D. 600 nuevos soles, ella sueña con poder darle a sus hijos todo lo mejor y una buena calidad D. vida, solicita el crédito para la compra D. un módulo pre-fabricado, se le brinda el crédito por contar con buenas referencias personales.
texts.en: Juana is 59 years old and lives at home with her children who are school-age. She rents out rooms, a business that provides a good income, receiving a monthly average of 600 new soles. She dreams of being able to give her children the best and a good quality of life.  She is requesting a loan to buy a pre-fabricated unit. She is being granted a loan because she has good personal references

loans.use: Purchase of a unit.

loans.name: Aibolat

texts.en: Aibolat J. is 30 years old and lives with his wife and three children in a house in the Bayan-Ulgiy province of western Mongolia. All of his children go to kindergarten, while his wife operates a clothing retail trading business in their town to supplement the family income. Aibolat operates a taxi service between the countryside and the capital of the province. He started his business in 2004 with a small car. After several successful years in business, Aibolat was able to afford to buy a larger, more reliable automobile. He was also able to complete construction on his home with his previous loan profits. For the future, he hopes to continue growing both family businesses. He says, “My only wish is to expand my business so that I can support my children’s education and have them become good people.” Aibolat is requesting a loan of 600,000 MNT to purchase extra tires for his automobile.

loans.use: To purchase extra tires

loans.name: Demberelsambuu

texts.en:
Demberelsambuu L. is 58 years old and lives with his wife and three children in Baganuur, one of the remote districts of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He and his family live in an apartment. His wife is a schoolteacher, while his older daughter is a university student and his youngest daughter attends a local high school. Demberelsambuu is a hardworking man.

Demberelsambuu operates a household furniture and products trading business in a local trade center that was newly opened. His daughter suggested that he run his own business; therefore, he decided to expand his daughter's business by selling a variety of furniture, lampshades and curtains. He started this business one and half year ago and was successful in his new business within a short time.

Demberelsambuu is requesting a 3,400,000 MNT loan to increase his product line and selection due to the upcoming holidays and celebrations in autumn.

loans.use: To increase his product line and selection

loans.name: Barshagul

texts.en:
Barshagul A. is 42 years old and lives with her five children in Bayan-Ulgiy province in western Mongolia. She and her children live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Her three daughters all attend a local secondary school.

Barshagul operates a butchering and meat-selling business in her province. In Mongolia it is common for a household to buy at least one cow and ten sheep to be eaten during the long Mongolian winters. People of this province usually prepare their meat for winter during October and November and finish eating it in March.

Barshagul usually purchases livestock from herders, and her son helps her to slaughter them to sell at the local market. She also travels up to 200 kilometers from her town to sell meat throughout the province. She sells a kilogram of lamb for 2000-2500 MNT and a kilogram of horse meat for 3000-3500 MNT.

She is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more livestock such as sheep at 50,000 to 60,000 MNT and cows at 200,000 MNT. She hopes to continue being successful and says, "All I want is to support my children."

loans.use: To purchase more livestock

loans.name: Kdan Channary's Group

texts.en:
This group loan is made up of four members located in Preaek Ruessei village in Kandal province. Mrs. Kdan C. has been selected as the leader of the group loan. With the loans, each group member hopes to increase their income to improve their family's standard of living.
Mrs. C., 61, earns her living by renting her house. She also works as a farmer on her own plot of land where she cultivates vegetables. Her husband, Mr. Moek Hum, is 63 years old and works as a Buddhist priest in the pagoda. Since this month is rainy season, their house is flooded so they are requesting a loan to buy soil to fill in the front yard. The couple does not have any children.

loans.use: To buy soil to fill in the front yard

loans.name: Palmira Del Belen

texts.es: Palmira tiene dos hijos los cuales estan en edad escolar, ella trabaja en su bodega que esta ubicada en su propia casa, su sueño es poder darles a sus hijos todo lo mejor y tener una calidad de vida buena, ya que ellos son aún muy pequeños, ella  solicita el crédito para compra de mercaderi y poder ampliar su negocio, se le brinda el crédito por contar con buenas referencias personales y capacidad de pago.
texts.en: Palmira has two children who are school-age. She works in her store that is located in her home. Her dream is to be able to give her children all the best and to have a good quality of life. Since they are still very small, she is requesting a loan to buy merchandise to be able to expand her business.  She is being granted a loan because she has good personal references and the ability to pay.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise.

loans.name: Mey Yin's Group

texts.en:
This group loan is made up of five people who live in Preaek Touch village, Kandal province. Mrs. Mey Y. is the leader of the group loan who has been selected by the members. The members of this group will use their portion of the loan to buy supplies, equipment and other items to support their different purposes.
Mrs. Y., 65, is a farmer who owns 2.80 hectares of land, which she uses to cultivate corn and peanuts. She will use her loan from Kiva partner, AMK, to buy fertilizer and pesticide and hire farm labor to cultivate her corn and peanuts. Mrs. Y. is a widow with a child who works as a seamstress in a garment factory.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide and hire farm labor

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Zolmandah

texts.en:
Zolmandah J. is a 27-year-old single mother with two young children. She lives with her parents and two sons in Suhbaatar province, Mongolia, in a 'ger', a traditional Mongolian nomadic home tent in a rented yard. Both her sons attend local kindergarten. 

Zolmandah operates a clothing retail business in the local trade center. She started her business in April, 2010 with working capital of 1,000,000 MNT. She sells a variety of products that have been imported from China. Since starting her business, she has traveled  3 times already to China to buy goods to sell. 

For the future, she hopes to continue growing with her new business and expand her product types. She needs more funds to purchase winter clothes, therefore she is requesting a  1,000,000 MNT loan to import products from Erlian, a border city in China for her growing store.

loans.use: To import products from Erlian

loans.name: Asunción De La Concepción

texts.es:
La Sra. Asunción de la Concepción S.,  inicio con pequeña cantidad y la comercializaba de forma ambulante en cambio hoy en día realiza las venta al por mayor en las Universidades y Colegios y su negocio ha crecido con créditos otorgados por ceprodel, cabe mencionar que ella inicio con un capital de C$500.00 el cual fue producto de préstamos, 
Este crédito fue utilizado para  compra de productos de  elaboración de platanitos y yuquitas  tales como: plátanos, yuca, aceite vinagres leña.
texts.en:
Mrs. Asuncion de la Concepcion S. started with small capital , her first loan of C$500.00, and used to offer her products as a traveling vendor. Her business has grown and she is now selling wholesale to universities and schools. This has been possible because of the loans given to her through CEPRODEL. 

She utilized the present loan to buy the ingredients and side items necessary to prepare ‘platanitos’ and ‘yuquitas’ like plantains, cassava, oil, vinegar and firewood.

loans.use: To buy plantain, cassava, oil, vinegar

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina P. is a married woman who lives in Yulo Street, Brgy. 8, Isabela , Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating one business venture: a used clothing  business.  Her husband Alfredo P., who is 53 years old, works as a driver to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities.  They have 6 children who are between 23 and 29 years old. 

Gina joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1999 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 18 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Gina has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 29,500 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 15,000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 19th loan, she is borrowing PHP 30,000, which she intends to use to buy more used clothes to sell so that she can continue to save up for future home repairs. Gina P. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF:

 In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase stock of used clothes to sell

loans.name: Alibek

texts.en:
Alibek S. is a 27-year-old and lives with his wife and two daughters in Bayan-Ulgiy province, Mongolia. He and his family live in a 'ger', a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His wife stopped working due to bad health and stays at home watching their two young daughters. 

Alibek currently operates a taxi service in his town. He started driving a taxi in 2006 and has since gained much experience as a driver. His daily revenue from taxi service is between 8,000 and 12,000 MNT and 50 percent of this is considered net profit. He has used all his earnings to stabilize his family's financial situation and improve their quality of life. His business is the only source of his family's income and it is still insufficient for household consumption.

 For the future, he hopes to continue his business' stable operation and save money in order to buy a new car. Alibek is a modest and hardworking man and is requesting a 500,000 MNT loan to purchase auto parts for his car as well as to buy 2 tons of coal and meat for the winter.

loans.use: To purchase auto parts for his car

loans.name: Handhuu

texts.en:
Handhuu S. is 40 years old and lives with her husband and two children in  Hovd province,  Mongolia. She and her family live in an apartment which was purchased from her previous loan profit. Her son attends a local secondary school while her daughter is in kindergarten. 

Handhuu operates a clothing retail trading business with help of her husband in their town. They started this business in 2001 and have built up a stable operation. Over the years she has gained much business experience and has built a positive reputation amongst her customers and suppliers. She attributes her business success to her good accounting skills. 

Handhuu is a hardworking and well-esteemed woman and is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to import winter clothing items from China.

loans.use: To import winter clothing items

loans.name: Bich's Group

texts.en:
Nine people make up this village loan. Mrs. Bich H., 50 years old, is the village bank president, having been selected by the members of this village loan, located in Preaek Bak village in Kandal province. The members of this village loan hope that the loan will increase their income to improve their families' living conditions.

H. and her husband, Mr. Kong Ith, are farmers who own a plot of land that they use to cultivate vegetables, peanuts, and corn for a living.
