He currently works as an instrumentalist musician for the Defense Ministry, a job that provides a regular income that he uses to pay for household expenses and save some money in the bank.

Paulo heard about Hluvuku at work. His four previous loans were used to buy the land for his house and construction material to start building it. He will use this current loan (the first one with Kiva), to buy construction material (cement, doors and sand) to continue building his house. These loans allow him to work toward providing better living conditions for his family.

He plans to apply for more Hluvuku/Kiva loans in the future, to finish building and to furnish his home, so that he and his family can live with dignity.

loans.use: to buy construction material (cement, sand, doors)

loans.name: Eang's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Eang S. is a 57-year-old married woman who lives in Kandal village in Kandal province. Eang and her husband, Mr. Kong Muth, are farmers who work very hard to support their two children. One of whom is a tailor and the other is a seamstress in the garment factory. 

Eang and her husband cultivate corn on their vegetable field. They now face a problem because they do not have enough money to buy pesticides to kill insect, so Eang decided to ask for a loan to buy pesticides and the rest of the loan she would use to buy cultivate corn seeds for cultivating.
 
Eang was selected by the five members of this group to be the group leader. With their loan, each member of this group hopes to increase his or her income to improve their families' lives.

loans.use: To buy pesticide and cultivate corn

loans.name: Jose

texts.pt:
José J. nasceu em Manica, uma Província do centro de Moçambique, onde concluiu o ensino primário, tem filhos e estudam. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém.

Transfere-se para Maputo na década 80 em missão de serviço, tem um salário mensal fixo que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda consegue poupar algum na sua conta bancária.

Através do seu serviço soube da existência da Hluvuku e já solicitou 4 empréstimos com os quais legalizou o seu terreno, comprou materiais de construção e iniciou a sua obra, tendo melhorado significativamente a sua vida pelo que já tem uma casa condigna.

Com actual empréstimo e primeiro no Kiva no valor de 16.500.00mt pretende comprar materiais de construção (cimento, areia e pagamento de mão de obra) para continuar com a sua obra.
O seu sonho futuro é comprar um carro, iniciar um negócio e para concretizar os seus projectos vai recorrer a outros empréstimos da Hluvuku/kiva.
texts.en:
José J. was born in Manica, in Central Mozambique, where he finished elementary school. He lives with his family in a house they own and has children who are enrolled in school. 

He was transferred to Maputo for work in the 1980s. His current salary pays for household expenses and allows him to save some money in the bank.
He learned about Hluvuku through work, and his previous four loans with the institution were used to buy the land for his house and construction material to start building it.

José will use his current loan, in the amount of 16.500.00mt, to buy more cement, sand and to pay for labor to continue the house construction. He plans to apply for more Hluvuku/Kiva loans in the future to buy a car and start his own business.

loans.use: compra de materiais de construção (cimento, areia e pagamento de mão de obra)

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
Shirley B. has been dedicated since she’s obtained working capital to engage in her hog-fattening business. Presently, Shirley relies on this activity to cover her personal costs and help sustain her family. Shirley buys piglets from her neighbors, raises them, and when they have reached a good point of development, she sells them to business people who visit the village, either alive or slaughtered for their meat to be sold per kilo. This activity is very common in their place and many entrepreneurs do this.

Shirley wishes to expand her business by buying more piglets, vitamins and feed for piglets, in order to forge ahead with her business and be able to help her family to get ahead. For this reason, she is for the first time approaching KIVA for a loan through ASHI amounting to 25,000 Php to help her reach her goal.

Shirley is a hard-working woman dedicated to her home. Her dream is to care for her nine children and offer them a better quality of life. Shirley’s neighbors, friends and even her group mates consider her respectful person.

Her dreams are to provide a better future for her family, sustain the profitability of her business, and start a savings account for her children and support them to finish their studies until they complete college to get a better career someday.  With hard work and determination, Shirley is focused on improving her quality of life through her entrepreneurial efforts and support from ASHI and Kiva lenders around the world.

loans.use: To continue to support her hog-raising business

loans.name: Mariana Aurora Filipe

texts.pt:
Mariana Aurora C. nasceu no Distrito de Boane, Província de Maputo, sul de Moçambique casada e mãe de 4 filhos de idades entre 6 a 16 e todos vão a Escola. Fez 9ª classe parou devido a vários motivos, desde já decidiu regressar a escola. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta seu cunhado que vive com eles.

Nunca saiu da sua cidade natal, tem um negocio próprio de venda de produtos de primeira necessidade no quintal da sua casa. Desenvolve esta atividade ha mais de 3 anos, não possui nenhum empregado e consegue um rendimento de cerca de 5.000.00mt por mês, que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancaria e Xitique (sistema tradicional de poupança rotativa) mensal.

Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de amigas clientes da instituição. Este é o seu primeiro empréstimo no valor de 10.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar produtos (arroz, açúcar, batata, caldo, feijão e outros) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria.

Esta confiante que vai pagar antes do tempo e pedir outro para construir uma banca de material convencional ainda em sua casa.
texts.en:
Mariana Aurora C. was born in Maputo, Southern Mozambique. She is married and the mother of four children ages 6 to 16, all enrolled in school. For various reasons, her own studies were interrupted in the 9th Grade, but she recently decided to go back to school. She lives with her husband and children in a house they own, and helps support a bother-in-law who lives with them.

She's never left her hometown, where for the past three years she has been running a small home-based business selling food staples. She works by herself and makes an average of 5.000.00mt per month, which she uses to pay for household expenses. Her monthly earnings also allow her to regularly save some money in the bank and through a traditional rotational savings system.

She has never had loans from other banks or institutions before, and learned about Hluvuku from friends who are clients of the instituition. This is her first loan with Hluvuku/Kiva, and she plans to use the money to purchase more products to sell (rice, sugar, potato, beans, etc).

She's confident in her ability to pay back this loan ahead of schedule, and plans to apply for a new loan to build a better/more conventional space for her store.

loans.use: to buy more food staples to sell at her home-based store (rice, sugar, potato, beans, etc)

loans.name: Eng's Group

texts.en:
Twenty-one people make up this village bank loan; Mr. Eng V. is the village bank president, having been selected by the members of this village loan, located in Anlong Slat village, Kandal province. All the member of this village bank loan will use their portion of the loan to support their different purposes.
 
V. earns his living by fishing near the local village. For this business, he owns a fishing boat, but he does not have fishnets. Thus, he decided to ask for a loan to buy fishnets and fishing gear to support his business. His wife, Mrs. Hort ChanT., is 30 years old and works as a lottery seller for a commission in the local village. With both these occupations, they are able to earn a small profit to support their famiL.. This couple has one child who is two years old.

loans.use: To buy fishnets and fishing gear

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of construction materials (stone, sand, cement, a door, and other items)

loans.name: Sonia Gertrudes

texts.pt:
Sônia Gertrudes M. nasceu na Província de Maputo, sul de Moçambique solteira e mãe de 1 filho de 12 anos de idade, vai a Escola. Fez 12ª classe não continuou porque queria prestar mais atenção ao seu filho. Vive na casa própria com seu filho e sustenta sua mãe enviando algum valor para algumas despesas de casa.

Nunca saiu de Maputo sempre viveu com seus pais nesta cidade, tem um negócio próprio de venda de produtos de primeira necessidade. Não possui nenhum empegado e consegue um lucro de cerca de 3.000.00mt que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancaria.

Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de outros clientes da instituição. Este é o seu segundo empréstimo no valor de 15.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar produtos (arroz, farinha, açúcar, óleo e outros) para aumentar a quantidade de seus produtos.

O seu sonho é de comprar uma viatura para lhe ajudar no transporte de seus produtos. Esta confiante que vai pagar antes do tempo e pedir outro para construir outra casa que vai servir de aluguer para aumentar a renda familiar.
texts.en:
Sônia Gertrudes M. was born in Maputo Province in southern Mozambique.  She is a single mother with a 12-year-old son who goes to school.  Sônia finished twelfth grade but did not continue with school because she wanted to pay more attention to her son.  She lives in her own house with him and supports her mother by sending her some money for household expenses.

Sônia never left Maputo.  She always lived with her parents in this city.  She has her own business selling basic foods.  She has no employees and earns a profit of about 3,000 meticais, which she uses for household expenses.  She also saves some money in her bank account.

She has never had loans from other banks, and she learned about Hluvuku through other customers of this institutions.  This is Sônia's second loan.  She is asking for 15,000 meticais to buy products (rice, flour, sugar, oil and other items) to increase her inventory.

Her dream is to buy a vehicle to help her transport her products.  Sônia is confident that she will pay off the loan ahead of time and ask for another to build a rental house, which will increase her family's income.

loans.use: Purchase products (rice, flour, sugar, oil, etc.)

loans.name: Ruth  Wangare

texts.en:
Ruth Wangare N. has been in the business of selling new clothes for the last 11 years in Kangemi open air market, and she earns a good income. She has a stall where she sells her clothes; most of her customers are passersby and business people who deal with different business types that are located at the open-air market. 

Wangare is 29 years old and married to Peter Mwangi, 36 years old, who works as an accountant at a supermarket, and they are blessed with two children. She was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend and she has no history with any other MFI. Ruth is applying for her third loan of Kshs.25,000 which she intends to use to buy new clothes for sale as she targets the festive season.

In the future Wangare hopes to grow her business and run a large shopping mall and open a branch in Kikuyu.

loans.use: To buy more new clothes for resale during the festive season

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
The desire that Lilibeth harbors in her heart is that of increasing her capital to invest in acquiring more food inventory in her stall. With this, she can create more revenue for her family. Above all, she hopes to offer a better quality of life for her two dependent children. 

Lilibeth wants request a loan of 24,500 PHP. Specifically, the loan funds will be used to pay for hot dogs, meat, fish balls and other supplies. Let’s support this devoted mother to help her keep bringing well-being and security to the members of her family. Lilibeth believes that her business will help her family to rise up and fight against poverty, as well as providing for the needs of her family, most especially in the education of her children. 

As a dedicated member since 2004 of Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI), a Kiva microfinance partner in the Philippines, Lilibeth is thankful for receiving loans to support her business dreams. She hopes to diversify her revenue in the long term to support the basic needs of her family.

The support of ASHI and Kiva lenders will enable her to finally reach her dreams in life: to have an expanded business, fund her children’s education until they finish college, offer a good life for her parents, and have a happy family as well.

loans.use: support her food stall business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase a large number of clothes for his wife’s business

loans.name: Adila's Group

texts.en:
Adila S. is the leader of this group. She is 30 and married. Together with her husband, who is currently working in Bishkek, she is raising two daughters; both of them are schoolgirls. Additionally Adila contributes a lot to the family budget by working at a hospital. A couple of years ago, the family rented land, and out of their profits they have managed to obtain curtains as window decoration. The loan purpose is to purchase necessary household appliances. In future the family aims to obtain a new house.

Adila’s partners:

Ruslan K., 37, married. Two children are being brought up in the family. Ruslan supports his family financially by working as a manager in a farmyard. His main goal is to purchase livestock. 

Gulnura T., 36, married. Together with her husband she is raising one daughter who was born last year. The family earn their livelihood by farming, and besides that, Gulnura works in a children's hospital. The loan purpose is to buy necessary equipment for land cultivation. 

Gulnara A., 36, not married. She earns her living by working as a hairdresser. She reconstructed her apartment in order to make a hairdressing salon. Now she is planning to add some room decorations, and for this purpose she hopes to get a loan. 

Raihan T., 53 and unmarried, has the status of the group treasurer. She is bringing up a daughter all alone. This woman earns money by working as a babysitter. The loan purpose is to obtain household appliances. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase household appliances

loans.name: Aigul's Group

texts.en:
Aigul M. is the leader of this group. She is 35 and married. Together with her spouse, who is a driver she is bringing up three children; the two older are school pupils, and the youngest one is of pre-school age. Aigul is a nanny in an orphanage. Besides those jobs, the family is engaged in cattle breeding; 3 years ago they inherited a bull, and since then their herd has increased. The loan purpose is to purchase two cows for breeding. In future Aigul wants to make house repairs.

Aigul’s partners:

Baktygul S. is the treasurer of the group. She is 34, married. her husband works as a driver. The couple is bringing up a daughter. The whole family is engaged in livestock breeding. In order to increase their herd, Baktygul intends to purchase four sheep, but for this purpose the family needs to get a loan. 

Maria J., 56, is a widow. She has three children. Maria is a charwoman in a clinic, and moreover she is engaged in farming. Her loan purpose is to purchase strawberries to plant. 

Zeinep S., 22, married. Together with her husband, she is raising a daughter. Zeinep is an employee of the military registration and enlistment office. She needs to get a loan in order to purchase a plot of land in the capital. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase cows

loans.name: Kasifa

texts.en:
Kasifa N. lives in the Mulago neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is single and has 2 children, all of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members her mother and her grand children). Kasifa has a business selling second hand clothes.  She has been in this business for 10 years, and she works 7 days out of every week.  Kasifa sells her products at the market, by means of retail.     

Kasifa has requested for a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bales of second hand clothes.   She also generates additional income through selling piped water at her home.The main business challenge(s) for Kasifa include transportation of bales of clothes from Owino market to Mulago market and thieves.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start importing bales of clothes and also selling at wholesale only.    

Kasifa lives in a home that she owns. She has access to electricity and doesn't have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bales of second hand clothes

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Gulmira's Group

texts.en:
Gulmira D. is the leader of the group. She is 42 and married. Her husband is an employee of the Department of Inner Affairs. The couple bring up 3 children. All of them are in school except the youngest one, who is of preschool age. Gulmira works as a head of the cardiology department in the hospital. Three years ago the family started with a cow with a calf. Now, almost all the family members are engaged in cattle breeding. During these years they have managed to increase the total number of animals. The purpose of the loan is to purchase 4 sheep. In the future the family is planning to obtain an apartment in the capital.

Gulmira’s partners:

Kulanda S. is the treasurer of the group. She is 56, a widow and has 2 children, both of them are already grown-up. Kulanda, with the help of her son, breeds cattle. She earns additionally by working as a hospital nurse. Her purpose of her loan is to purchase 2 sheep for increase her livestock. 

Sharyikul B., 55, married. Her family has 4 children. Sharyikul is currently working as a hospital nurse. She is also engaged in cattle breeding. Her loan aim is to purchase 3 sheep to increase the total number of animals. 

Gulnara M., 27 is not married. She is a nurse in the cardiologic department. She is also engaged in selling frozen foodstuff. The loan purpose is to purchase more stuff to increase her inventory. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase sheep

loans.name: Tep

texts.en: Tep S., 44 years old, works as internal staff for a local company in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia. She typically makes around $3.33 of profit each day to meet what her family needs. Tep S. is married to 48-year-old, Sok Chea, a furniture maker who makes items such as tables, beds, and chairs. This couple has been married for several years and has two children. One of them is a teenager attending school and one is married and works as policeman. Tep S. is concerned about walking to work as she doesn’t own a vehicle. Tep S. decided to seek a loan to purchase a used motorcycle for transportation  to work.

loans.use: To purchase a used motorcycle for riding to work.

loans.name: Nazgul's Group

texts.en:
Nazgul A. is the leader of the group. She is 37 and married. Together with her spouse, who earns money by working as a security guard, they have brought up two children. Both of them attend school. Nazgul augments the family’s income by working as an accountant in a paper factory. Her family is also engaged in breeding livestock. 5 years ago they were presented a sheep.  With the profits earned from raising livestock, Nazgul has managed to purchase a car. The purpose of this loan is to obtain 2 sheep for breeding. In the future the family plans to open their own café.

Nazgul’s partners:

Askarbek T., 45 is married. The couple have 3 children. She is the head of the family and raises money by working in a workshop in the paper factory. The loan purpose is to obtain necessary equipment for mowing hay. 

Duishebai O., 53 is married. Both of his 2 children live separately. He is the head of the family and is a manger in a paper factory. besides He also breeds cattle to resell. The aim of loan is to buy 2 cows to increase stock .

Chinara S. is the treasurer of the group, she is 33 and married. Her family has 3 children. Chinara is an accountant in a paper producing factory. The loan purpose is to purchase 2 tons of coal for winter. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase sheep

loans.name: Bathuu

texts.en:
Bathuu D. is 43 years old and lives with his wife and four children in the Songinohairhan district of Ulaanbaatar, capital of Mongolia. He and his family live in a ger, which is a traditional Mongolian housing tent. He has two children who are attending university and another child who attends a local school. Bathuu is disabled with a paralyzed leg.

Bathuu operates a grocery store. His wife helps with his business. He started his grocery trading business in 2000 with a small shop and has since expanded his business into grocery store. Unfortunately, his first business was not successful and he had to close it in 2008. Bathuu did not give up on his plans to own a business, however, and purchased a place next to a trauma hospital to re-establish his grocery store in 2009. Since then, he has built a stable operation and has managed to increase his working capital by selling all kinds of cellphone units in his store. He is already making plans to expand his shop by obtaining a license from the Professional Inspection Office. 

Bathuu is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more products to expand the number of products in his grocery shop.

loans.use: To purchase more products

loans.name: Nyamjav

texts.en:
Nyamjav M. is 54 years old and lives with his wife and three children in Arhangai province in central Mongolia. He and his family have been living in their own apartment for past 9 years. His oldest daughter is a university student while his two sons, ages 11 and 12, attend a local secondary school. 

Nyamjav currently operates a wooden products making business in his town. He designs and produces many different styles and sizes of furniture that he sells throughout his community. He started his business in 1989 with capital of 50,000 MNT and has found success in his production and trade. Today, his business is well established in the local area, and his working capital exceeds 4,200,000 MNT. For the future, Nyamjav says, "My dreams are to expand my business and to provide a good education for my children." 

He is requesting a 500,000 MNT loan to purchase more wood and timber to make wooden products.

loans.use: To purchase more wood and timber

loans.name: Kenjegul's Group

texts.en:
Kenjegul K. is the leader of the group. She is 50, married.  With her husband she has 6 grown children; two daughters are married and live on their own, the elder son is also married and currently works in Russia as an odd-job man. 

In 2006 from the harvest profits the family purchased cattle and began their own farming business. During the 4 years of running this business they have managed to make repairs to their house. Today Kenjegul wants to increase the total number of farm animals, she intends to obtain 2 more calves.  For this purpose she needs to get a loan. In the future the family plans to purchase furniture and household appliances.   

Kenjegul’s partners:

Nurlan A., 28, married. Together with his wife he brings up a daughter. Nurlan raises family capital by reselling potatoes. Out of the profits he has managed to obtain a foreign car. His loan purpose is to purchase 5 tons of potato for further reselling. 

Edilbek T., 31, married. He has 3 children, all of them are of preschool age. The family lives on cattle breeding and milk selling (10 liters daily). Edilbek wants to purchase 2 livestock animals to increase the total number of cattle. 

Mairamgul C. is the treasurer of the group. She is 28, married. Together with her herder-husband she brings up a daughter. The family earns their livelihood by milk selling and cattle breeding. The loan purpose is to buy 2 livestock animals for fattening. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (being environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase calves for cattle business, and potatoes for resale business.

loans.name: Vandan

texts.en:
Vandan G. is 34 years old and lives with his wife and three daughters, ages 14, 12 and 7, in the Arhangai province of Mongolia. He and his family have been living in an apartment since 2002. All of his three daughters attend a local secondary school. 

Vandan and his wife work together in their retail clothing business. They began this business in 2003 with a working capital of 500,000 MNT and after several years of hard work, their working capital now exceeds 2,800,000 MNT. He has used his earnings to support his family. Vandan says, "All I want is to raise my children to be good people with high education".

Vandan is requesting a 3,500,000 MNT loan to purchase more clothing items in order to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase clothing for resale.

loans.name: Namhia

texts.en:
Namhia T. is a 48-year-old single mother with four children. She lives with her children in the Arhangai province of Mongolia in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent for the past 17 years. Her younger daughter, age 22, attends university and her youngest daughter, age 13, attends a local middle school. 

Namhia operates a food retail business in her town. She began the business in 2009 selling her sibling's products and has since expanded her business by gaining her own working capital. After years of operation, she has built a stable business and has gained a positive reputation among her customers. Her earnings have enabled her to support her family. For the future, she hopes to continue growing her grocery trading business.  She is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT  loan to purchase a large amount of food, goodies to sell.

loans.use: To purchase food for resale.

loans.name: Tsolmon

texts.en:
Tsolmon D. is 35 years old and lives with her husband and two daughters in the Songinohairhan district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She and her family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Her oldest daughter attends a local secondary school and her youngest daughter is in kindergarten. 

Tsolmon operates a meat trading business with the help of her husband. Her husband is responsible for purchasing meats from Dundgovi province and she sells those products in her stall as a wholesaler and retailer. She started her business in a rented stall in 2003 and has since gained much experience. 

After many years of owning this business, her daily earnings have reached 200,000 MNT. With her business revenues, she was able to build a house for her family. Her business currently operates at a stable level and she continues to make progress. She hopes to grow her business in the future and start to save her business profits by opening an account at the bank. Tsolmon is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase and preserve more meat in order to increase her sales.

loans.use: To purchase meat for resale.

loans.name: Ibagdathan

texts.en:
Ibagdathan S. is a 54 year-old villager who lives in Masy village, in the south of Kyrgyzstan. She is married and has one daughter.  She graduated from the Andizhan cotton institute and has devoted 35 years of her life to cotton cultivating.  

Her responsible and precise attitude to this activity allowed Ibagdathan to achieve success and broaden her business by purchasing livestock. Currently she breeds twelve cows and earns about 15,000 Kyrgyz Soms a month.  

Ibagdathan is a reliable Bai-Tushum borrower who repaid her loans without any delay and used them as intended. Now Ibagdathan needs to manure the land to get a good harvest next year.  That is why she is applying for a loan of 100,000 Kyrgyz Soms to purchase fertilizers and to plant the seeds.  

With the revenues from the business, she plans to build a house for her family. Ibagdathan is a real go-getter and makes every effort to improve her family’s life. 

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert N. is 25 years old. He is single and without any kids of his own to support.   Robert is a farmer and has been farming on his own piece of land for the last five years.
	
He learned about KADET through a friend who is a KADET-registered client in his area of residence. This will be his second loan which he is planning spend to buy seeds, fertilizer and chemicals for his wheat farm. 

He is anticipating buying some farm machineries with the anticipated profit from the expanded farming activity, and improving his living standards.

He is a hardworking man who is determined to achieve his goals.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, sprays and fertilizers for wheat farm.

loans.name: Ronkonga

texts.en:
Ronkonka Saoli is 37 years old and is married to Nalakiti Saoli.  He supports six people in his family. 

Saoli is a farmer and does the farming on his own piece of land which he has been doing for the last ten years.

He learned about KADET through a marketing campaign done by KADET staff in his area of residence. This will be his second loan, which he is planning to use to buy seedings and to operate the farm.  He hopes to use the profit from this loan to acquire more land for farming to meet the demand for wheat.

His hope and dream is to become a large scale farmer and have his own farm machinery.

He is a hardworking man who is determined to achieve his goals.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and operate wheat farm.

loans.name: Norah

texts.en:
Norah  K.  lives in the Ntinda neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has 4 children, all of whom are in school.    She also takes care of additional family members (mother and her sister's children).  

Norah has a bar business.  She changed her business enterprise from second-hand clothing to the bar business two months ago.  She works 7 days a  week.   Norah sells wholesale/retail out of her home.  Norah has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more crates of beer, soda, and boxes of mineral water.   She also generates additional income through renting rooms.

The main business challenge for Norah includes the transportation of crates of beer in the rainy season.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a fully stocked bar and also to start selling wholesale only.   Norah lives in a home that she owns.  She has access to electricity and  piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy beer, soda, and mineral water for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase tools for vehicle repair shop.

loans.name: Lamara

texts.en:
Lamara M. is 41 years old and married to Nolari M..   He supports five people in his family.

M. is a farmer and does the farming on his own piece of land which he has been doing for last seven years.

He learned about KADET from marketing awareness done by KADET staff in his area. This will be his second loan which he is planning to use to buy young sheep for fattening to sell later at a profit and also to prepare his land for wheat farming.
	
With the anticipated profit he intends to acquire a bigger piece of land and fence it for grazing.

His future dream is that he will become a large scale farmer in cattle rearing and wheat farming.

loans.use: To buy sheep stock and prepare land for wheat farming.

loans.name: Tubula

texts.en:
Tubula M. is 32 years old.  He is a farmer and supports six people in his family. He is married to Nailepu M. and has children aged between 4 months and 10 years. Nailepu is a house wife and she helps Tubula in his farming activity.

Tubula does wheat farming which he has been doing for the last seven  years.  This will be his second loan and he is planning to spend twenty thousand KES to buy chemical and fertilizer, and forty thousand KES to spray his wheat farm.

He is planning to use the anticipated profit from his farming to expand his farming activity by leasing a bigger piece of land to increase his wheat production.  

His hopes and dream is that he will become a large scale farmer, owning a bigger piece of land and be financially stable to support his family

loans.use: To buy fertilizer/spray for wheat farm.

loans.name: Leyla

texts.ru:
Leyla A. 27 let. Ona zamujem i imeyet 3 detey sin 7 let uchitsya v shkole doch 5 let i sin 3 let. Leyla yavlyayetsya IDP personom ona pereselenec iz Xodjali i seychas projivayet v Absheron regionevmeste so semyoy. 

Ona uje 3 qoda kak imeyet maqazin. Seychas ona nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chto bi kupit vitrinniye xolodilniki  dlya razvitiya svoyeqo biznessa.
texts.en: Leyla A. is 27 years old.  She is married and has 3 children: 7-year-old son, who goes to school, 5-year-old daughter and 3-year-old son.  Leyla is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person).  She is a refugee from Xodjali and now lives in the Absheron region with her family.  Leyla has owned a store for 3 years.  Currently, she needs 2000 AZN in order to buy display refrigerators for the development of her business.

loans.use: Purchase of display refrigerators for the store

loans.name: Reviewsakamo

texts.en:
Sakamo Ole Ndayia is 35-years-old. He is married to Talesha and a father of children aged between 10 months and 7 years. Sakamo is a farmer and he does the farming on his own piece of land, which he has been doing for the past eight years.

Sakamo learned about KADET from other members in a group already registered with KADET in his area of residence. This will be his second loan which he is planning to spend on preparing land for planting more wheat and also to buy some chemicals for the crop that is already planted. Wheat has been doing well in his area due to good climatic conditions. He hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to expand his farming activity from small scale to commercial farming.

Sakamo’s dream is do large scale farming and to be the best wheat farmer in his area. He is a hard working man who is determined to achieve his set goals

loans.use: To prepare land to planting wheat, and to buy chemicals for his current crop.

loans.name: Constancia Jose

texts.pt:
Constância José C. conseguiu comprar todo o material que foi acordado com a Instituição e conseguiu pagar o seu empréstimo segundo o calendário estabelecido.

O seu negocio esta a um ritmo satisfatório principalmente agora que se aproxima a quadra festiva. Com este empréstimo no valor de 15.000.00mt pretende comprar produtos (arroz, açúcar, farinha, óleo e outros) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria e satisfazer a demanda da sua clientela.

As mudanças verificadas na sua vida têm apenas a ver com o crescimento do seu negócio. No futuro pretende solicitar mais empréstimos para aplicar na habitação.
texts.en:
Constância José C. was able to buy all the material that was in the agreement with the Institution and paid off her loan on schedule.

Her business is doing well now, mainly because the holiday season is approaching.  With this loan of 15,000 meticais, she intends to buy products (rice, sugar, flour, oil and other items) to increase her inventory and satisfy customer demand.

The changes that have occurred in Constância's life have little to do with the growth of her business.  In the future, she would like to ask for more loans to use for her house.

loans.use: Purchase products (rice, sugar, flour, oil, etc.)

loans.name: Kipailoi

texts.en:
Kipailoi Ole M. is 45-years-old. He is married and a father of four children, aged between three and twenty-three years. He is a farmer and he does the farming on his own piece of land, which he has been doing for the past twelve years.

Kipailoi learned about KADET through a friend who is already a registered member in KADET. This will be his second loan. He is planning to spend forty thousand KES to buy fertilizer and chemicals to spray his already growing wheat. He hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to expand his farming activity from small scale to commercial farming.

Kipailoi's dream is to do large scale farming, attain financial independence and to improve the living standard of his family. He is a hardworking man who is determined to achieve his set goals.

loans.use: fertilizer and chemicals

loans.name: Reviewann

texts.en:
Ann S. is 18-years-old. She is newly married to Rufus Mathe. She is a farmer and she does the farming on her own piece of land, which she has been doing for one year.

Ann learned about KADET from other women who are already registered as clients. This will be her first loan. She is planning to increase her production by purchasing more seeds and insecticides. With the profits she hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, she plans to and expand her business from small scale to large scale farming.

Her future dream is that she will be able to build her own house and be the best farmer in her area. Ann also believes she is hard working and she only needs the resources to attain her goals.

loans.use: To purchase more seeds and insecticide.

loans.name: Alda Aurelio

texts.pt:
Alda Aurélio Manhiça nasceu no Distrito de Namaacha, Província de Maputo, sul de Moçambique solteira e mãe de 1 filho de 11 anos de idade, vai a Escola. Freqüenta 9ª classe no curso noturno. Vive na casa de aluguer com seu filho e sustenta seus irmãos enviando algum valor para algumas despesas de casa.

Saiu de Namaacha para Boane com seus pais e depois de ter o seu primeiro filho decidiu começar uma nova vida. Tem um negócio próprio de venda de bebidas ha mais de 3 anos e consegue um rendimento de cerca de 4.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e não consegue poupar sempre devido ao elevado custo de vida.

Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de sua irmã que também é cliente da instituição. Este é o seu primeiro empréstimo no valor de 10.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, areia, ferro, pedra e outros) para dar continuidade com a construção da sua casa.

Esta confiante que vai pagar antes do tempo e pedir outro para concluir a sua casa.
texts.en:
Alda Aurélio Manhiça was born in the district of Namaacha, in the province of Maputo in the south of Mozambique. She is single and has an 11-year-old son who attends school. Alda is currently taking night classes to finish 9th grade. She lives with her son in a rental house and helps support her siblings by sending them money to help with everyday expenses.

Alda left Namaacha for the Boane district of Maputo with her parents. After the birth of her son she decided to make a new start in life. She has owned her own business, selling various beverages, for more than 3 years. She has a monthly income of around 4000 Meticais. She uses this income to cover household expenses and isn't always able to put money away in savings because of the high cost of living. 

Alda has never taken out a loan with another bank. She found out about Hluvuku [the Kiva Field Partner] through her sister, who also works with the institution. This is her 1st loan, for the amount of 10,000 Meticais. She plans to use this money to buy construction materials (cement, sand, iron, stone and other items) in order to continue working on the construction of her home. 

She is confident that she will be able to repay the loan even earlier than required, and then take out another loan to finish with the construction.

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials (cement, sand, iron, stone and other items)

loans.name: Djahangir

texts.ru:
Djahangir H. 32 let. Djahangir yavlyayetsya IDP personom on pereselenec iz Fuzuli, seychas projivayet v Absheron regione vmeste so svoyey semyoy.

Djahangir uje 8 let kak zanimayetsya etim biznessom prodaji produktov v svayom maqazine. Etomu biznesu on nauchilsya u svoyeqo otca. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chto bi kupit produkti dlya pereprodaji.
texts.en: Djahangir H. is 32 years old.  He is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person).  He is a refugee from Fuzuli and now lives in the Absheron region with his family.  Djahangir has been involved in the business of selling products at his store for 8 years.  He learned this business from his father.  Currently, Djahangir needs 2000 AZN in order to buy products for resale.

loans.use: Purchase of products

loans.name: Reviewelkanah

texts.en:
Elkana M. is 45 years old. He is married and supports a family of six members. His children are between 4 and 20 years of age. He has a retail shop, that he has been running for the last three years, on a busy street in Narok. 

Elkana learned about KADET from marketing awareness done by KADET staff in his area. This will be his second loan. He is planning to use the loan to boost his capital so that he can buy more goods for his store. With the anticipated profit he intends to buy his own car inorder to transport goods to different markets with ease and to expand his business.

Elkana's future dream is that he will become a wholesaler. He is a hardworking man who is determined to achieve his set goals.

loans.use: To purchase more goods for his store.

loans.name: Beth Wanjiru

texts.en:
Beth Wanjiru has been offering tailoring services in Gatakaini in Thika town for 10 years. Her customers are mostly people who work in Thika town and also some of her neighbours, who are actually aware of her talent of dress making. Out of this business she earns a monthly profit of KES 5,400. Beth is a single mother of one child.

Beth has no history with any other MFI. She is applying for her third loan from KADET LTD. She intends to buy more stock of clothing materials for making the latest fashions for the festive season. Communities in Kenya treasure this Christmas time and treat it with better, new dresses. Beth believes this period is her highest peak season for her business.

She will plough profits back into the business for it to be stable and, in the future, she plans to buy a plot of land for herself and to educate her child.

loans.use: To buy more clothing materials to make the latest fashionable dresses.

loans.name: Maato Ene

texts.en:
Maato has been rearing livestock to sell in Naivasha town for the last seven years now. She is 24 years old, married to Nkitei Saapai and they have two children.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by her friend and this will be her first loan. She plans to use the cash to buy more sheep, which she will rear and sell later at a profit.

In the future, Maato hopes to diversify her sources of income and open a boutique in town.

loans.use: To buy more sheep to rear and sell later, at a profit.

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha B. lives in the Kawempe neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has 7 children, all of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (four relatives: sisters and brother).

Aisha has a business of selling bananas. She has been in this business for over 10 years, and she works 6 days out of every week. Aisha sells her products at the market by means of wholesale and retail. Aisha has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bunches of bananas. She also generates additional income through rental rooms and motorcycle for hire.

The main business challenge(s) for Aisha include transportation and the rainy season, which makes village roads impassable. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a delivery van and also to built other rental rooms. Aisha lives in a home that she owns. She has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and medication.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a member of Nuru Investment group registered under Faulu Kenya. He is married and a father of three. He is a hardworking business man who does tailoring for a living.  

John's customers are people of his area of residence. Apart from tailoring, he also practises farming. Faulu Kenya has been a blessing to his business, especially after he took out his first loan. He was able to improve his business. He has been operating his business for five years and hopes to succeed.  He has requested for a loan of 70,000 Kes to buy a sewing machine and an overlock (serger) machine.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine and an overlock (serger) machine.

loans.name: Meoli Ole

texts.en:
Meoli S., aged 37 years, is a tailor. He is married to Ene sinei, a farmer. Together they have three children aged 10,14 and 17 years. His business is at Bissil in Kajiado District. He was introduced to Kadet by the Credit officer in charge of Kitengela office.

Meoli has been running this business for two years and his monthly profit is Kes 15,000. After he gets the loan he will buy fabric for making men's trousers and suits and also ladies suits and dresses. His customers are happy with his designs.

If the loan boosts the business, Meoli plans to open another shop in Kajiado. His future dreams is to start making school uniforms and eventually become a supplier to all nearby schools.

Meoli is hardworking and focused.

loans.use: To buy fabrics for making men's and women's suits.

loans.name: Mutua

texts.en:
Mutua M., aged 50 years, is a contractor in the building industry. He is married to Rose, aged 46 years, and together they have three children, aged 21, 19, and nine years. His business office is normally based at Kikomba market in Tala.

Mutua learned about KADET LTD through the Kadet credit officer in charge of the Tala office. His business generates a monthly profit of KES 20,000 and all his clients, both within and outside Kikomba market, are happy with his services.

With the loan, Mutua plans to buy working tools. With the extra income generated, he will buy some agricultural products to boost his wife’s farm.

Mutua, who describes himself as hardworking, dreams of having a construction company and take better care of his family.

loans.use: To buy additional tools for construction.

loans.name: Annah Jillo

texts.en:
Annah Jillo is 39 years old and is married to John Kinyimu who is a police officer. Together they have two children aged 14 and 8.  She has a boutique where she sells clothes to people in Kajiado market and its surroundings.  She learned about Kadet Ltd in a Kadet Business awareness meeting which was conducted at Kajiado market.

The boutique business gives Annah a monthly income of Kshs 4,000 which she uses to help her husband in taking care of their family. With the loan she plans to use Kshs 25,000 to buy clothes for selling and the other Kshs 25,000 to rent and open a shop in Kitengela town where there are more customers.

She intends to grow her business to wholesale with the extra money generated from the business.

Annah describes herself as enterprising.

loans.use: To buy clothes for resale and open a second shop.

loans.name: Rikaton

texts.en:
Rikaton N., age 42, is married to N. who is a farmer.  Together they have four children aged 20, 13, 10, and 2.   She lives in Enkaroni and her business is in the Bissil market which is in Kitengela.  She sells curios and also practises farming as a secondary business. She was introduced to Kadet by the Credit Officer in charge of the Kitengela office.

Rikaton has been running this business for six years and she makes a monthly profit of Kshs 7,000.  The Bissil market is a very busy market.  With the loan she plans to buy more curios, swords and belts for resale, and with the extra income generated she will expand her business and open shops in Nairobi.

With the big plans Rikaton has for the future, she has a dream to sell her curios to tourists in Nairobi.

Rikaton is hardworking and ambitious.

loans.use: To buy curios for resale.

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha S. lives in the Kisaasi neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is widowed and has  4 children, all of whom are in school.   She also takes care of additional family members (in- laws).  Aisha  has a poultry farming business.  She has been in this business for over 10 years, and she works 7 days out of every week.    

Aisha sells her products from home, by means of wholesale/retail.  Aisha  has requested a loan of 1,500,000  Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of chicken feeds.  She also generates additional income through brick laying and room renting.

The main business challenges for Aisha include thieves and the ever increasing prices of chicken feeds.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are  to own a delivery van and also to own 2000 chickens.    

Aisha lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and medication.

loans.use: To buy chicken feeds  for poultry farm business.

loans.name: Ntiti

texts.en:
Ntiti has been rearing animals to sell in Naivasha town for the last four years.  She is 23 years old, married to Tumate Ole Kararei and they have three children.

She was introduced to KADET by her friend and this will be her first loan. She plans to use the money to buy more sheep and goats which she will rear and sell later at a profit.

In the future, Ntiti hopes to increase her income from her livestock business so that she can send all her children to school.

loans.use: To buy sheep and goats to raise and resell.

loans.name: Togolet Ole

texts.en:
Togolet has been rearing livestock to sell in Naivasha town for the last 12 years.  He is 43 years old, married to Tupepe Ene Tokore and they have two children.

He was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his first loan.  He plans to use the money to buy five calves which he will rear and sell later for a profit.

In the future, Togolet hopes to increase the number of livestock he rears so that he may be able to supply meat to the Kenya Meat Commision in bulk.

loans.use: To buy five calves to raise and resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy food stocks for resale.

loans.name: Carmen Alicia

texts.es:
Carmen Alicia vive en la ciudad hermosa del Cusco, Perú y desde hace mucho tiempo que participa en el banco comunal “Patrón de San Sebastián” de la Unidad de Micro finanzas Arariwa. Carmen Alicia y su esposo Edgar Percy,  tienen tres hijos y tienen un pequeño negocio familiar de venta de sándwich y, ella desempeña se dedica a preparar sándwich.
     
Carmen Alicia con su próximo préstamo que espera recibir de $ 300 USD, ella invertirá el dinero para aumentar el capital del negocio y desea comprar insumos como por ejemplo panes, tomates, carne, pollo y muchas cosas más. 

La socio se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Carmen Alicia lives in the beautiful city of Cusco, Perú and has participated in Arariwa’s Micro Finances Unit’s “Patrón de San Sebastián” communal bank for a long time. Carmen Alicia and her husband, Edgar Percy, have three children and a small family sandwich shop; she makes the sandwiches.

Carmen Alicia expects to use her next, $300 USD, loan to buy ingredients like: bread, tomatoes, meat, chicken and many other things.

She is grateful for the opportunity provided and commits to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: To buy ingredients like bread, tomatos, meat, chicken and many other things.

loans.name: David

texts.en: David K. runs a retail shop and hotel. He is 59 years old and married to Josphine Sabula, a housewife who does not produce any income. He is supporting a family of nine people. David has been in his business for 19 years and right now his monthly income is 10,000 Kenyan shillings (KES). He is borrowing 50,000 KES to purchase stock for his butchery and the hotel. He will use the anticipated profit to expand the butchery. This is his second loan from KADET. The previous loan was repaid successfully. He hopes and dreams to open another retail shop in Kabarnet town.

loans.use: To purchase stock for a butchery and hotel

loans.name: Edgar Percy

texts.es:
Edgar Percy tiene 72 años, es casado, tiene tres hijos, vive en la ciudad hermosa del Cusco, Perú y desde hace mucho tiempo que participa en el banco comunal “Patrón de San Sebastián” de la Unidad de Micro finanzas Arariwa. Edgar Percy es un trabajador jubilado pero sigue trabajando en su pequeño negocio de venta de sándwich y desempeña el cargo de administrador.
     
Edgar Percy con su próximo préstamo que espera recibir de $ 400 USD, él invertirá el dinero para aumentar el capital del negocio y desea comprar insumos como por ejemplo panes, tomates, carne, pollo y muchas cosas más. 

El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Edgar Percy, 72, has three children.  He lives in the beautiful city of Cusco, Perú.   He has collaborated with Arariwa’s Micro Finance Unit’s “Patrón de San Sebastián” communal bank for a long time.  Edgar Percy is a retired worker but he continues to work as Administrator of a small sandwich shop.

Edgar Percy expects to use his next, $400 USD, loan to buy ingredients like: bread, tomatoes, meat, chicken and many other things.

He is grateful for the opportunity provided through this means and pledges to repay in at timely fashion.

loans.use: To buy ingredients like bread, tomatoes, meat, chicken and many other things.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es:
Patricia tiene 23 años, es soltera, vive en la ciudad hermosa del Cusco, Perú y desde hace mucho tiempo que participa en el banco comunal “Patrón de San Sebastián” de la Unidad de Micro finanzas Arariwa. Patricia es joven hermosa y trabajadora que es profesional en diseño grafico y trabaja en un empresa de diseño. Patricia y su papá Ricardo tienen un pequeño negocio familiar que consiste en brindar servicios de hospedaje.
     
Patricia con su próximo préstamo que espera recibir de $ 600 USD, ella invertirá el dinero para aumentar el capital del negocio y desea construir más habitaciones del hospedaje. 

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Patricia, 23, is single.  She lives in the beautiful city of Cusco, Perú and has collaborated with Arariwa’s Micro Finance Unit’s “Patrón de San Sebastián” communal bank for a long time.  

Patricia is a beautiful, hard working young woman who is a professional Graphic Designer employed by a design firm.  

Patricia and her father have a small family business consisting of rental rooms. Patricia will use her next, $600 USD, loan to build more rental rooms.

She is grateful for the opportunity provided and commits to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: To build more rental rooms.

loans.name: Zipporah Muthoni

texts.en:
Zipporah has been selling charcoal in Naivasha for the last three years. She is 30 years old, married to Peter M. and they have three children. 

Zipporah was introduced to KADET by her friend and this will be her second loan. She paid her first loan of 15,000 Kenyan shillings well and in good time. She plans to use this second loan to buy three sacks of charcoal and add fruits for resale. With these two businesses she forsees more profits and thus a better standard of living for her and her family.

Zipporah is a hardworking and ambitious lady.

loans.use: To buy three sacks of charcoal and also fruits for sale

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es:
Marisol tiene 30 años, es conviviente y participa en el banco comunal “Señor De Los Temblores II” de la Unidad de Micro finanzas Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco, Perú. Marisol es una madre emprendedora y trabajadora que se dedica a la venta de gorros y tambien se dedica a la venta comida. (En la ciudad de Cusco se encuentra ubicada una de las octavas maravillas del Mundo que es la ciudadela de los Incas llamado Machupicchu).  

Marisol con su próximo préstamo que espera recibir de S/. 1500 nuevos soles, ella invertirá el dinero para uso personal. 
 
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Marisol is 30 years old, she has a live-in partner and participates in the community bank “Señor De Los Temblores II” of the Arariwa microfinance unit of the city of Cusco, Peru. Marisol is an entrepreneur and working mother who sells hats and food. (One of the eight wonders of the world is located in Cusco, the citadel of the Incas called Machu Picchu).

Marisol, with her next loan which she expects of 1500 PEN will invest the money on personal uses.
 
The member is grateful for the opportunity afforded to her by this medium and agrees to maker her payments on time.

loans.use: Purchase rice, sugar, pasta and other supplies.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es:
Lourdes vive en la hermosa ciudad del Cusco, Perú y desde hace mucho tiempo que participa en el banco comunal “Patrón de San Sebastián” de la Unidad de Micro finanzas Arariwa. Lourdes tiene 2 hijos y se considera una madre trabajadora y emprendedora, ella tiene un pequeño negocio que consiste en vender artesanía de tipo bisutería. Lourdes también tiene un carro que brinda servicios de transportes.  
     
Lourdes con su próximo préstamo que espera recibir de $ 400 USD, ella invertirá el dinero para el mantenimiento del carro y desea comprar repuestos como llantas y muchas cosas más que necesita el carro. 

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Lourdes lives in the beautiful city of Cusco, Peru and has been a member of Arariwa's “Patrón de San Sebastián” community bank for a long time.  Lourdes has 2 children and considers herself to be a hard-working and enterprising mother.  She has a small business selling hand-made jewelry.  Lourdes also has a car with which she provides transport services.

Lourdes will use this loan for $400USD to have maintenance work done on her car.  She would like to buy new parts for it such as tires and many other things that it needs.

Lourdes is grateful for the opportunity which she is being given with this loan and she pledges to make her repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To buy spare parts such as tires and many other things which her car needs

loans.name: Enrique

texts.es:
Enrique tiene 23 años, es soltero y participa en el banco comunal “Señor de Los Temblores II” de la Unidad de Micro finanzas Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco, Perú.  Enrique es un joven emprendedor y trabajador que se dedica a brindar servicio de taxi en ciudad del Cusco. (En la ciudad de Cusco se encuentra ubicada una de las octavas maravillas del Mundo que es la ciudadela de los Incas llamado Machupicchu).  

Enrique con su próximo préstamo que espera recibir de S/. 1500 nuevos soles, él pagara las ultimas letras del taxi que compro a crédito. 
 
El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Enrique is 23 years old and single.  He is a member of Arariwa's “Señor de Los Temblores II” community bank in the city of Cusco, Peru.  Enrique is an enterprising and hard-working young man who offers taxi services in the city of Cusco (The city of Cusco is home to one of the eight wonders of the world, the citadel of the Incas known as Machu Picchu).

Enrique will use his loan for 1,500 nuevos soles to pay off the last bills for his taxi which he bought on credit.

He is grateful for the opportunity which he is being given with this loan and he pledges to make his repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To pay off the last bills for his taxi which he bought on credit

loans.name: Danitza Soledad

texts.es:
Danitza tiene 19 años, es soltera y participa en el banco comunal “Señor De Los Temblores II” de la Unidad de Micro finanzas Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco, Perú. Danitza es una joven emprendedora y trabajadora que se dedica a la confección y venta de artesanía de tipo platería en la ciudad de “Aguas calientes”. (La ciudad de “Aguas Calientes” se encuentra ubicada de camino  a una de las octavas maravillas del Mundo que es la ciudadela de los Incas llamado Machupicchu).  

Danitza con su próximo préstamo que espera recibir de S/. 1500 nuevos soles, ella invertirá el dinero para aumentar el capital del negocio y desea comprar materiales de tipo platería para la elaboración de la artesanía. 
 
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Danitza is 19 years old and single.  She is a member of Arariwa's “Señor De Los Temblores II” community bank in the city of Cusco, Peru.  Danitza is an enterprising and hard-working young woman who makes and sells silver handicrafts in the city of Aguas Calientes (Aguas Calientes is located on the road to one of the eight wonders of the world, the Inca citadel known as Machu Picchu).

Danitza will use her loan for 1,500 nuevos soles to increase her business capital.  She would like to buy materials for creating her silverwork.

She is grateful for the opportunity which she is being given with this loan and she pledges to make her repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To buy materials for making silver handicrafts

loans.name: Carlos Andres

texts.es:
Carlos Andres tiene 46 años, es casado, tiene un hijo, vive en la ciudad hermosa del Cusco, Perú y desde hace mucho tiempo que participa en el banco comunal “Patrón de San Sebastián” de la Unidad de Micro finanzas Arariwa. Carlos Andres es un padre trabajador y emprendedor que trabaja en el Hotel “Andre” y desempeña el cargo de administrador.
     
Carlos Andres con su próximo préstamo que espera recibir de $ 250 USD, él invertirá para uso personal  y no especifico para que exactamente. 

El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Carlos Andres is 46 years old, married, and has a son. He lives in the beautiful city of Cusco, and has for some time participated in the “Patron de San Sebastian” communal bank of the Arariwa Micro-finance Unit.  Carlos Andres is a hard-working and enterprising father who works in the Hotel Andre as its administrator.

For his new loan, Carlos Andres expects to receive $250 U.S. dollars, to be used for unspecified personal needs.

Carlos Andres is grateful for the opportunity offered through this means and also, he promises to comply with all corresponding payments on schedule.

loans.use: FOR HIS PERSONAL NEEDS

loans.name: Sofia

texts.es:
Sofia tiene 45 años, es casada y participa en el banco comunal “Señor De Los Temblores II” de la Unidad de Micro finanzas Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco, Perú. Sofia es una madre emprendedora y trabajadora que se dedica a la venta de comida en la feria sabatina de Huancaro de la ciudad del Cusco. (En la ciudad de Cusco se encuentra ubicada una de las octavas maravillas del Mundo que es la ciudadela de los Incas llamado Machupicchu).  

Sofia con su próximo préstamo que espera recibir de S/. 500 nuevos soles, ella invertirá el dinero para aumentar el capital del negocio y desea comprar insumos como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar, fideos, verduras, carnes y muchas cosas más.
 
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Sofia is 45 years old and married.  She is a member of the Señor De Los Temblores II Communal Bank with the Arariwa microfinance entity in the city of Cusco, Perú.  Sofia is an enterprising and hard-working mother.  She sells food in the Sabatina Fair of Huancaro in the city of Cusco.  (One of the eight wonders of the world, the Inca citadel Machupicchu, can be found in the city of Cusco.) 

With her next loan for 500 soles that she hopes to receive Sofia will increase her business capital.  She wishes to buy ingredients like rice, sugar, noodles, vegetables, meat, and many other things.

She is grateful for the opportunity provided and commits to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: To buy ingredients like rice, sugar, noodles, vegetables, meat, and many other things

loans.name: Yolanda Maritza

texts.es:
Yolanda Maritza tiene 53 años, es casada, tiene tres hijos, vive en la ciudad del Cusco, Perú y desde hace mucho tiempo que participa en el banco comunal “Patrón de San Sebastián” de la Unidad de Micro finanzas Arariwa. Yolanda Maritza es una mujer emprendedora que alterna las actividades del hogar con las actividades de su trabajo y negocio. Yolanda trabaja en el hotel “Andre” como recepcionista y también se dedica a la venta de zapatos.  
     
Yolanda Maritza con su próximo préstamo que espera recibir de $ 250 USD, ella invertirá para aumentar el capital de negocio y desea comprar más zapatos. 

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Yolanda Maritza, age 53, is married. She has three children and lives in the city of Cusco, Perú. For a long time she has participated in the Araiwa Microfinance Unit’s “Patrón de San Sebastián” communal bank.

Yolanda Maritza is an enterprising woman who alternates household activities with the activities of her work and business. Yolanda works in the hotel Andre as a desk clerk and also is engaged in the sale of shoes.

With her next loan Yolanda Maritza hopes to receive US$250 which she will invest in adding to the capital of her business. She wants to purchase more shoes. The member is grateful for the opportunity offered by means of this loan and also promises to make payments in accordance with the schedule.

loans.use: To purchase more shoes.

loans.name: Maria Jesusa

texts.es:
Maria Jesusa; tiene 54 años,   vive en la hermosa ciudad del Cusco, Perú y desD. hace mucho tiempo que participa en el banco comunal “Patrón D. San Sebastián” D. la Unidad D. Micro finanzas Arariwa. Maria Jesusa tiene 4 hijos y se considera una madre trabajadora y emprendedora, ella es ama D. casa y se dedica al cuidado D. su nieto. 

Maria Jesusa con su próximo préstamo que espera recibir D. $ 300 USD, ella invertirá el dinero para comprar tejas para cercar el muro D. la pared D. su terreno pues se están acercando la temporada D. lluvias en la ciudad del Cusco. 

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Maria Jesusa is 54 years old, and she lives in the beautiful city of Cusco, Peru.  She has been a member for some time with the communal bank "Patron D. San Sebastian" with Arariwa microfinance.  Maria Jesusa has 4 children and considers herself hard-working and entrepreneurial; she is also a housewife and cares for her grandson.

Maria Jesusa hopes to receive her $300 USD loan to purchase tiling to enclose a wall on her property; rain season in Cusco is approaching.

As a member she finds herself appreciative of the opportunity offered through this medium, therefore she comits to making her payments on schedule.

loans.use: Purchase tiling

loans.name: Lucio

texts.es:
Lucio tiene 30 años, es casado, tiene un hijo, vive en la ciudad hermosa del Cusco, Perú y desde hace mucho tiempo que participa en el banco comunal “Patrón de San Sebastián” de la Unidad de Micro finanzas Arariwa. Lucio es un padre trabajador y emprendedor que se dedica a brindar servicios de seguridad. Lucio trabaja en el Seguro Social de Salud (EsSalud, Hospital Nacional Adolfo Guevara Velasco) como guardia de seguridad.  
     
Lucio con su próximo préstamo que espera recibir de $ 300 USD, él invertirá para aumentar sus ahorros.   

El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Lucio is 30 years old.  He is married and has one child.  He lives in the beautiful city of Cusco, Peru and has been a member of Arariwa's “Patrón de San Sebastián” community bank for a long time.  Lucio is a hard-working and enterprising father who offers security services.  Lucio works for the national Social Security Health Service (EsSalud, Adolfo Guevara Velasco National Hospital).  He works as a security guard.

Lucio plans to use his loan for $300USD to increase his savings.

He is grateful for the opportunity which he is being offered with this loan and he pledges to make his repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To increase his savings

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
Ana vive en la ciudad hermosa del Cusco, Perú y desD. hace mucho tiempo que participa en el banco comunal “Patrón D. San Sebastián” D. la Unidad D. Micro finanzas Arariwa. Ana tiene 4 hijos y se considera una madre trabajadora y emprendedora, ella tiene un pequeño negocio que consiste en vender ropa para niños y bebes.
     
Ana con su próximo préstamo que espera recibir D. $ 700 USD, ella invertirá el dinero para aumentar el capital del negocio y desea comprar más ropas como por ejemplo compras, pantalones, casacas para bebes y niños. 

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Ana lives in the beautiful city of Cusco, Peru and has been a member of Arariwa's “Patrón D. San Sebastián” community bank for a long time.  Ana has 4 children and considers herself to be a hard-working and enterprising mother.  She has a small business selling clothes for children and babies.

Ana plans to use her loan for $700 USD to increase her business capital.  She would like to buy more clothes such as sweaters, pants and jackets for children and babies.

She is grateful for the opportunity which she is being offered with this loan and she pledges to make her repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To buy more clothes such as sweaters, pants and jackets for babies and children

loans.name: Rita

texts.es:
Rita tiene 38 años, vive en la ciudad hermosa del Cusco, Perú y desde hace mucho tiempo que participa en el banco comunal “Patrón de San Sebastián” de la Unidad de Micro finanzas Arariwa. Rita tiene 2 hijos y se considera una madre trabajadora y emprendedora, ella es enfermera y brinda servicios de salud. Rita y su esposo tienen un negocio familiar que consiste en la venta de joyería.  
     
Rita con su próximo préstamo que espera recibir de $ 400 USD, ella invertirá el dinero para aumentar el capital del negocio y desea comprar más joyería como por ejemplo aretes, pulseras, aretes y muchas cosas más.
 
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Rita is 38 years old and lives in the beautiful city of Cusco, Peru.  She has been a member of Arariwa's “Patrón de San Sebastián” community bank for a long time.  Rita has 2 children and she considers herself a hard-working and enterprising mother.  She is a nurse and provides health services.  Rita and her husband have a family business where they sell jewelry.

Rita plans to use her loan for $400 USD to increase her business capital.  She would like to buy more jewelry such as earrings, bracelets, etc.

She is grateful for the opportunity which she is being offered with this loan and she pledges to make her repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To buy more jewelry such as earrings, bracelets, etc.

loans.name: Shalom Isabel

texts.es:
Shalom Isabel tiene 22 años y vive en la ciudad del Cusco, ella desde hace mucho tiempo que participa en el banco comunal “Patrón de San Sebastián” de la Unidad de Micro finanzas Arariwa. Shalom Isabel es conviviente y tiene un hijo, ella es una madre joven, trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia, ella tiene un pequeño negocio que consiste en ofrecer productos de belleza por medio de catálogos de marcas conocidas a sus amigas, vecinos, conocidos y familiares. Sus clientes  escogen los productos que va a comprar al crédito y después de un mes pagan el total o en partes el valor del producto.
 
Shalom Isabel con su próximo préstamo que espera recibir de $300 USD, ella invertirá el dinero para aumentar el capital del negocio y desea comprar de la línea de cosméticos perfumes, aretes, collares, colonias, etc. 

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Shalom Isabel is 22 years old and lives in the beautiful city of Cusco, Peru.  She has been a member of Arariwa's “Patrón de San Sebastián” community bank for a long time.  Shalom Isabel lives with her partner and has one child.  She is a young, hard-working and enterprising mother who is working hard to get her family ahead.  She has a small business offering brand-name beauty products through catalogs to her friends, neighbors, acquaintances and family members.  Her customers choose the products they want to buy on credit and, after a month, they pay all or part of the value of the product.
